original: thugs mi ches par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: thugs mi ches par mi 'gyur te /
translated: He does not become displeased.

original: 'di ni dran pa nye bar bzhag pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dran pa nye bar bzhag pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second application of mindfulness.

original: kha cig rna blags te gus par nyan cing bka' nyan pa'i sems nye bar 'jog la /
analyzed: kha cig rna blags te gus par nyan cing bka' nyan pa'i sems nye bar 'jog la /
translated: Some people listen with their ears open and set their minds on obeying.

original: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos la nan tan du byed /🔽kha cig ni rna mi blag /
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos la nan tan du byed / kha cig ni rna mi blag /
translated: They practice the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma.🔽Some people do not listen with their ears open.

original: gus par mi nyan cing bka' nyan pa'i sems nye bar mi 'jog la /🔽chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos la nan tan mi byed na'ang des de bzhin gshegs pa dgyes pa'am /
analyzed: gus par mi nyan cing bka' nyan pa'i sems nye bar mi 'jog la / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos la nan tan mi byed na'ang des de bzhin gshegs pa dgyes pa'am /
translated: They do not set their minds on obeying.🔽They do not practice the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma.

original: kun nas mnar sems gnyis su mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun nas mnar sems gnyis su mi 'gyur te /
translated: But the Tathāgata does not become pleased or displeased.

original: thams cad du dran pa dang ldan zhing mkhyen bzhin du btang snyoms su gnas pa 'di ni dran pa nye bar bzhag pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad du dran pa dang ldan zhing mkhyen bzhin du btang snyoms su gnas pa 'di ni dran pa nye bar bzhag pa gsum pa'o //
translated: He is always mindful and aware, and remains equanimous. This is the third application of mindfulness.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the Tathāgata’s nature of being free from forgetfulness?

original: gang gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams don yod pa'i chos ston pa'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi don mdzad pa la dus las mi yol ba ste /
analyzed: gang gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams don yod pa'i chos ston pa'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi don mdzad pa la dus las mi yol ba ste /
translated: It is the fact that the Lord Buddhas, in order to teach the Dharma without fail, do not delay in acting for the welfare of all sentient beings.🔽This is called the “nature of non-forgetfulness.

original: 'di ni bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the nature of non-forgetfulness.🔽🔽

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i bag chags kyi sgrib pa spangs pa gang zhe na /🔽nyan @120b thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad ni /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i bag chags kyi sgrib pa spangs pa gang zhe na / nyan @120b thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad ni /
translated: What is the Tathāgata’s elimination of the propensities?

original: nyon mongs pa rnams spangs kyang de dag la lus kyi 'gyur ba dag 'byung gi /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams spangs kyang de dag la lus kyi 'gyur ba dag 'byung gi /
translated: Even though all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas have eliminated the afflictions, their bodies still undergo changes.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni de dag mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni de dag mi mnga' ste /
translated: But the Tathāgata has none of that.

original: de ni bag chags kyi sgrib pa spangs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni bag chags kyi sgrib pa spangs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the “elimination of the propensities.🔽”

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the Tathāgata’s great compassion?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po gang dang ldan pas 'jig rten gyi brda nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po gang dang ldan pas 'jig rten gyi brda nye bar bzung ste /
translated: It is the great compassion of the Tathāgata, endowed with which he takes up the conventional expressions of the world.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba la gzigs pa'i phyir dus thams cad du nyin lan gsum /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba la gzigs pa'i phyir dus thams cad du nyin lan gsum /
translated: In order to see the roots of virtue, three times a day.🔽

original: mtshan lan gsum 'jig rten la rtog pa mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan lan gsum 'jig rten la rtog pa mdzad pa ste /
translated: In order to see the roots of virtue, he looks at the world three times each day and three times each night.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thugs rje chen po sems can mtha' yas pa yongs su smin par bya ba la gzigs pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thugs rje chen po sems can mtha' yas pa yongs su smin par bya ba la gzigs pa /
translated: This is the great compassion of the Lord Buddhas, which is always present and looks to ripen the infinite number of sentient beings.

original: rtag tu 'byung ba 'di ni thugs rje chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtag tu 'byung ba 'di ni thugs rje chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called great compassion.

original: rab 'byor / de la sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de la sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: Subhūti, what are the eighteen dharmas exclusive to a Buddha?

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du bar der de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa med pa dang / ca co med pa dang / bsnyel ba med pa dang / sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa med pa dang /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du bar der de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa med pa dang / ca co med pa dang / bsnyel ba med pa dang / sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa med pa dang /
translated: From the time of the generation of the initial thought of enlightenment until the full realization of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, the Tathāgata is free of error, free of incoherent speech, free of forgetfulness, free of uncollectedness of mind, free of the differentiation of various notions, free of the indifference of non-discrimination, and free of the diminution of vigor.

original: tha dad pa'i 'du shes med pa dang / so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms med pa dang / 'dun pa nyams pa med pa dang / brtson 'grus nyams pa med pa dang / dran pa nyams pa med pa dang / ting nge 'dzin nyams pa med pa dang /🔽shes rab nyams pa med pa dang / rnam par grol ba nyams pa med pa dang / lus kyi @121a *//
analyzed: tha dad pa'i 'du shes med pa dang / so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms med pa dang / 'dun pa nyams pa med pa dang / brtson 'grus nyams pa med pa dang / dran pa nyams pa med pa dang / ting nge 'dzin nyams pa med pa dang / shes rab nyams pa med pa dang / rnam par grol ba nyams pa med pa dang / lus kyi @121a *//
translated: It is to be without the perception of difference. It is to be without indifference that is not discernment. It is to be without the decline of aspiration. It is to be without the decline of diligence. It is to be without the decline of mindfulness. It is to be without the decline of absorption.

original: las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / ngag gi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / yid kyi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang /
analyzed: las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / ngag gi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / yid kyi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang /
translated: It is to be without the decline of insight. It is to be without the decline of liberation. It is to have all physical actions preceded by and following after wisdom. It is to have all verbal actions preceded by and following after wisdom. It is to have all mental actions preceded by and following after wisdom.

original: 'das pa'i dus la ma chags /
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus la ma chags /
translated: It is to be unattached to the past.

original: ma thogs pa'i ye shes mthong ba 'jug pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus la ma chags /
analyzed: ma thogs pa'i ye shes mthong ba 'jug pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus la ma chags /
translated: It is to engage in the vision of unobstructed wisdom. It is to be unattached to the future.

original: ma thogs pa'i ye shes mthong ba 'jug pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus la ma chags /
analyzed: ma thogs pa'i ye shes mthong ba 'jug pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus la ma chags /
translated: the vision of unhindered wisdom penetrates the future,

original: ma thogs pa'i ye shes mthong ba 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: ma thogs pa'i ye shes mthong ba 'jug pa ste /
translated: and the vision of unhindered wisdom penetrates the present.

original: de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ces bya'o //
translated: These are called the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, what is the tathāgatas’ knowledge of all aspects?

original: gang gi dmigs pa ni dngos po med pa; dbang byed pa ni dran pa /
analyzed: gang gi dmigs pa ni dngos po med pa; dbang byed pa ni dran pa /
translated: Its object is non-entity, its power is mindfulness,

original: rnam pa ni zhi ba /
analyzed: rnam pa ni zhi ba /
translated: its aspect is peace,

original: mtshan nyid ni mtshan nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni mtshan nyid med pa ste /
translated: and its characteristic is the absence of characteristics.

original: 'di ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor / de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, what are the tathāgatas’ thirty-two marks of a great person?

original: phyag dang zhabs kyi mthil 'khor lo'i mtshan dang ldan pa dang / zhabs shin tu gnas pa dang / phyag dang zhabs dra bas 'brel ba dang / phyag dang zhabs 'jam zhing gzhon sha chags pa dang / bdun mtho ba dang / sor mo ring ba dang /🔽rting pa yangs pa dang / sku che zhing drang ba dang / zhabs la @121b 'bar 'bur med pa dang / sku'i spu gyen du phyogs pa dang / byin pa ri dvags ae na ya'i lta bu dang / phyag sbom zhing ring ba dang / 'doms kyi sba ba sbubs su nub pa dang /
analyzed: phyag dang zhabs kyi mthil 'khor lo'i mtshan dang ldan pa dang / zhabs shin tu gnas pa dang / phyag dang zhabs dra bas 'brel ba dang / phyag dang zhabs 'jam zhing gzhon sha chags pa dang / bdun mtho ba dang / sor mo ring ba dang / rting pa yangs pa dang / sku che zhing drang ba dang / zhabs la @121b 'bar 'bur med pa dang / sku'i spu gyen du phyogs pa dang / byin pa ri dvags ae na ya'i lta bu dang / phyag sbom zhing ring ba dang / 'doms kyi sba ba sbubs su nub pa dang /
translated: The soles of his hands and feet are marked with wheels, his feet are well-planted, his hands and feet are webbed, his hands and feet are soft and youthful, he has seven elevated areas, long fingers,🔽broad heels, a large and straight body, feet without depressions, body hair that points upward, calves like the enaya deer, long and thick arms, a sexual organ that is concealed in a sheath,

original: mdog gser 'dra ba dang / pags pa srab pa dang / spu re re nas skye zhing g-yas su 'khyil ba dang / zhal la mdzod spu'i mtshan mnga' ba dang / ro stod sengge'i 'dra ba dang / dpung mgo legs par grub pa dang / thal gong rgyas pa dang /
analyzed: mdog gser 'dra ba dang / pags pa srab pa dang / spu re re nas skye zhing g-yas su 'khyil ba dang / zhal la mdzod spu'i mtshan mnga' ba dang / ro stod sengge'i 'dra ba dang / dpung mgo legs par grub pa dang / thal gong rgyas pa dang /
translated: a golden complexion, thin skin, hair that grows singly and curls to the right, a hair-circle between the eyebrows, a lion-like upper body, well-developed shoulders, broad chest,

original: ro bro ba mkhyen pa dang / shing n+ya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab pa dang / dbu gtsug tor dang ldan pa dang / ljags ring zhing srab pa dang / tshangs pa'i dbyangs dang / 'gram pa sengge'i lta bu dang / tshems shin tu dkar ba dang /
analyzed: ro bro ba mkhyen pa dang / shing n+ya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab pa dang / dbu gtsug tor dang ldan pa dang / ljags ring zhing srab pa dang / tshangs pa'i dbyangs dang / 'gram pa sengge'i lta bu dang / tshems shin tu dkar ba dang /
translated: and his teeth are very white.🔽His teeth are even,🔽well-aligned,🔽and forty in number.

original: tshems mnyam pa dang / tshems thags bzang ba dang / tshems bzhi bcu mnga' ba dang / spyan mthon mthing dang / ba'i rdzi ma lta bu rnams so //
analyzed: tshems mnyam pa dang / tshems thags bzang ba dang / tshems bzhi bcu mnga' ba dang / spyan mthon mthing dang / ba'i rdzi ma lta bu rnams so //
translated: His eyes are deep blue,🔽and his eyelashes are like those of an ox.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyag dang zhabs kyi mthil dag la 'khor lo rtsibs stong dang ldan pa mu khyud can lte ba dang bcas pa /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyag dang zhabs kyi mthil dag la 'khor lo rtsibs stong dang ldan pa mu khyud can lte ba dang bcas pa /
translated: The palms of his hands and the soles of his feet are marked with wheels that have a thousand spokes, with rims and hubs,

original: rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa /
translated: complete in every way.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽dper na / rus pa'am /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / dper na / rus pa'am /
translated: They are like🔽the designs carved on bone or ivory.

original: ba so la gzugs su brkos pa lta bu dag mnga' bas na phyag dang zhabs 'khor lo'i mtshan dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: ba so la gzugs su brkos pa lta bu dag mnga' bas na phyag dang zhabs 'khor lo'i mtshan dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he is endowed with the mark of having the soles of his feet and palms marked with wheels.

original: zhabs kyi mthil gnyis mnyam par sa la 'jog cing zhabs zhum pa med pas na zhabs shin tu gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: zhabs kyi mthil gnyis mnyam par sa la 'jog cing zhabs zhum pa med pas na zhabs shin tu gnas pa yin no //
translated: His feet are well-planted because he places his feet evenly on the ground and his feet are not sunken.

original: dang pa'i rgyal po ltar phyag dang zhabs kyi sor mo dra bas 'brel bas na phyag @122a *//🔽dang zhabs dra bas 'brel ba yin no //
analyzed: dang pa'i rgyal po ltar phyag dang zhabs kyi sor mo dra bas 'brel bas na phyag @122a *// dang zhabs dra bas 'brel ba yin no //
translated: His hands and feet are webbed like a king goose.

original: shing bal gyi 'dab ma ltar phyag dang zhabs 'jam zhing gzhon sha chags la snying bas na phyag dang zhabs gzhon sha chags pa yin no //
analyzed: shing bal gyi 'dab ma ltar phyag dang zhabs 'jam zhing gzhon sha chags la snying bas na phyag dang zhabs gzhon sha chags pa yin no //
translated: His hands and feet are soft and youthful like cotton because they are soft and youthful like cotton.

original: phyag dang zhabs kyi bol gnyis dang / dpung mgo gnyis dang / ltag pa'i phyogs mtho bas na bdun mtho ba yin no //
analyzed: phyag dang zhabs kyi bol gnyis dang / dpung mgo gnyis dang / ltag pa'i phyogs mtho bas na bdun mtho ba yin no //
translated: His two ankles, two shoulders, and the back of his neck are prominent, so he has seven prominent body parts.

original: phyag dang zhabs kyi sor mo ring bas na sor mo ring ba yin no //
analyzed: phyag dang zhabs kyi sor mo ring bas na sor mo ring ba yin no //
translated: His fingers and toes are long.

original: zhabs kyi rting pa che bas na rting pa yangs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhabs kyi rting pa che bas na rting pa yangs pa yin no //
translated: His heels are broad.

original: khru bdun du 'phags par mtho zhing sku mi yo bas na sku che zhing drang ba yin no //
analyzed: khru bdun du 'phags par mtho zhing sku mi yo bas na sku che zhing drang ba yin no //
translated: His body is tall and straight, rising seven cubits and not bending.

original: pus mo'i lha nga dang / long bu shin tu mi mngon pas na zhabs 'bar 'bur med pa yin no //
analyzed: pus mo'i lha nga dang / long bu shin tu mi mngon pas na zhabs 'bar 'bur med pa yin no //
translated: His ankles are not prominent because his knees and his feet are very well-rounded.

original: spu g-yas phyogs su zlum por 'khyil cing gyen du phyogs pas na sku'i su gyen du phyogs pa yin no //
analyzed: spu g-yas phyogs su zlum por 'khyil cing gyen du phyogs pas na sku'i su gyen du phyogs pa yin no //
translated: His body-hairs point upward because they are curled to the right and stand erect.

original: byin pa ri dvags ae na ya'i byin pa dang / mda' rgyu'i snying po ltar byin gyis zlum pas na byin pa ri dvags ae na ya'i lta bu yin no //
analyzed: byin pa ri dvags ae na ya'i byin pa dang / mda' rgyu'i snying po ltar byin gyis zlum pas na byin pa ri dvags ae na ya'i lta bu yin no //
translated: His calves are like those of the Ena deer and are round like the Avaḍāma gem because his calves are well-rounded.

original: phyag sbom zhing ring ba'i phyir ma btud kyang phyag gis pus mo slebs pas na phyag sbom zhing ring ba yin no //
analyzed: phyag sbom zhing ring ba'i phyir ma btud kyang phyag gis pus mo slebs pas na phyag sbom zhing ring ba yin no //
translated: His arms are long and massive because his hands reach his knees even when he is not bending over.🔽His sexual organ is enclosed in a sheath because it is very well-hidden like that of a horse or elephant.

original: glang po che dang rta cang shes ltar gsang ba'i mtshan shin tu mdzes par sbubs su nub pas na 'doms kyi spa ba sbubs su nub pa yin no; ;gser shin tu sbyangs pa'i mdog 'dra bas na mdog gser 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: glang po che dang rta cang shes ltar gsang ba'i mtshan shin tu mdzes par sbubs su nub pas na 'doms kyi spa ba sbubs su nub pa yin no; ;gser shin tu sbyangs pa'i mdog 'dra bas na mdog gser 'dra ba yin no //
translated: His skin is golden colored because it is the color of well-refined gold.

original: pags pa gser dang dngul shin tu sbyangs pa ltar 'jam zhing sku la rdul gyis mi gos pas na pags @122b pa srab pa yin no //
analyzed: pags pa gser dang dngul shin tu sbyangs pa ltar 'jam zhing sku la rdul gyis mi gos pas na pags @122b pa srab pa yin no //
translated: His skin is smooth, like well-refined gold, and dust does not stick to his body.

original: spu shin tu 'byes shing gcig tu gnyis ma yin pas na spu re re nas skye zhing g-yas su 'khyil ba yin no //
analyzed: spu shin tu 'byes shing gcig tu gnyis ma yin pas na spu re re nas skye zhing g-yas su 'khyil ba yin no //
translated: His body hair is distinct, not mixed, and each hair grows singly and curls to the right.

original: me tog kunda dang / zla ba dang / ba'i 'o ma dang / ba mo'i mdog ltar dkar zhing /
analyzed: me tog kunda dang / zla ba dang / ba'i 'o ma dang / ba mo'i mdog ltar dkar zhing /
translated: His skin is white, like the color of jasmine flowers, the moon, milk, or snow.

original: nyi ma dang zla ba brgya bas kyang shin tu 'phags par 'od gsal ba'i mdzod spus smin mtshams legs par brgyan pas na zhal la mdzod spu'i mtshan mnga' ba yin no //
analyzed: nyi ma dang zla ba brgya bas kyang shin tu 'phags par 'od gsal ba'i mdzod spus smin mtshams legs par brgyan pas na zhal la mdzod spu'i mtshan mnga' ba yin no //
translated: His forehead is well-adorned with a hair-tuft that is brighter than a hundred suns and moons.

original: sku'i stod 'phel ka che bas na ro stod sengge'i 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: sku'i stod 'phel ka che bas na ro stod sengge'i 'dra ba yin no //
translated: His upper body is broad, like that of a lion.

original: dpung mgo zlum zhing phya ler 'dug pas na dpung mgo legs par grub pa yin no //
analyzed: dpung mgo zlum zhing phya ler 'dug pas na dpung mgo legs par grub pa yin no //
translated: His shoulders are round and full.

original: gser gyi glegs ma shin tu rnam par phyis pa lta bus mthong ka shin tu rgyas pas na thal gong rgyas pa yin no //
analyzed: gser gyi glegs ma shin tu rnam par phyis pa lta bus mthong ka shin tu rgyas pas na thal gong rgyas pa yin no //
translated: His shoulders are broad because his chest is very broad, like a very well-polished golden plate.

original: ljags rlung dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan gyis nyams pa mi mnga' zhing /
analyzed: ljags rlung dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan gyis nyams pa mi mnga' zhing /
translated: His tongue is not impaired by wind, bile, or phlegm.

original: ro thams cad so sor rnam par rig pa dang mthun par rnam par shes pas na re bro ba mkhyen pa yin no //
analyzed: ro thams cad so sor rnam par rig pa dang mthun par rnam par shes pas na re bro ba mkhyen pa yin no //
translated: He knows the taste of all tastes because he is conscious of each taste as it is.

original: sku'i khrun dang / 'dom gyi tshad du mnyam pas na shing n+ya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab pa yin no //🔽dbu'i gtsug tor zlum zhing lham la g-yas su 'khyil ba dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: sku'i khrun dang / 'dom gyi tshad du mnyam pas na shing n+ya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab pa yin no // dbu'i gtsug tor zlum zhing lham la g-yas su 'khyil ba dang ldan zhing /
translated: His body is the same in height and width, like a nyagrodha tree.🔽His head is round and smooth, with a crown protrusion that curls to the right.

original: dbu legs par grub cing lta na sdug pas na dbu gtsug tor dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: dbu legs par grub cing lta na sdug pas na dbu gtsug tor dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: His head is well-formed and beautiful to behold.

original: autpal dmar po'i 'dab ma'i mdog 'dra zhing yangs pas na ljags ring zhing srab pa yin no //
analyzed: autpal dmar po'i 'dab ma'i mdog 'dra zhing yangs pas na ljags ring zhing srab pa yin no //
translated: His tongue is long and slender, the color of a red lotus petal.

original: dbyig gi snying po dang / bya ka la pingka lta bu'i gsung mnga' bas na tshangs pa'i dbyangs yin no //
analyzed: dbyig gi snying po dang / bya ka la pingka lta bu'i gsung mnga' bas na tshangs pa'i dbyangs yin no //
translated: His voice is like the sound of a kalaviṅka bird and a lute, so he has the voice of Brahmā.

original: me long gi dkyil 'khor ltar @123a *//🔽shin tu legs par grub cing zlum la rgyas shing lta na sdug la mkhrang bas na 'gram pa sengge'i lta bu yin no //
analyzed: me long gi dkyil 'khor ltar @123a *// shin tu legs par grub cing zlum la rgyas shing lta na sdug la mkhrang bas na 'gram pa sengge'i lta bu yin no //
translated: His face is like a full moon,🔽His cheeks are like the full moon,

original: me tog kunda dang / zla ba dang / dung gi bcag 'phro ltar shin tu dkar ba'i tshems mnga' bas na tshems shin tu dkar ba yin no //
analyzed: me tog kunda dang / zla ba dang / dung gi bcag 'phro ltar shin tu dkar ba'i tshems mnga' bas na tshems shin tu dkar ba yin no //
translated: His teeth are very white, like jasmine flowers, the moon, and a conch shell, so he has very white teeth.

original: tshems mtho dman med pas na tshems mnyam pa yin no //
analyzed: tshems mtho dman med pas na tshems mnyam pa yin no //
translated: His teeth are even, so he has even teeth.

original: tshems mtshams ma dod pas na tshems thags bzang ba yin no //
analyzed: tshems mtshams ma dod pas na tshems thags bzang ba yin no //
translated: His teeth are not crooked, so he has teeth without gaps.

original: tshems bla 'og lhag chad med cing mnyam pas na tshems bzhi bcu mnga' ba yin no //
analyzed: tshems bla 'og lhag chad med cing mnyam pas na tshems bzhi bcu mnga' ba yin no //
translated: He has forty teeth, with no extra or missing teeth.

original: dkar gang gi phyogs ma 'dres shing shin tu rnam par dag la /
analyzed: dkar gang gi phyogs ma 'dres shing shin tu rnam par dag la /
translated: His eyes are deep blue, with no admixture of white, and very pure,

original: dmar po'i rgyun dang ma 'brel bas na spyan mthon mthing yin no //
analyzed: dmar po'i rgyun dang ma 'brel bas na spyan mthon mthing yin no //
translated: and not connected with red veins, so he has deep blue eyes.

original: spyan gyi rdzi ma bla 'og legs par gzhol zhing ma 'dzings pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan gyi rdzi ma ni ba'i rdzi ma lta bu yin no //
analyzed: spyan gyi rdzi ma bla 'og legs par gzhol zhing ma 'dzings pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan gyi rdzi ma ni ba'i rdzi ma lta bu yin no //
translated: The eyelashes of the Tathāgata are like those of a cow, because he has never cast down his eyes in order to despise anyone.

original: de la bla ma rnams la bsu bskyal dang / chos nyan pa dang / me tog phreng 'bul ba dang / gtsug lag khang dang / mchod rten la sogs pa'i gan du 'gro ba dang / g-yog 'khor gyi sbyin pa byas pas na phyag dang zhabs kyi mthil 'khor lo'i mtshan dang ldan par gyur te /
analyzed: de la bla ma rnams la bsu bskyal dang / chos nyan pa dang / me tog phreng 'bul ba dang / gtsug lag khang dang / mchod rten la sogs pa'i gan du 'gro ba dang / g-yog 'khor gyi sbyin pa byas pas na phyag dang zhabs kyi mthil 'khor lo'i mtshan dang ldan par gyur te /
translated: He has the mark of having soles and palms marked with wheels, because he has served his teachers, listened to the Dharma, offered flower garlands, gone to the temples and stūpas, and given servants.

original: de ni g-yog 'khor shin tu mang ba'i snga ltas yin no //
analyzed: de ni g-yog 'khor shin tu mang ba'i snga ltas yin no //
translated: This is an auspicious sign of having a large retinue.

original: yi dam la brtan pas na zhabs shin tu gnas par gyur te /
analyzed: yi dam la brtan pas na zhabs shin tu gnas par gyur te /
translated: He has the mark of having feet with heels that are prominent, because he has been firm in his commitments.

original: de ni mi g-yo ba'i snga ltas yin no //
analyzed: de ni mi g-yo ba'i snga ltas yin no //
translated: This is an auspicious sign of being unshakable.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi po sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / don spyod pa dang / don mthun pa dag kun tu @123b bsten pas na phyag dang zhabs dra bas 'brel bar gyur te /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi po sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / don spyod pa dang / don mthun pa dag kun tu @123b bsten pas na phyag dang zhabs dra bas 'brel bar gyur te /
translated: By relying on the four means of gathering disciples—generosity, pleasant speech, purposeful behavior, and practicing what one preaches—one obtains the signs of having webbed fingers and toes.

original: de ni myur du 'du ba'i snga ltas yin no //
analyzed: de ni myur du 'du ba'i snga ltas yin no //
translated: These are the signs of being quick to gather disciples.

original: bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / bldag pa dang / bca' ba bsod pa dag gi sbyin pa byas pas na phyag dang zhabs 'jam zhing gzhon sha chags pa dang / bdun mtho bar gyur te /
analyzed: bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / bldag pa dang / bca' ba bsod pa dag gi sbyin pa byas pas na phyag dang zhabs 'jam zhing gzhon sha chags pa dang / bdun mtho bar gyur te /
translated: By giving good food and drink, chewable food and food to lick, one obtains the signs of having soft and youthful hands and feet and seven elevated areas.

original: de gnyis ni bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / bldag pa dang / bca' ba bsod pa dag 'thob pa'i snga ltas yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis ni bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / bldag pa dang / bca' ba bsod pa dag 'thob pa'i snga ltas yin no //
translated: These two are the signs of obtaining good food and drink, chewable food and food to lick.

original: gsad pa las thar bar byas pa dang / bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa byin pas srog gi rim gro byas pa dang / srog gcod pa spangs pa kun tu bsten pas na sor mo ring ba dang / rting pa yangs pa dang /
analyzed: gsad pa las thar bar byas pa dang / bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa byin pas srog gi rim gro byas pa dang / srog gcod pa spangs pa kun tu bsten pas na sor mo ring ba dang / rting pa yangs pa dang /
translated: By saving beings from being killed, by giving them food and drink, etc., by helping them with their livelihood, and by relying on the avoidance of killing, one obtains the signs of long fingers and toes and broad heels.

original: sku che zhing drang bar gyur te /
analyzed: sku che zhing drang bar gyur te /
translated: His body became large and straight.

original: de dag ni sku tshe ring ba'i snga ltas yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni sku tshe ring ba'i snga ltas yin no //
translated: These are the signs of his long life.

original: dge ba'i chos yang dag par blangs pa dang / bzung ba rnams mngon par spel cing yongs su 'grib par ma byas pas na zhabs 'bar 'bur med pa dang / sku'i spu gyen du phyogs par gyur te /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos yang dag par blangs pa dang / bzung ba rnams mngon par spel cing yongs su 'grib par ma byas pas na zhabs 'bar 'bur med pa dang / sku'i spu gyen du phyogs par gyur te /
translated: By taking up virtuous dharmas and by increasing and not diminishing those that have been taken up, he became one whose feet are without depressions and whose body hair points upward.

original: de gnyis ni chos yongs su mi nyams pa'i snga ltas yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis ni chos yongs su mi nyams pa'i snga ltas yin no //
translated: These two are the signs of his not diminishing the Dharma.

original: bzo'i las dang / rig pa'i gnas rnams gus par byas shing byin pa dang / blangs pas na byin pa ri dvags ae na ya'i lta bur gyur te /
analyzed: bzo'i las dang / rig pa'i gnas rnams gus par byas shing byin pa dang / blangs pas na byin pa ri dvags ae na ya'i lta bur gyur te /
translated: By respectfully giving and receiving the arts and sciences, he became one whose shanks are like those of the enaya deer.

original: de ni myur du 'dzin pa'i snga ltas yin no //
analyzed: de ni myur du 'dzin pa'i snga ltas yin no //
translated: This is the sign of his quick apprehension.

original: bdog cing yod pa'i nor bslangs na med ces mi zer zhing byin pas na phyag sbom zhing ring bar gyur te /
analyzed: bdog cing yod pa'i nor bslangs na med ces mi zer zhing byin pas na phyag sbom zhing ring bar gyur te /
translated: By giving when asked for wealth that he possessed, and not saying “I do not have it,” he became one whose hands are long and broad.

original: de ni dbang sbyin zhing 'dul bar byed pa'i snga ltas yin no //
analyzed: de ni dbang sbyin zhing 'dul bar byed pa'i snga ltas yin no //
translated: This is the sign of his giving power and subduing.

original: mdza' bshes dang / gnyen 'dab dang / @124a *//
analyzed: mdza' bshes dang / gnyen 'dab dang / @124a *//
translated: friends,🔽relatives,🔽

original: gnyen pa phan tshun 'brel ba dag gi dbyen ma byas shing /
analyzed: gnyen pa phan tshun 'brel ba dag gi dbyen ma byas shing /
translated: He did not cause division among friends, relatives, and kinsmen,🔽and he reconciled those who were divided.

original: bye bar gyur ba dag bsdums pa dang / tshangs par spyod pa yang dag par blangs pa dang / gsang ba'i tshig bsrungs pas na 'doms kyi sba ba sbubs su nub par gyur te /
analyzed: bye bar gyur ba dag bsdums pa dang / tshangs par spyod pa yang dag par blangs pa dang / gsang ba'i tshig bsrungs pas na 'doms kyi sba ba sbubs su nub par gyur te /
translated: He took up pure conduct and guarded the secret speech.

original: de ni sras mang ba'i snga ltas yin no //🔽stan dang / gos dang / bgo ba rnams dang / khang bzang dang / gzhal med khang dang / gnas bzang po dag gi sbyin pa byas pas na mdog gser 'dra ba dang / pags pa srab par gyur te /
analyzed: de ni sras mang ba'i snga ltas yin no // stan dang / gos dang / bgo ba rnams dang / khang bzang dang / gzhal med khang dang / gnas bzang po dag gi sbyin pa byas pas na mdog gser 'dra ba dang / pags pa srab par gyur te /
translated: These are the signs of having many sons.🔽He gave away seats, clothes, garments, palaces, celestial palaces, and fine dwellings.

original: de gnyis ni stan dang / gos dang / bgo ba rnams dang / khang bzang dang / gzhal med khang dang / gnas bzang po dag 'thob pa'i snga ltas yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis ni stan dang / gos dang / bgo ba rnams dang / khang bzang dang / gzhal med khang dang / gnas bzang po dag 'thob pa'i snga ltas yin no //
translated: These two are the signs of obtaining seats, clothes, garments, palaces, celestial palaces, and fine dwellings.

original: 'du 'dzi spangs pa dang / mkhan po dang / slob dpon dang / pha ma dang / phu nul sogs pa bla ma rnams ji ltar rigs pa'i gnas su bkod cing rim gro byas pa dang / sbyin pa byin pa dang / mgu bar byas pas na spu re re nas skye zhing g-yas su 'khyil ba dang /
analyzed: 'du 'dzi spangs pa dang / mkhan po dang / slob dpon dang / pha ma dang / phu nul sogs pa bla ma rnams ji ltar rigs pa'i gnas su bkod cing rim gro byas pa dang / sbyin pa byin pa dang / mgu bar byas pas na spu re re nas skye zhing g-yas su 'khyil ba dang /
translated: He placed his gurus—abbot, master, father, mother, brother, and so forth—in appropriate places and served them. He gave gifts and pleased them. Because of that, he was born with each body hair growing from its own follicle and curling to the right.

original: zhal la mdzod spu'i mtshan mnga' bar gyur te /
analyzed: zhal la mdzod spu'i mtshan mnga' bar gyur te /
translated: He was born with the sign of the ūrṇā hair between his eyebrows.

original: de gnyis ni zla med pa'i snga ltas yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis ni zla med pa'i snga ltas yin no //
translated: These two are signs of being without an equal.

original: mu cor mi smra zhing gzhan la mi smod pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / legs par smras pa la rjes su mthun par byed pa dang / sengge'i sgra dang mthun par smra bas na ro stod sengge'i 'dra ba dang / dpung mgo legs par grub par gyur te /
analyzed: mu cor mi smra zhing gzhan la mi smod pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / legs par smras pa la rjes su mthun par byed pa dang / sengge'i sgra dang mthun par smra bas na ro stod sengge'i 'dra ba dang / dpung mgo legs par grub par gyur te /
translated: He did not speak nonsense, did not criticize others, spoke pleasantly, agreed with those who spoke well, and spoke in a way that was consistent with the lion’s roar. Because of that, he was born with the torso of a lion and well-developed shoulders.

original: de gnyis ni mi choms pa'i snga @124b ltas yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis ni mi choms pa'i snga @124b ltas yin no //
translated: These two are signs of being invincible.

original: nad pa rnams la rtsi dang / g-yog 'khor dang / sman dang mthun pa'i kha zas sbyin zhing rim gro byas pas na thal gong rgyas pa dang / ro bro ba mkhyen par gyur te /
analyzed: nad pa rnams la rtsi dang / g-yog 'khor dang / sman dang mthun pa'i kha zas sbyin zhing rim gro byas pas na thal gong rgyas pa dang / ro bro ba mkhyen par gyur te /
translated: By giving medicine, attendants, and food suitable for the sick, and by serving them, he obtained the marks of full bust and knowing taste.

original: de gnyis ni gnod pa mi mnga' ba'i snga ltas yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis ni gnod pa mi mnga' ba'i snga ltas yin no //
translated: These two are omens of being free from harm.

original: kun dga' ra ba dang / 'dun sa dang / bsil khang dang / khron pa dang / bgrod dka' bar zam pa gdags pa dang / kha zas dang / me tog phreng dang / gtsug lag khang dang / 'dug gnas la sogs pa bya ba la thog mar 'gro zhing /
analyzed: kun dga' ra ba dang / 'dun sa dang / bsil khang dang / khron pa dang / bgrod dka' bar zam pa gdags pa dang / kha zas dang / me tog phreng dang / gtsug lag khang dang / 'dug gnas la sogs pa bya ba la thog mar 'gro zhing /
translated: By going first to make parks, assembly halls, rest houses, wells, bridges over difficult river crossings, food, flower garlands, temples, and dwellings, and so on,

original: gzhan dag kyang spro ba bskyed pa dang / gzhan dag la lhag par byin pas na shing n+ya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab pa dang / dbu gtsug tor dang ldan par gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang spro ba bskyed pa dang / gzhan dag la lhag par byin pas na shing n+ya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab pa dang / dbu gtsug tor dang ldan par gyur te /
translated: and by encouraging others and giving to others in excess, he obtained the marks of being covered like a banyan tree and having a crown protrusion.

original: de gnyis ni mnga' dbang chen po brnyes pa'i snga ltas yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis ni mnga' dbang chen po brnyes pa'i snga ltas yin no //
translated: These two are omens of obtaining great power.

original: yun ring po nas 'jam zhing snyan pa dang / mnyen pa'i tshig brjod pas na ljags ring zhing srab pa dang / tshangs pa'i dbyangs dang ldan par gyur te /
analyzed: yun ring po nas 'jam zhing snyan pa dang / mnyen pa'i tshig brjod pas na ljags ring zhing srab pa dang / tshangs pa'i dbyangs dang ldan par gyur te /
translated: Because for a long time he has spoken gentle, pleasant, and soft words, he has a long and slender tongue and a Brahmā-like voice.

original: de gnyis ni gsung gi lam yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i dbyangs brnyes pa'i snga ltas yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis ni gsung gi lam yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i dbyangs brnyes pa'i snga ltas yin no //
translated: These two are omens that he will attain the melodious Brahmā voice endowed with five features.

original: gsung gi lam yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i dbyangs ni /
analyzed: gsung gi lam yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i dbyangs ni /
translated: The melodious Brahmā voice endowed with five features is as follows:

original: kun tu shes par bya zhing rnam par rig par bya ba dang / mnyan par 'os shing mi mthun pa med pa dang / zab cing dbyangs rjes su 'byung ba dang / mi tshugs shing rnar snyan pa dang / ma 'khrugs shing gsal ba'o //
analyzed: kun tu shes par bya zhing rnam par rig par bya ba dang / mnyan par 'os shing mi mthun pa med pa dang / zab cing dbyangs rjes su 'byung ba dang / mi tshugs shing rnar snyan pa dang / ma 'khrugs shing gsal ba'o //
translated: It is to be understood and cognized, it is worthy of being listened to and free from discord, it is profound and follows the melody, it is unbreakable and pleasing to the ear, and it is undisturbed and clear.

original: yun ring po nas tshig bkyal pa spangs shing dus su smra bas na 'gram pa sengge'i lta bur gyur @125a *//
analyzed: yun ring po nas tshig bkyal pa spangs shing dus su smra bas na 'gram pa sengge'i lta bur gyur @125a *//
translated: Because for a long time he has abandoned idle talk and spoken at the right time, he has cheeks like a lion.

original: te; de ni tshig btsun pa'i snga ltas yin no //
analyzed: te; de ni tshig btsun pa'i snga ltas yin no //
translated: This is an omen of his being a person of noble speech.

original: rim gro byed pa dang / brnyas pa med pa dang / 'tsho ba yongs su dag pas tshems shin tu dkar ba dang / tshems mnyam par gyur te /
analyzed: rim gro byed pa dang / brnyas pa med pa dang / 'tsho ba yongs su dag pas tshems shin tu dkar ba dang / tshems mnyam par gyur te /
translated: His teeth are very white and even because he has served his parents, teachers, and the worthy ones, and has not despised or mistreated anyone.

original: de gnyis ni 'khor snga nas bsags pa'i snga ltas yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis ni 'khor snga nas bsags pa'i snga ltas yin no //
translated: These two are the signs that his retinue has been gathered from before.

original: yun ring po nas bden zhing phra ma mad par spyad pas na /
analyzed: yun ring po nas bden zhing phra ma mad par spyad pas na /
translated: His teeth are even because he has practiced the truth and not slander for a long time.

original: tshems thags bzang ba dang / tshems bzhi bcu mnga' bar gyur te /
analyzed: tshems thags bzang ba dang / tshems bzhi bcu mnga' bar gyur te /
translated: His teeth are forty in number and have no gaps because he has not spoken in haste.

original: de gnyis ni 'khor mi phyed pa'i snga ltas yin no //🔽khyud pa dang smod par byed pa la'ang chags pa dang sdang ba med cing /
analyzed: de gnyis ni 'khor mi phyed pa'i snga ltas yin no // khyud pa dang smod par byed pa la'ang chags pa dang sdang ba med cing /
translated: These two are the signs that his retinue is not divided.

original: rmongs pa med pa'i mig gis nges par rtogs pas na spyan mthon mthing dang / ba'i rdzi ma lta bur gyur te /
analyzed: rmongs pa med pa'i mig gis nges par rtogs pas na spyan mthon mthing dang / ba'i rdzi ma lta bur gyur te /
translated: His eyes are deep blue and his eyelashes are like those of a magnificent heifer because he has understood with undistracted eyes, without attachment or aversion, those who praise him and those who slander him.

original: de gnyis ni kun nas mdzes pa'i snga ltas yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis ni kun nas mdzes pa'i snga ltas yin no //
translated: These two are the signs of his all-around beauty.

original: rab 'byor / de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis yin te /
translated: Subhūti, these are the thirty-two marks of a great being of the tathāgatas.

original: de dag gis rang bzhin gyi 'od kyis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams dang / bzhed na 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa dag kyang snang bas khyab par mdzad do //
analyzed: de dag gis rang bzhin gyi 'od kyis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams dang / bzhed na 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa dag kyang snang bas khyab par mdzad do //
translated: Their natural radiance illuminates the trichiliocosm, and if they wish, they can illuminate countless worlds.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa sems can rnams la thugs brtse bas 'od 'dom gang tsam du byin gyis rlob par mdzad de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sems can rnams la thugs brtse bas 'od 'dom gang tsam du byin gyis rlob par mdzad de /
translated: The Thus-Gone One, out of compassion for sentient beings, manifests a fathom-wide light.

original: gal te bcom ldan 'das kyis 'od 'dom gang bar byin gyis ma brlabs su zin na /
analyzed: gal te bcom ldan 'das kyis 'od 'dom gang bar byin gyis ma brlabs su zin na /
translated: If the Blessed One did not bless the light to be a fathom wide,

original: rang bzhin gyi 'od kyis zil gyis gnon par gyur pas nyi ma dang zla ba dag gi 'od kyang mngon par mi 'gyur @125b la; zla ba dang / zla ba phyed dang / dus tshigs dang / lo khyud khor dag kyang yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi 'od kyis zil gyis gnon par gyur pas nyi ma dang zla ba dag gi 'od kyang mngon par mi 'gyur @125b la; zla ba dang / zla ba phyed dang / dus tshigs dang / lo khyud khor dag kyang yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the natural radiance would overpower it, and the light of the sun and moon would not be visible. There would be no months, fortnights, seasons, or years.

original: rang bzhin gyi sgra dbyangs kyis kyang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams mngon par go bar mdzad do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi sgra dbyangs kyis kyang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams mngon par go bar mdzad do //
translated: The natural sound of his voice is also heard throughout the trichiliocosm.

original: bzhed na gnyis dang / gsum dang / bzhi dang ji snyed du snang bas khyab par 'gyur ba de snyed du dbyangs kyis mngon par go bar yang mdzad do //
analyzed: bzhed na gnyis dang / gsum dang / bzhi dang ji snyed du snang bas khyab par 'gyur ba de snyed du dbyangs kyis mngon par go bar yang mdzad do //
translated: If he wishes, he can make himself understood by means of a single sound, by two, by three, by as many as there are sounds.

original: rab 'byor / de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu gang zhe na /
translated: Subhūti, what are the Tathāgata’s eighty minor marks?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mngon par 'du byed pa thams cad la ma chags pa'i thugs mnga' bas na sen mo zangs kyi mdog lta bu yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mngon par 'du byed pa thams cad la ma chags pa'i thugs mnga' bas na sen mo zangs kyi mdog lta bu yin no //
translated: The Blessed Buddhas have copper-colored nails because their minds are unattached to all volitional activities.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni gnyen 'dab la byams pa bzhin du sems can la phan pa dang / bde bar dgongs pa'i thugs mnga' bas na sen mo mdog snum pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni gnyen 'dab la byams pa bzhin du sems can la phan pa dang / bde bar dgongs pa'i thugs mnga' bas na sen mo mdog snum pa yin no //
translated: The Blessed Buddhas have glossy nails because they have minds that are intent on the welfare and happiness of sentient beings, like a relative who is affectionate.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rigs mtho ba'i rgyud du skyes pas na sen mo mtho ba yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rigs mtho ba'i rgyud du skyes pas na sen mo mtho ba yin no //
translated: The Blessed Buddhas have prominent nails because they are born into a high family lineage.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni tshul la kha na ma tho ba med pas na sor mo rnams zlum pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni tshul la kha na ma tho ba med pas na sor mo rnams zlum pa yin no //
translated: The fingers of the Blessed Buddhas are rounded, because their conduct is irreproachable.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rgya chen por bsags pas na sor mo rnams rgyas pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rgya chen por bsags pas na sor mo rnams rgyas pa yin no //
translated: The fingers of the Blessed Buddhas are tapering, because they have accumulated vast roots of virtue.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni dge ba'i rtsa ba dag rim gyis yang dag par bsgrubs pas na sor mo rnams byin gyis phra ba yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni dge ba'i rtsa ba dag rim gyis yang dag par bsgrubs pas na sor mo rnams byin gyis phra ba yin no //
translated: The fingers of the Blessed Buddhas are well-rounded, because they have gradually accomplished the roots of virtue.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das @126a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das @126a *//
translated: The Blessed Buddhas

original: rnams ni sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi 'phrin las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba dag shin tu dben pas na rtsa mi mngon pa yin no //
analyzed: rnams ni sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi 'phrin las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba dag shin tu dben pas na rtsa mi mngon pa yin no //
translated: have veins that are not prominent, because their physical, verbal, and mental activities and livelihood are very pure.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i mdud pa 'grol bar mdzad pas na rtsa mdud pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i mdud pa 'grol bar mdzad pas na rtsa mdud pa med pa yin no //
translated: The Blessed Buddhas have veins that are not knotted, because they untie the knots of the afflictions.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos kyi dgongs pa shin tu dben pas na long tshigs bu mi mngon pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos kyi dgongs pa shin tu dben pas na long tshigs bu mi mngon pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have very secluded intentions with regard to the Dharma, thus their ankles are not protruding.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mi mnyam pa thams cad las 'grol bar mdzad pas na zhabs mi mnyam pa med pa yin no //🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mi'i seng ge yin pas na sengge'i stabs su gshegs pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mi mnyam pa thams cad las 'grol bar mdzad pas na zhabs mi mnyam pa med pa yin no // sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mi'i seng ge yin pas na sengge'i stabs su gshegs pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, liberate from all unevenness, thus they have even feet.🔽The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are lions among men, thus they have the gait of a lion.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mi'i glang po che yin pas na glang po che'i stabs su gshegs pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mi'i glang po che yin pas na glang po che'i stabs su gshegs pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are elephants among men, thus they have the gait of an elephant.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni ngang pa'i rgyal po ltar nam mkha' la bzhud pas na ngang pa'i stabs su gshegs pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni ngang pa'i rgyal po ltar nam mkha' la bzhud pas na ngang pa'i stabs su gshegs pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, travel through the sky like the king of swans, thus they have the gait of a swan.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni skyes bu'i khyu mchog yin pas na khyu mchog gi stabs su gshegs pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni skyes bu'i khyu mchog yin pas na khyu mchog gi stabs su gshegs pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are the best of men, thus they have the gait of the best of men.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mthun pa'i lam mnga' bas na g-yas phyogs su ldog cing gshegs pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mthun pa'i lam mnga' bas na g-yas phyogs su ldog cing gshegs pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have a path that is in harmony with the world, and so they walk with their right side toward it.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni lta na mdzes pas na mdzes par gshegs pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni lta na mdzes pas na mdzes par gshegs pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are beautiful to behold, and so they walk beautifully.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das @126b rnams ni rtag tu thugs yon po mi mnga' bas na ma yo bar gshegs pa yin no //🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni tshul rnam par dag pa'i yon tan ston pas na sku khri la bag chags pa yin no //🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sdig pa'i chos rnams shin tu sbyangs pas na sku byi dor byas pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das @126b rnams ni rtag tu thugs yon po mi mnga' bas na ma yo bar gshegs pa yin no // sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni tshul rnam par dag pa'i yon tan ston pas na sku khri la bag chags pa yin no // sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sdig pa'i chos rnams shin tu sbyangs pas na sku byi dor byas pa lta bu yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are always without crooked thoughts, and so they walk without stooping.🔽The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, show the quality of pure conduct, and so their bodies are well-proportioned.🔽The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have thoroughly purified evil dharmas, and so their bodies are well-polished.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos rim gyis ston pas na sku rim par 'tsham pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos rim gyis ston pas na sku rim par 'tsham pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, teach the Dharma gradually, and so their bodies are well-formed.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sku dang gsung dang thugs shin tu gtsang bas na sku gtsang pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sku dang gsung dang thugs shin tu gtsang bas na sku gtsang pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have a pure body, speech, and mind, so they have a pure body.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rang bzhin gyis thugs 'jam pa dang ldan pas na sku 'jam pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rang bzhin gyis thugs 'jam pa dang ldan pas na sku 'jam pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have a naturally gentle mind, so they have a gentle body.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rang bzhin gyis thugs rnam par dag pas na sku rnam par dag pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rang bzhin gyis thugs rnam par dag pas na sku rnam par dag pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have a naturally pure mind, so they have a pure body.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos 'dul ba shin tu yongs su rdzogs pas na mtshan yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos 'dul ba shin tu yongs su rdzogs pas na mtshan yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have a perfectly complete Dharma and Vinaya, so they have complete marks.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni yangs shing mdzes pa'i yon tan gsung bas na sku kho lag yangs shing bzang ba yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni yangs shing mdzes pa'i yon tan gsung bas na sku kho lag yangs shing bzang ba yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, speak with a voice that is expansive and beautiful, so they have an expansive and beautiful body.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sems can thams cad la thugs mnyam pas na gom pa snyoms pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sems can thams cad la thugs mnyam pas na gom pa snyoms pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have an impartial mind towards all sentient beings, so they have an even gait.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni shin tu 'jam pa'i chos ston pas na sku shin tu gzhon mdog can @127a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni shin tu 'jam pa'i chos ston pas na sku shin tu gzhon mdog can @127a *//
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have very youthful bodies because they teach the very gentle Dharma.

original: yin no // sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rtag tu zhum pa med pa'i thugs mnga' bas na sku zhum pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: yin no // sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rtag tu zhum pa med pa'i thugs mnga' bas na sku zhum pa med pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have bodies that are not stooped because they always have an unbowed mind.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams byang bas na sku rgyas pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams byang bas na sku rgyas pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have bodies that are well-proportioned because they have eliminated the roots of non-virtue.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni yang 'byung ba'i srid par mtshams sbyor ba zad pas na sku shin tu grims pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni yang 'byung ba'i srid par mtshams sbyor ba zad pas na sku shin tu grims pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have bodies that are very firm because they have exhausted the linking of existence.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag dang nying lag rnams shin tu legs par ston pas na yan lag dang nying lag shin tu rnam par 'byes pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag dang nying lag rnams shin tu legs par ston pas na yan lag dang nying lag shin tu rnam par 'byes pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have limbs and fingers that are very well-separated because they teach the major and minor aspects of dependent origination very well.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni gzigs pa shin tu rnam par dag pas na gzigs pa rab rib med cing rnam par dag pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni gzigs pa shin tu rnam par dag pas na gzigs pa rab rib med cing rnam par dag pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have a very pure vision, and so their vision is unclouded and pure.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni tshul dang ldan pa'i slob ma mnga' bas na sku zlum pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni tshul dang ldan pa'i slob ma mnga' bas na sku zlum pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have a following of disciples who are well-behaved, and so their bodies are round.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'khor ba'i skyon rnams rab tu sbyangs pas na sku skabs phyin pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'khor ba'i skyon rnams rab tu sbyangs pas na sku skabs phyin pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have thoroughly purified the faults of cyclic existence, and so their bodies are well-proportioned.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni nga rgyal gyi rtse mo bcom pas na sku ma rnyongs pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni nga rgyal gyi rtse mo bcom pas na sku ma rnyongs pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have destroyed the peak of pride, and so their bodies are not stooped.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos zad par byed pa rnam par zlog pas na phyal phyang nge ba yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos zad par byed pa rnam par zlog pas na phyal phyang nge ba yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have turned away from the exhaustion of the Dharma, and so their bellies are not protruding.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos shin tu zab mo rnams thugs su chud pas na lte ba zab pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos shin tu zab mo rnams thugs su chud pas na lte ba zab pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have realized the very profound Dharma, and so their navels are deep.

original: @127b sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mthun par 'dzin par zhugs pa'i slob ma mnga' bas na lte ba g-yas phyogs su 'khyil ba yin no //
analyzed: @127b sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mthun par 'dzin par zhugs pa'i slob ma mnga' bas na lte ba g-yas phyogs su 'khyil ba yin no //
translated: The Blessed Buddhas have disciples who are harmonious, so their navels are deep.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni slob ma kun nas mdzes pa'i dge 'dun mnga' bas na kun nas mdzes pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni slob ma kun nas mdzes pa'i dge 'dun mnga' bas na kun nas mdzes pa yin no //
translated: The Blessed Buddhas have a Saṅgha of disciples who are all beautiful, so they are beautiful.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni thugs shin tu gtsang bas na kun spyod pa gtsang ba yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni thugs shin tu gtsang bas na kun spyod pa gtsang ba yin no //
translated: The Blessed Buddhas have very pure minds, so their conduct is pure.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos 'dul ba nag po ston pa dang bral bas na sku la sme ba dang gnag bag med pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos 'dul ba nag po ston pa dang bral bas na sku la sme ba dang gnag bag med pa yin no //
translated: The Blessed Buddhas teach a Dharma and Vinaya that is free from the teaching of the dark side, so their bodies are free from moles and blemishes.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni shing bal ltar yang ba'i lus thob par 'gyur ba'i chos ston pas na phyag shing bal ltar shin tu 'jam pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni shing bal ltar yang ba'i lus thob par 'gyur ba'i chos ston pas na phyag shing bal ltar shin tu 'jam pa yin no //
translated: The Blessed Buddhas teach the Dharma that leads to attaining a body that is light like cotton, so their hands are very soft like cotton.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni gnyen 'dab dang / skye bo phal po che la snyoms par byams pas dge sbyong chen po yin pas na phyag gi ri mo mdangs yod pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni gnyen 'dab dang / skye bo phal po che la snyoms par byams pas dge sbyong chen po yin pas na phyag gi ri mo mdangs yod pa yin no //
translated: The Bhagavat Buddhas are great ascetics, because they love equally all beings, friends and strangers.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni shin tu zab cing brtan par gnas pas na phyag gi ri mo zab pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni shin tu zab cing brtan par gnas pas na phyag gi ri mo zab pa yin no //
translated: The Bhagavat Buddhas have deep lines on the palms of their hands, because they are well-established in the profound and the stable.🔽The Bhagavat Buddhas have long lines on the palms of their hands, because they teach the Dharma of great patience.🔽The Bhagavat Buddhas do not have long faces, because they establish the bases of training that are not excessive.🔽The Bhagavat Buddhas have faces that are like the full moon, because they are endowed with the thirty-two marks.🔽The Bhagavat Buddhas have faces that are like the clear autumn moon, because they are endowed with the ten powers.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni bzod pa rgya chen po'i chos ston pas na phyag gi ri mo ring ba yin no; ;sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni ha cang phal che ba ma yin pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bas na zhal ha cang mi ring ba🔽yin no // sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams @128a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni bzod pa rgya chen po'i chos ston pas na phyag gi ri mo ring ba yin no; ;sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni ha cang phal che ba ma yin pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bas na zhal ha cang mi ring ba yin no // sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams @128a *//
translated: The Bhagavat Buddhas have faces that are like the clear autumn sun, because they are endowed with the four forms of fearlessness.🔽The Bhagavat Buddhas have faces that are like the king of mountains, because they are endowed with the four forms of unhindered knowledge.🔽The Bhagavat Buddhas have faces that are like the king of mountains, because they are endowed with the four forms of unhindered knowledge.🔽The Bhagavat Buddhas have faces that are like the king of mountains, because they are endowed with the four forms of unhindered knowledge.🔽The Bhagavat Buddhas have faces that are like the king of mountains, because they are endowed with the four forms of unhindered knowledge.🔽The Bhagavat Buddhas have faces that are like the king of mountains, because they are endowed with the four forms of unhindered knowledge.🔽The Bhagavat Buddhas have faces that are like the king of mountains, because they are endowed with the four forms of unhindered knowledge.🔽The Bhagavat Buddhas have faces that are like the king of mountains, because they are endowed with the four forms of unhindered knowledge.🔽The Bhagavat Buddhas have faces that are like the king of mountains, because they are endowed with the four forms of unhindered knowledge.🔽The Bhagavat Buddhas have faces that are like the king of mountains, because they are endowed with the four forms of unhindered knowledge.🔽The Bhagavat Buddhas have faces that are like the king of mountains, because they are endowed with the four forms of unhindered knowledge.

original: ni 'jig rten thams cad gzugs brnyan lta bur ston pas na zhal la gzugs kyi gzugs brnyan snang ba yin no //
analyzed: ni 'jig rten thams cad gzugs brnyan lta bur ston pas na zhal la gzugs kyi gzugs brnyan snang ba yin no //
translated: The Bhagavat Buddhas have faces that are like the king of mountains, because they are endowed with the four forms of unhindered knowledge.🔽The Bhagavat

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'jam pa sngon du gtong zhing 'dul bas na ljags gnyen pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'jam pa sngon du gtong zhing 'dul bas na ljags gnyen pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are gentle and patient, so their tongues are slender.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni yon tan cha phra ba'i chogs dang ldan pas na ljags srab pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni yon tan cha phra ba'i chogs dang ldan pas na ljags srab pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are endowed with a multitude of subtle qualities, so their tongues are slender.🔽The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, discipline those who are attached to childish things with a Dharma that is difficult to fathom, so their tongues are red.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni byis pa'i skye bo chags pa rnams la gting dpag dka' ba'i chos kyis 'dul bar mdzad pas na ljags dmar ba yin no; ;sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni glang po che'i nga ro dang / 'brug gi sgra lta bus bsnyengs pa mi mnga' bas na glang po che'i nga ro dang /🔽'brug gi sgra dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni byis pa'i skye bo chags pa rnams la gting dpag dka' ba'i chos kyis 'dul bar mdzad pas na ljags dmar ba yin no; ;sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni glang po che'i nga ro dang / 'brug gi sgra lta bus bsnyengs pa mi mnga' bas na glang po che'i nga ro dang / 'brug gi sgra dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are fearless with the voice of a bull and the sound of thunder, so they have the voice of a bull and the sound of thunder.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni snyan cing mnyes la 'jam par smra ba'i slob ma mnga' bas na gsung snyan cing mnyen la 'jam pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni snyan cing mnyes la 'jam par smra ba'i slob ma mnga' bas na gsung snyan cing mnyen la 'jam pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have disciples who are pleasant, agreeable, and gentle, so their speech is pleasant, agreeable, and gentle.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni srid pa'i kun tu sbyor ba las log pas na mche ba zlum pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni srid pa'i kun tu sbyor ba las log pas na mche ba zlum pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have round teeth because they have turned away from the fetters of existence.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni skye bo rnon po 'dul ba la mkhas pas na mche ba rno ba yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni skye bo rnon po 'dul ba la mkhas pas na mche ba rno ba yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have sharp teeth because they are skilled in subduing the sharp-toothed.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos 'dul ba mchog tu dkar bas na mche ba dkar ba yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos 'dul ba mchog tu dkar bas na mche ba dkar ba yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have white teeth because their Dharma and Vinaya is supremely white.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni cha mnyam pa'i @128b sa la bzhugs pas na mche ba mnyam pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni cha mnyam pa'i @128b sa la bzhugs pas na mche ba mnyam pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have even teeth because they dwell in the evenness of the four abodes of Brahma.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mngon par rtogs par rim gyis ston pas na mche ba byin gyis phra ba yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mngon par rtogs par rim gyis ston pas na mche ba byin gyis phra ba yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have teeth without gaps because they teach realization gradually.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni shes rab kyi ri mthon po la bzhugs pas na shangs mtho ba yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni shes rab kyi ri mthon po la bzhugs pas na shangs mtho ba yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have prominent noses because they dwell on the high mountain of wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'dul ba'i skye bo gtsang ma mnga' bas na shangs gtsang ba yin no //🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni gzigs pa rnam par dag pas na spyan rnam par dag pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'dul ba'i skye bo gtsang ma mnga' bas na shangs gtsang ba yin no // sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni gzigs pa rnam par dag pas na spyan rnam par dag pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have a straight nose, because they have a pure following of disciples.🔽The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have pure eyes, because their vision is pure.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi chos shin tu yangs pa dang ldan pas na spyan yangs pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi chos shin tu yangs pa dang ldan pas na spyan yangs pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have expansive eyes, because they possess the expansive qualities of the Buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sems can gyi tshogs shin tu bsags pas na rdzi ma stug pa yin no //🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni lha dang lha ma yin dang mi'i na chung mig dkar gnag 'byes shing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sems can gyi tshogs shin tu bsags pas na rdzi ma stug pa yin no // sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni lha dang lha ma yin dang mi'i na chung mig dkar gnag 'byes shing /
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have eyelashes like a cow, because they have accumulated a great multitude of sentient beings.

original: padma'i 'dab ma rangs pa lta bu dang ldan pa mchog rnams kyis mngon par dga' bar byas shing bstod pas na spyan dkar gnag 'byes shing padma'i 'dab ma rangs pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: padma'i 'dab ma rangs pa lta bu dang ldan pa mchog rnams kyis mngon par dga' bar byas shing bstod pas na spyan dkar gnag 'byes shing padma'i 'dab ma rangs pa lta bu yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have eyes like the petals of a blue lotus, because they are delighted and praised by the best of women, with eyes like the petals of a blue lotus, among the gods, asuras, and humans.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rtag tu yangs pa ston pas na smin tshugs ring ba yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rtag tu yangs pa ston pas na smin tshugs ring ba yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have long eyebrows, because they always teach the extensive Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'jam pos 'dul ba la mkhas pas na smin ma 'jam pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'jam pos 'dul ba la mkhas pas na smin ma 'jam pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have soft eyebrows, because they are skilled in taming with gentleness.

original: sangs @129a *// rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni kun nas skyon mkhyen pas na smin ma'i sbu mnyam pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs @129a *// rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni kun nas skyon mkhyen pas na smin ma'i sbu mnyam pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have eyebrows with equal hair, because they know the faults of all.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni dge ba'i rtsa ba'i snum gyis skye bo rgyud snum pa rnams 'dul bar mdzad pas na smin ma snum pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni dge ba'i rtsa ba'i snum gyis skye bo rgyud snum pa rnams 'dul bar mdzad pas na smin ma snum pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have oily eyebrows, because they tame those whose minds are oily with the oil of roots of virtue.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos mchog tu yangs pa ston pas na snyan shal stug cing ring ba yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos mchog tu yangs pa ston pas na snyan shal stug cing ring ba yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have thick and long earlobes, because they teach the most extensive Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i g-yul las rgyal bas na snyan mnyam pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i g-yul las rgyal bas na snyan mnyam pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have equal ears, because they are victorious over the battle of the afflictions.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sems kyi rgyud mnyam pa'i sems can 'dul bar mdzad pas na snyan gyi dbang po ma nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sems kyi rgyud mnyam pa'i sems can 'dul bar mdzad pas na snyan gyi dbang po ma nyams pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have unimpaired hearing, for they discipline those sentient beings whose mental continua are equal.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni lta bar gyur pa thams cad rnam par spangs pas na dpral ba legs par 'byes pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni lta bar gyur pa thams cad rnam par spangs pas na dpral ba legs par 'byes pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have well-shaped foreheads, for they have abandoned all views.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni dge sbyong dang / bram ze dang / phas kyi rgol ba rnams rab tu bcom pas na dpral ba dbyes che ba yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni dge sbyong dang / bram ze dang / phas kyi rgol ba rnams rab tu bcom pas na dpral ba dbyes che ba yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have broad foreheads, for they have thoroughly defeated all ascetics, brahmins, and adversaries.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni smon lam dam pa shin tu yongs su rdzogs pas na dbu shin tu rgyas pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni smon lam dam pa shin tu yongs su rdzogs pas na dbu shin tu rgyas pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have well-rounded heads, for they have fulfilled their excellent aspirations.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni yul la bong ba ltar dga' ba rnam par bzlog pas na dbu skra bung ba ltar gnag pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni yul la bong ba ltar dga' ba rnam par bzlog pas na dbu skra bung ba ltar gnag pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have hair as black as a bee, for they have turned away from delighting in objects like a dog.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mthong ba dang bsgom @129b pas srang bar bya ba'i bag la nyal rnams spangs pas na dbu skra stug pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mthong ba dang bsgom @129b pas srang bar bya ba'i bag la nyal rnams spangs pas na dbu skra stug pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have eliminated the latent tendencies that are to be eliminated by seeing and by cultivation, so their hair is thick.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni dgongs pa 'jam pas bstan pa'i snying po thugs su chud pas na dbu skra 'jam pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni dgongs pa 'jam pas bstan pa'i snying po thugs su chud pas na dbu skra 'jam pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have understood the essence of the teaching through their gentle intention, so their hair is smooth.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rtag tu ma 'khrugs pa'i thugs mnga' bas na dbu skra mi 'dzing ba yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rtag tu ma 'khrugs pa'i thugs mnga' bas na dbu skra mi 'dzing ba yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, always have an undisturbed mind, so their hair is untangled.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rtag tu mi brlang ba'i gsung mnga' bas na dbu skra mi bshor ba yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rtag tu mi brlang ba'i gsung mnga' bas na dbu skra mi bshor ba yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, always have a non-harsh voice, so their hair is unruffled.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni byang chub kyi yan lag gi spos kyi me tog gis skye bo rnams la mthun par sgrub pas na dbu skra dri zhim pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni byang chub kyi yan lag gi spos kyi me tog gis skye bo rnams la mthun par sgrub pas na dbu skra dri zhim pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, always benefit beings with the fragrant flowers of the factors of awakening, so their hair has a pleasant smell.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni phyag dang zhabs kyi mthil dpal be'u dang / bkra shis dang / g-yung drung 'khyil pas brgyan pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni phyag dang zhabs kyi mthil dpal be'u dang / bkra shis dang / g-yung drung 'khyil pas brgyan pa ste /
translated: The palms of the hands and the soles of the feet of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are marked with auspicious signs, swastikas, and coiled wheels.

original: rab 'byor / de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la mnga' ba'i dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la mnga' ba'i dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu yin no //
translated: Subhūti, these are the eighty minor marks that the Tathāgata possesses on his body.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings

original: de ltar sbyin pa gnyis po zang zing gi sbyin pa dang / chos kyi sbyin pa dag gis sems can rnams yang dag par sdud par byed de /
analyzed: de ltar sbyin pa gnyis po zang zing gi sbyin pa dang / chos kyi sbyin pa dag gis sems can rnams yang dag par sdud par byed de /
translated: gather beings with those two kinds of generosity, the generosity of material things and the generosity of the Dharma.

original: rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos yin no //
translated: Subhūti, that is the amazing and marvelous Dharma of bodhisattva great beings.

original: rab 'byor / ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos snyan par smra bas sems can rnams yang dag par sdud ce na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos snyan par smra bas sems can rnams yang dag par sdud ce na /
translated: “Subhūti, how do bodhisattva great beings gather beings with pleasant speech?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang @130a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang @130a *//
translated: Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings

original: chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag gis sems can rnams yang dag par sdud par byed de /
analyzed: chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag gis sems can rnams yang dag par sdud par byed de /
translated: “Bodhisattva great beings gather beings through the six perfections.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: They gather beings through the perfection of generosity, the perfection of good conduct, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom.
