original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos snyan par smra bas sems can rnams sdud par byed do //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos snyan par smra bas sems can rnams sdud par byed do //
translated: Bodhisattva great beings gather beings through the six perfections with pleasant speech.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na; pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag gis dge ba'i chos thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na; pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag gis dge ba'i chos thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And why? Because all wholesome dharmas are included in those six perfections.

original: rab 'byor / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po don spyod pas sems can rnams sdud ce na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po don spyod pas sems can rnams sdud ce na /
translated: “Subhūti, how do bodhisattva great beings gather beings through sharing the same aims?

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag nyid kyis /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag nyid kyis /
translated: “Subhūti, those very six perfections

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: are like this:

original: sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / don spyod pa dang / don mthun pas sems can rnams yun ring po nas bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / don spyod pa dang / don mthun pas sems can rnams yun ring po nas bsdus pa yin no //
translated: they gather beings for a long time with giving, kind talk, meaningful actions, and consistency.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la 'di skad du 'doms shing rjes su ston te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la 'di skad du 'doms shing rjes su ston te /
translated: advise and instruct bodhisattva great beings like this:

original: rigs kyi bu dag tshur shog /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag tshur shog /
translated: ‘Come here, sons of a good family.

original: khyed cag yi ge mngon par bsgrub pa la mkhas par gyis shig /
analyzed: khyed cag yi ge mngon par bsgrub pa la mkhas par gyis shig /
translated: You must become skilled in the accomplishment of letters.

original: yi ge gcig la mkhas @130b par gyis shig /
analyzed: yi ge gcig la mkhas @130b par gyis shig /
translated: You must become skilled in one letter.

original: yi ge gnyis la mkhas par gyis shig /
analyzed: yi ge gnyis la mkhas par gyis shig /
translated: You must become skilled in two letters.

original: yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa lnga'i bar dag la mkhas par gyis shig /
analyzed: yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa lnga'i bar dag la mkhas par gyis shig /
translated: You must become skilled in up to forty-nine letters.

original: yi ge gcig gis thams cad 'grib pa dang ldan par rjes su rtogs par gyis shig /
analyzed: yi ge gcig gis thams cad 'grib pa dang ldan par rjes su rtogs par gyis shig /
translated: You must realize that all are included in one letter.

original: yi ge gnyis kyis thams cad 'grib pa dang ldan par rjes su rtogs par gyis shig /
analyzed: yi ge gnyis kyis thams cad 'grib pa dang ldan par rjes su rtogs par gyis shig /
translated: You should understand that all [phenomena] are associated with the two syllables.

original: yi ge gsum gyis thams cad 'grib pa dang ldan par rjes su rtogs par gyis shig /
analyzed: yi ge gsum gyis thams cad 'grib pa dang ldan par rjes su rtogs par gyis shig /
translated: You should understand that all [phenomena] are associated with the three syllables.

original: yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa lnga'i bar dag gis thams cad 'grib pa dang ldan par rjes su rtogs par gyis shig /🔽yi ge gcig tu yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa lnga 'dus par sgoms shig /🔽yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa lnga rnams su yi ge gcig 'dus par sgoms shig /
analyzed: yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa lnga'i bar dag gis thams cad 'grib pa dang ldan par rjes su rtogs par gyis shig / yi ge gcig tu yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa lnga 'dus par sgoms shig / yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa lnga rnams su yi ge gcig 'dus par sgoms shig /
translated: You should understand that all [phenomena] are associated with the forty-five syllables.🔽You should meditate on the forty-five syllables being included in one syllable.

original: ces 'doms par byed de /
analyzed: ces 'doms par byed de /
translated: You should meditate on one syllable being included in the forty-five syllables.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni yi ge gcig la mkhas pa yin no //🔽yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa lnga'i bar dag la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni yi ge gcig la mkhas pa yin no // yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa lnga'i bar dag la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: Subhūti, that bodhisattva mahāsattva is skilled in the one syllable.🔽He is skilled in the forty-five syllables.

original: yi ge gcig tu yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa lnga 'dus par bsgom pa la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: yi ge gcig tu yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa lnga 'dus par bsgom pa la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: He is skilled in meditating on the forty-five syllables being included in one syllable.

original: yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa lnga rnams su yi ge gcig 'dus par bsgom pa la mkhas pa yin te /
analyzed: yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa lnga rnams su yi ge gcig 'dus par bsgom pa la mkhas pa yin te /
translated: He is skilled in the meditation on the inclusion of one letter in forty-five letters.

original: yi ge mngon par bsgrub pa la mkhas par byas nas yi ge med pa mngon par bsgrub pa la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: yi ge mngon par bsgrub pa la mkhas par byas nas yi ge med pa mngon par bsgrub pa la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: Having become skilled in the accomplishment of letters, he is skilled in the accomplishment of the absence of letters.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni chos la mkhas pa dang / yi ge la mkhas pa yin te /🔽de chos la mkhas pa dang / yi ge @131a *//
analyzed: dper na / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni chos la mkhas pa dang / yi ge la mkhas pa yin te / de chos la mkhas pa dang / yi ge @131a *//
translated: The Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One is skilled in the Dharma and skilled in letters.

original: la mkhas pas chos ston te /
analyzed: la mkhas pas chos ston te /
translated: Through his skill in the Dharma and skill in letters, he teaches the Dharma.

original: yi ge rnams kyis yi ge med pa'i chos ston pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yi ge rnams kyis yi ge med pa'i chos ston pa bzhin no //
translated: He teaches the Dharma of the absence of letters through letters.

original: rab 'byor / chos de ni yi ge med pa'i rnam par sprul pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos de ni yi ge med pa'i rnam par sprul pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, that Dharma is a manifestation of the absence of letters.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One!

original: gal te mtha' las 'das pa dang / thog ma dang tha ma ma mchis pa stong pa nyid kyi slad du sems can yang gtan dmigs su ma mchis la /
analyzed: gal te mtha' las 'das pa dang / thog ma dang tha ma ma mchis pa stong pa nyid kyi slad du sems can yang gtan dmigs su ma mchis la /
translated: If, because of the emptiness of what is beyond extremes and the emptiness of what is not to be discarded, sentient beings are also ultimately unobservable,

original: chos kyang dmigs su ma mchis shing /
analyzed: chos kyang dmigs su ma mchis shing /
translated: and phenomena are unobservable,

original: chos kyi rang bzhin yang dmigs su ma mchis lags na /
analyzed: chos kyi rang bzhin yang dmigs su ma mchis lags na /
translated: and the intrinsic nature of phenomena is unobservable,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,🔽how then do bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom that arises from maturation,

original: 'o na ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang /
translated: practice the perfection of meditative stabilization, practice the perfection of perseverance,

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi la spyod pa dang / tshad med pa bzhi la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi la spyod pa dang / tshad med pa bzhi la spyod pa dang /
translated: the perfection of patience, the perfection of discipline, the perfection of generosity, the four concentrations, the four immeasurables,

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi la spyod pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la spyod pa dang / stong pa nyid bcu bzhi la spyod pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi la spyod pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la spyod pa dang / stong pa nyid bcu bzhi la spyod pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la spyod pa dang /
translated: the four formless absorptions, the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the fourteen emptinesses, the absence of marks, and the absence of wishes,

original: ting nge @131b 'dzin rnams la spyod pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad la spyod pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug par dgu la spyod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: ting nge @131b 'dzin rnams la spyod pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad la spyod pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug par dgu la spyod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
translated: the meditative stabilizations, the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang / rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa drug la spyod pa ji ltar sems can rnams la chos ston pa bgyid lags /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang / rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa drug la spyod pa ji ltar sems can rnams la chos ston pa bgyid lags /
translated: How do they teach the Dharma to sentient beings while engaging in the eighteen unique qualities of a buddha, the thirty-two major marks of a great being, the eighty minor marks, and the six higher knowledges that arise from karmic ripening?

original: de la ni sems can dang / sems can du gdags pa'ang dmigs su ma mchis lags te /
analyzed: de la ni sems can dang / sems can du gdags pa'ang dmigs su ma mchis lags te /
translated: In this regard, sentient beings and the designation of sentient beings are not apprehended.

original: sems can dmigs su ma mchis pas /
analyzed: sems can dmigs su ma mchis pas /
translated: Since sentient beings are not apprehended,

original: gzugs kyang dmigs su ma mchis la; rnam par shes pa'i bar du'ang dmigs su ma mchis /
analyzed: gzugs kyang dmigs su ma mchis la; rnam par shes pa'i bar du'ang dmigs su ma mchis /
translated: form is also not apprehended, up to consciousness is not apprehended.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug kyang dmigs su ma mchis la /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug kyang dmigs su ma mchis la /
translated: The six perfections are also not apprehended.

original: de bzhin du dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag kyang dmigs su ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: de bzhin du dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag kyang dmigs su ma mchis lags so //
translated: Similarly, up to the eighty minor marks and the eighteen unique qualities of a buddha are not apprehended.”

original: sems can dang sems can du gdags pa dmigs su ma mchis pa de la ni gzugs kyang ma mchis la /🔽de bzhin du dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bar dag kyang ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: sems can dang sems can du gdags pa dmigs su ma mchis pa de la ni gzugs kyang ma mchis la / de bzhin du dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bar dag kyang ma mchis lags so //
translated: In that regard, there is no form, and similarly, there are no , up to and including the eighty minor marks.

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bar dag kyang ma mchis lags na /
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bar dag kyang ma mchis lags na /
translated: If there are no , up to and including the eighty minor marks,

original: bcom ldan 'das @132a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das @132a *//
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ji ltar sems can rnams la chos ston par 'gyur te; bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ji ltar sems can rnams la chos ston par 'gyur te; bcom ldan 'das /
translated: how will bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom teach the Dharma to sentient beings?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de sems can rnams mchis pa ma lags pa'i chos rnams la yang dag par 'dzin du stsol cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de sems can rnams mchis pa ma lags pa'i chos rnams la yang dag par 'dzin du stsol cing /
translated: Blessed One, will those bodhisattva great beings cause sentient beings to take up non-existent phenomena,

original: phyin ci log la sbyor bar bgyid pa'am /
analyzed: phyin ci log la sbyor bar bgyid pa'am /
translated: and will they cause them to engage in error?

original: gcig tu mi 'gyur lags grang /
analyzed: gcig tu mi 'gyur lags grang /
translated: Will they not be doing just that?

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: In this way, Subhūti, a bodhisattva great being practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: does not apprehend even the bodhisattva,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams lta smos kyang ci 'tshal lags /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams lta smos kyang ci 'tshal lags /
translated: let alone the dharmas on the side of awakening.

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //🔽rab 'byor / de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to // rab 'byor / de de bzhin te /
translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Subhūti said to him,

original: de de bzhin no //
analyzed: de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so, it is so!

original: ji skad smras pa de bzhin te /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: rab 'byor / sems can dmigs su med pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sems can dmigs su med pas /
translated: Subhūti, since sentient beings are not apprehended,

original: nang stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //🔽phyi stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o // phyi stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: inner emptiness should be known.🔽Outer emptiness should be known.

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Inner and outer emptiness should be known.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du rig par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature should be known.

original: phung po stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phung po stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: The emptiness of the aggregates should be known.

original: khams stong pa nyid du @132b rig par bya'o //
analyzed: khams stong pa nyid du @132b rig par bya'o //
translated: the elements should be known as emptiness;

original: skye mched stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: skye mched stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: the sense-spheres should be known as emptiness;

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: dependent origination should be known as emptiness;

original: bdag stong pa nyid dang / sems can stong pa nyid dang / srog stong pa nyid dang / skye ba po stong pa nyid dang / shed las skyes pa stong pa nyid dang / gang zag stong pa nyid dang / gso ba stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: bdag stong pa nyid dang / sems can stong pa nyid dang / srog stong pa nyid dang / skye ba po stong pa nyid dang / shed las skyes pa stong pa nyid dang / gang zag stong pa nyid dang / gso ba stong pa nyid dang /
translated: self should be known as emptiness, sentient being should be known as emptiness, living being should be known as emptiness, born of life should be known as emptiness, nourished should be known as emptiness,

original: byed pa po dang / byed du 'jug pa po dang / slong ba po dang / kun nas slong ba po dang / tshor ba po dang / tshor bar byed pa po dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byed pa po dang / byed du 'jug pa po dang / slong ba po dang / kun nas slong ba po dang / tshor ba po dang / tshor bar byed pa po dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: the agent and the experiencer should be known as emptiness, the one who instigates and the one who instigates others, the one who feels and the one who causes to feel, the one who knows and the one who sees should be known as emptiness;

original: de bzhin du sbyar te bsam gtan stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te bsam gtan stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: and similarly, the meditative absorptions should be known as emptiness.

original: tshad med pa stong pa nyid dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa stong pa nyid dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa stong pa nyid dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa stong pa nyid dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: the emptiness of the immeasurables, the emptiness of the formless absorptions, and the emptiness of the applications of mindfulness.🔽You should know that the emptiness of the emptiness of the applications of mindfulness extends as far as the emptiness of the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bar dag stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //🔽stong pa nyid stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bar dag stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o // stong pa nyid stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: You should know that the emptiness of the emptiness of the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening extends as far as the emptiness of the emptiness of the ten powers of the tathāgatas.🔽You should know that the emptiness of the emptiness of the ten powers of the tathāgatas extends as far as the emptiness of the emptiness of the four fearlessnesses.

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //🔽de bzhin du sbyar te rnam par thar pa brgyad stong pa nyid dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu stong pa nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu stong pa nyid dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o // de bzhin du sbyar te rnam par thar pa brgyad stong pa nyid dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu stong pa nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu stong pa nyid dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi stong pa nyid dang /
translated: You should know that the emptiness of the emptiness of the four fearlessnesses extends as far as the emptiness of the emptiness of the four detailed and thorough knowledges.🔽You should know that the emptiness of the emptiness of the four detailed and thorough knowledges extends as far as the emptiness of the emptiness of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi stong pa nyid dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco @133a *//
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi stong pa nyid dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco @133a *//
translated: You should know that the emptiness of the emptiness of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha extends as far as the emptiness of the emptiness of the emptiness of essential nature.🔽You should know that the emptiness of the emptiness of the emptiness of essential nature extends as far as the emptiness of the emptiness of the emptiness of non-entities.🔽You should know that the emptiness of the emptiness of the emptiness of non-entities extends as far as the emptiness of the emptiness of the emptiness of essential nature.🔽You should know that the emptiness of the emptiness of the emptiness of essential nature extends as far as the emptiness of the emptiness of the emptiness of non-entities.🔽You should know that the emptiness of the emptiness of the emptiness of non-entities extends as far as the emptiness of the emptiness of the emptiness of the emptiness of essential nature.🔽You should know that the emptiness of the emptiness of the emptiness of the emptiness of essential nature extends as far as the emptiness of the emptiness of the emptiness of the emptiness of non-entities.🔽You should know that the emptiness of the emptiness of the emptiness of the emptiness of non-entities extends as far as the emptiness of the emptiness of the emptiness of the emptiness of the emptiness of essential nature.🔽You should know that the emptiness of the emptiness of the emptiness of the emptiness of the emptiness of essential nature extends as far as the emptiness of the emptiness of the emptiness of the emptiness of the emptiness of non-entities.🔽You should know

original: brgyad stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: brgyad stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: and the perfection of wisdom in eight thousand lines should be known to be emptiness.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: The fruit of entering the stream, the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, arhatship, and individual enlightenment should be known to be emptiness.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva levels should be known to be emptiness.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: A buddhafield should be known to be emptiness.

original: byang chub stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Awakening should be known to be emptiness.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos de dag thams cad stong par mthong nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos de dag thams cad stong par mthong nas /
translated: Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings have seen all those dharmas as empty,

original: phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i sems can rnams la chos ston te /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i sems can rnams la chos ston te /
translated: they teach the doctrine to sentient beings who have gone wrong.

original: ci nas kyang stong pa nyid de dag tu phyir mi ldog pa de ltar chos ston to //
analyzed: ci nas kyang stong pa nyid de dag tu phyir mi ldog pa de ltar chos ston to //
translated: They teach the doctrine in such a way that they do not turn back from those emptinesses.

original: des chos thams cad sgrib pa med par yang dag par rjes su mthong ste /
analyzed: des chos thams cad sgrib pa med par yang dag par rjes su mthong ste /
translated: They see all dharmas as unobstructed.

original: chos gang yang 'khrug par mi byed cing /
analyzed: chos gang yang 'khrug par mi byed cing /
translated: they do not cause any dharma to be disturbed,

original: gnyis su mi 'byed par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos ston par byed do //
analyzed: gnyis su mi 'byed par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos ston par byed do //
translated: and they teach the Dharma as it is, without making a division into two.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste; dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste; dper na /
translated: “To illustrate further, Subhūti,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa zhig gis sprul pa bye ba phrag du ma mngon par sprul nas kha cig ni sbyin pa la bkod /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa zhig gis sprul pa bye ba phrag du ma mngon par sprul nas kha cig ni sbyin pa la bkod /
translated: a tathāgata emanates many billions of emanations, and some of them he establishes in generosity,

original: kha cig ni tshul khrims la bkod cing /
analyzed: kha cig ni tshul khrims la bkod cing /
translated: some in morality,

original: de bzhin du sbyar te kha cig ni bzod pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te kha cig ni bzod pa la /
translated: some in patience,

original: kha cig ni brtson 'grus la /
analyzed: kha cig ni brtson 'grus la /
translated: some in perseverance,

original: kha cig ni ting nge 'dzin la /
analyzed: kha cig ni ting nge 'dzin la /
translated: some in concentration,

original: kha cig ni shes rab la /
analyzed: kha cig ni shes rab la /
translated: some in wisdom,

original: kha cig ni bsam gtan rnams @133b la; kha cig ni tshad med pa rnams la /
analyzed: kha cig ni bsam gtan rnams @133b la; kha cig ni tshad med pa rnams la /
translated: some in the meditative stabilizations,

original: kha cig ni gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la /
analyzed: kha cig ni gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la /
translated: some in the formless absorptions,

original: kha cig ni dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la /
analyzed: kha cig ni dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la /
translated: some in the applications of mindfulness,

original: kha cig ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dag la /
analyzed: kha cig ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dag la /
translated: up to some in the eightfold noble path,

original: kha cig ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar dag la bkod /🔽kha cig ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la bkod /
analyzed: kha cig ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar dag la bkod / kha cig ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la bkod /
translated: Some he established up to the knowledge of all aspects.🔽Some he established in the result of stream enterer.🔽

original: kha cig ni byang chub kyi bar dag la bkod na /
analyzed: kha cig ni byang chub kyi bar dag la bkod na /
translated: some he established in the ten wholesome actions, some in the four concentrations, some in the four formless concentrations, some in the four forbearing states, some in the five faculties, some in the five powers, some in the seven limbs of awakening, some in the eightfold noble path, some in the fruit of stream enterer, some in the fruit of once-returner, some in the fruit of non-returner, some in the fruit of worthy one, some in the pratyekabuddha’s awakening, and some in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Subhūti, what do you think?

original: sprul pa des chos gang yang rnam par 'phel ba yod snyam mam /
analyzed: sprul pa des chos gang yang rnam par 'phel ba yod snyam mam /
translated: Is there any dharma that the emanation has increased?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Bhagavān,

original: de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma lags so //
translated: there is not.”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: “Subhūti, you should know that in that way bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: sems can rnams la chos ston te /
analyzed: sems can rnams la chos ston te /
translated: teach the Dharma to beings

original: ma bcings ma grol ba'i tshul gyis de dag ni phyin ci log rnams las rnam par grol bar byed cing /
analyzed: ma bcings ma grol ba'i tshul gyis de dag ni phyin ci log rnams las rnam par grol bar byed cing /
translated: so that they are freed from errors in a way that is neither bound nor freed,

original: de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba la 'god pa de ltar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba la 'god pa de ltar rig par bya'o //
translated: and so that they are established in the real just as it is.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol ba yin la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol ba yin la /
translated: Subhūti, it is because form is neither bound nor liberated.🔽Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are neither bound nor liberated.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'ang ma bcings ma grol ba yin te; gzugs kyi ma bcings ma grol ba nyid gang yin pa de gzugs ma yin la /🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i ma bcings ma grol ba @134a *//
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'ang ma bcings ma grol ba yin te; gzugs kyi ma bcings ma grol ba nyid gang yin pa de gzugs ma yin la / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i ma bcings ma grol ba @134a *//
translated: The very non-bondage and non-liberation of form is not form.

original: nyid gang yin pa de'ang rnam par shes pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: nyid gang yin pa de'ang rnam par shes pa ma yin zhing /
translated: The very non-bondage and non-liberation of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness is not consciousness.

original: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi bar gyi ma bcings ma grol ba nyid gang yin pa de'ang 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi bar gyi ma bcings ma grol ba nyid gang yin pa de'ang 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The very non-bondage and non-liberation of conditioned and unconditioned phenomena is not conditioned and unconditioned phenomena.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar gzugs dang / rnam par shes pa'i bar dag dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi bar gyi chos rnams ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar gzugs dang / rnam par shes pa'i bar dag dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi bar gyi chos rnams ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subhūti, it is because form, up to consciousness, and conditioned and unconditioned phenomena are utterly pure.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: sems can rnams la chos ston kyang sems can du dmigs pa'ang med do //
analyzed: sems can rnams la chos ston kyang sems can du dmigs pa'ang med do //
translated: teach the Dharma to sentient beings, but they do not apprehend sentient beings.🔽Bodhisattva great beings stand in all dharmas without apprehending anything.🔽They stand in the absence of an apprehending mind, and they stand in the absence of an apprehended object.🔽They stand in the absence of an apprehending mind and an apprehended object.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas te /
translated: They stand in the absence of an apprehending mind and an apprehended object, and they stand in the absence of a knower.🔽They stand in the absence of an apprehending mind and an apprehended object, and they stand in the absence of a knower, and they stand in the absence of an object of knowledge.🔽They stand in the absence of an apprehending mind and an apprehended object, and they stand in the absence of a knower, and they stand in the absence of an object of knowledge, and they stand in the absence of a knower of an object of knowledge.🔽They stand in the absence of an apprehending mind and an apprehended object, and they stand in the absence of a knower, and they stand in the absence of an object of knowledge, and they stand in the absence of a knower of an object of knowledge, and they stand in the absence of an object of knowledge of an object of knowledge.

original: de'ang gzugs stong zhes bya bar mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang / rnam par shes pa'i bar du stong zhes bya bar mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi bar dag stong zhes bya bar mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas te /
analyzed: de'ang gzugs stong zhes bya bar mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang / rnam par shes pa'i bar du stong zhes bya bar mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi bar dag stong zhes bya bar mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas te /
translated: They stand in the absence of an apprehending mind and an apprehended object, and they stand in the absence of a knower, and they stand in the absence of an object of knowledge, and they stand in the absence of a knower of an object of knowledge, and they stand in the absence of an object of knowledge of an object of knowledge, and they stand in the absence of an object of knowledge of an object of knowledge of an object of knowledge.🔽They stand in the absence of an apprehending mind and an apprehended object, and they stand in the absence of a knower, and they stand in the absence of an object of knowledge, and they stand in the absence of a knower of an object of knowledge, and they stand in the absence of an object of knowledge of an object of knowledge, and they stand in the absence of an object of knowledge of an object of knowledge of an object of knowledge, and they stand in the absence of an object of knowledge of an object of knowledge of an object of knowledge

original: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams ni gang du'ang gnas pa'ang med do //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams ni gang du'ang gnas pa'ang med do //
translated: conditioned and unconditioned phenomena do not stand anywhere.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar de dag la gang gnas par 'gyur ba'i ngo bo nyid med pas na dngos po med pa'ang dngos po @134b med pa la mi gnas la /🔽rang gi dngos po'ang dngos po med pa la mi gnas shing /🔽gzhan gyi dngos po'ang dngos po med pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag la gang gnas par 'gyur ba'i ngo bo nyid med pas na dngos po med pa'ang dngos po @134b med pa la mi gnas la / rang gi dngos po'ang dngos po med pa la mi gnas shing / gzhan gyi dngos po'ang dngos po med pa'am /
translated: Because they do not stand in non-entities, since they have no intrinsic nature that could stand.🔽Nor do they stand in non-entities in their own intrinsic nature,🔽nor do they stand in non-entities in the intrinsic nature of others.

original: rang gi dngos po la mi gnas pa'i phyir ro; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi dngos po la mi gnas pa'i phyir ro; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar de dag thams cad ni dmigs su med de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar de dag thams cad ni dmigs su med de /
translated: Subhūti, it is because all of them are non-apprehensible.

original: gang dmigs su med pa de ni gang la'ang gnas par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang dmigs su med pa de ni gang la'ang gnas par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: That which is non-apprehensible does not stand anywhere.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: Subhūti, in that way bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: chos de dag thams cad stong pa nyid du sgom ste /
analyzed: chos de dag thams cad stong pa nyid du sgom ste /
translated: meditate on all those phenomena as emptiness.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / nyan thos rnams dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / nyan thos rnams dang /
translated: Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom like that, they do not offend the lord buddhas, the bodhisattvas, the pratyekabuddhas, and the śrāvakas.

original: 'phags pa thams cad la nyes par byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa thams cad la nyes par byas pa ma yin no //
translated: They do not offend any of the noble ones.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / nyan thos rnams kyis kyang chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di nyid rtog ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / nyan thos rnams kyis kyang chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di nyid rtog ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is because those lord buddhas, the bodhisattvas, the pratyekabuddhas, and the śrāvakas have realized this very dharma nature of phenomena.

original: rtogs nas kyang sems can rnams la chos ston cing /🔽chos rnams kyi chos nyid de las kyang mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: rtogs nas kyang sems can rnams la chos ston cing / chos rnams kyi chos nyid de las kyang mi 'da' ste /
translated: Having realized it, they teach the Dharma to sentient beings.🔽They do not transgress that dharma nature of phenomena.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyang 'da' ba med la /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyang 'da' ba med la /
translated: The expanse of reality is not transgressed.

original: de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' yang 'da' ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' yang 'da' ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the dharmadhātu, suchness, and the very limit of reality are not transcended.

original: de ci'i phyir @135a *//🔽zhe na / rab 'byor /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir @135a *// zhe na / rab 'byor /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de dag la gang 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro ////🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag la gang 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //// shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
translated: Subhūti, it is because they do not have a basic nature that could be transcended.🔽The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines

original: bam po lnga bcu rtsa gnyis pa /
analyzed: bam po lnga bcu rtsa gnyis pa /
translated: Chapter 21: The Perfection of Wisdom

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Blessed One having said that, venerable Subhūti asked him,

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos kyi dbyings la 'da' ba ma mchis shing /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos kyi dbyings la 'da' ba ma mchis shing /
translated: “Blessed One, if the dharmadhātu is not transcended,

original: de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' la'ang 'da' ba ma mchis na /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' la'ang 'da' ba ma mchis na /
translated: and suchness and the very limit of reality are also not transcended,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'o na ci gzugs kyang gzhan la; chos kyi dbyings kyang gzhan /🔽de bzhin nyid kyang gzhan /
analyzed: 'o na ci gzugs kyang gzhan la; chos kyi dbyings kyang gzhan / de bzhin nyid kyang gzhan /
translated: then is form one thing, and the dharmadhātu another;

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' yang gzhan zhig lags sam /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' yang gzhan zhig lags sam /
translated: is suchness one thing, and the very limit of reality another?

original: rnam par shes pa'ang gzhan la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'ang gzhan la /
translated: Is consciousness one thing, and the dharmadhātu another;

original: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa ma mchis pa'i chos rnams kyang gzhan pa zhig lags sam /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa ma mchis pa'i chos rnams kyang gzhan pa zhig lags sam /
translated: Are conditioned and unconditioned phenomena, mundane and supramundane, contaminated and uncontaminated phenomena, also something else?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin te /
translated: Subhūti, that is not so.

original: gzugs kyang gzhan ma yin la /
analyzed: gzugs kyang gzhan ma yin la /
translated: Form is not something else,

original: chos kyi dbyings kyang gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyang gzhan ma yin no //
translated: and the dharma-constituent is not something else.

original: de bzhin nyid kyang gzhan ma yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyang gzhan ma yin la /
translated: Suchness is not something else,

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' yang gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' yang gzhan ma yin no //
translated: and the very limit of reality is not something else.

original: rnam par shes pa'ang gzhan ma yin la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'ang gzhan ma yin la /
translated: Consciousness is not something else,

original: chos thams cad kyi bar yang gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi bar yang gzhan ma yin no //
translated: and all dharmas are not something else.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyang gzhan ma yin la /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyang gzhan ma yin la /
translated: The dharma-constituent is not something else,

original: de @135b bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' yang gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: de @135b bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' yang gzhan ma yin no //
translated: and suchness and the very limit of reality are not something else.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti asked him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gal te gzugs kyang gzhan ma lags shing /
analyzed: gal te gzugs kyang gzhan ma lags shing /
translated: Form is not other than that.🔽

original: chos kyi dbyings kyang gzhan ma lags la /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyang gzhan ma lags la /
translated: If form is not one thing and the dharma-constituent another,

original: rnam par shes pa'i bar yang gzhan ma lags /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bar yang gzhan ma lags /
translated: and if consciousness is not one thing and the dharma-constituent another,

original: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi bar yang gzhan ma lags /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi bar yang gzhan ma lags /
translated: and if, in the same way, up to conditioned and unconditioned dharmas are not one thing and the dharma-constituent another,

original: de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings kyi bar yang gzhan ma lags na /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings kyi bar yang gzhan ma lags na /
translated: and if, in the same way, up to the dharma-constituent is not one thing and the dharma-constituent another,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: then, Lord,

original: 'o na nag po'i chos rnams kyi rnam par smin pa nag po ni sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten lags so //
analyzed: 'o na nag po'i chos rnams kyi rnam par smin pa nag po ni sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten lags so //
translated: how is it that the ripened result of black dharmas is the hells, the animal world, and the world of Yama?

original: zhes bgyi ba dang / dkar po'i chos rnams kyi rnam par smin pa dkar po ni lha dang mi rnams lags so //
analyzed: zhes bgyi ba dang / dkar po'i chos rnams kyi rnam par smin pa dkar po ni lha dang mi rnams lags so //
translated: And how is it that the ripened result of white dharmas is gods and humans?

original: zhes bgyi ba dang / dkar gnag gi chos rnams kyi rnam par smin pa dkar gnag ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal 'dres ma lags so //
analyzed: zhes bgyi ba dang / dkar gnag gi chos rnams kyi rnam par smin pa dkar gnag ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal 'dres ma lags so //
translated: And how is it that the ripened result of black-and-white dharmas is a mixture of pleasure and pain?

original: zhes bgyi ba dang / mi gnag cing dkar ba'i chos rnams kyi rnam par smin pa mi gnag cing /
analyzed: zhes bgyi ba dang / mi gnag cing dkar ba'i chos rnams kyi rnam par smin pa mi gnag cing /
translated: and “The ripening of actions that are neither dark nor bright

original: dkar ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub lags so //🔽zhes bgyi bar rnam par dgod par ji @136a *//
analyzed: dkar ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub lags so // zhes bgyi bar rnam par dgod par ji @136a *//
translated: is the fruit of entering the stream, the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, arhatship, individual enlightenment, and unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: ltar 'gyur lags /
analyzed: ltar 'gyur lags /
translated: How is it that they are set forth?🔽The Lord having been asked this,

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //🔽rab 'byor / kun rdzob kyi bden pa nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to // rab 'byor / kun rdzob kyi bden pa nye bar bzung ste /
translated: he said to the venerable Subhūti,

original: 'bras bu rnam par dgod pa bstan par zad kyi /
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam par dgod pa bstan par zad kyi /
translated: “Subhūti, it is only in terms of conventional truth that the presentation of fruits is taught.

original: don dam pa'i bden par ni 'bras bu rnam par dgod pa bstan par mi nus so //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden par ni 'bras bu rnam par dgod pa bstan par mi nus so // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: It is not possible to teach the presentation of fruits in terms of ultimate truth.🔽And why is that?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is because

original: ming dang gzugs ni skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs ni skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: Name and form are non-arising and unceasing, and are neither afflicted nor purified.

original: chos de ni rnam par rtog pa med cing bsnyad du med pa ste /
analyzed: chos de ni rnam par rtog pa med cing bsnyad du med pa ste /
translated: This Dharma is non-conceptual and inexpressible.

original: de ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: It is the emptiness of what transcends limits and the emptiness of what is beginningless and endless.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Blessed One having said this, the venerable Subhūti said to him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽gal te kun rdzob kyi bden pa nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / gal te kun rdzob kyi bden pa nye bar bzung ste /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: 'bras bu rnam par dgod pa mchis kyi /
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam par dgod pa mchis kyi /
translated: if the establishment of the fruits is due to the relative truth,

original: don dam par ma mchis pa lags na /
analyzed: don dam par ma mchis pa lags na /
translated: and not to the ultimate truth,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'o na byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad kyang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bur mi 'gyur lags sam /
analyzed: 'o na byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad kyang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bur mi 'gyur lags sam /
translated: then even all ordinary foolish beings would not be stream-enterers,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu @136b mi 'gyur lags sam /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu @136b mi 'gyur lags sam /
translated: the fruit of once-returning, the fruit of non-returning, the fruit of arhatship, individual enlightenment, and unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?”🔽The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti asked him, “Lord, if all dharmas are empty of all dharmas, how will a beginning bodhisattva great being apprehend the perfection of wisdom, how will he apprehend skillful means, and how will he apprehend the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of giving?

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis che dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //🔽rab 'byor / ci byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis kun rdzob kyi bden pa'am /
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis che dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to // rab 'byor / ci byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis kun rdzob kyi bden pa'am /
translated: How will he apprehend the perfection of wisdom, skillful means, the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of giving?🔽How will he apprehend the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the three gateways to liberation, the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions, the ten powers of a tathāgata, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, the perfection of giving, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, the perfection of wisdom, the perfection of skillful means, the perfection of aspiration, the perfection of power, and the perfection of knowledge?

original: don dam pa'i bden pa shes sam /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa shes sam /
translated: How will he apprehend the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great extent, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of non-dispersal, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all things, the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of non-entities, the emptiness of essential nature, and the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities?🔽How will he apprehend the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions, the five clairvoyances, the four noble truths, the ten powers of a tathāgata, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the three gateways to liberation, and the emptiness gateway to liberation?🔽How will he apprehend the gateway to the light of the Dharma, the gateway to the light of the Dharma of

original: 'o na ni de dag la'ang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi 'bras bu rnam par dgod pa yod par yang 'gyur te /🔽gal te kun rdzob kyi bden pa'am /
analyzed: 'o na ni de dag la'ang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi 'bras bu rnam par dgod pa yod par yang 'gyur te / gal te kun rdzob kyi bden pa'am /
translated: Well then, it would also be the case that those who are not āryas would have the result of stream enterer, the result of once-returner, the result of nonreturner, the state of an arhat, a pratyekabuddha’s enlightenment, and the result of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya bar shes na ni /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya bar shes na ni /
translated: If they knew what is called “conventional truth” or “ultimate truth,”

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo zhes bya ba'i grangs su'ang mi 'gro ba zhig na /
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo zhes bya ba'i grangs su'ang mi 'gro ba zhig na /
translated: they would not be counted as “ordinary, foolish beings.”

original: 'di ltar de dag la yongs su shes pa med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag la yongs su shes pa med de /
translated: However, they do not have complete knowledge of those.

original: de'i phyir de dag la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi 'bras bu rnam par dgod pa dag kyang med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi 'bras bu rnam par dgod pa dag kyang med do //
translated: Therefore, the fruit of stream enterer, the fruit of once-returner, the fruit of non-returner, the state of a worthy one, a pratyekabuddha’s awakening, and unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening are not set forth.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams la ni lam yang med la /🔽lam rnam par bzhag pa'ang med /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams la ni lam yang med la / lam rnam par bzhag pa'ang med /
translated: Subhūti, it is because foolish, ordinary beings do not have a path,🔽do not have a path set forth,

original: lam bsgom pa'ang med na /
analyzed: lam bsgom pa'ang med na /
translated: and do not have a path cultivated.

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams la 'bras bu rnam par dgod pa lta yod par 'gyur re skan /
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams la 'bras bu rnam par dgod pa lta yod par 'gyur re skan /
translated: If foolish, ordinary beings do not have a path cultivated, how could they have a path set forth as a fruit?

original: 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams la ni /🔽lam yang @137a *//🔽yod la lam rnam par bzhag pa'ang yod /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams la ni / lam yang @137a *// yod la lam rnam par bzhag pa'ang yod /
translated: But, Subhūti, noble beings🔽do have a path,🔽do have a path set forth,

original: lam bsgom pa'ang yod pas na 'bras bu rnam par dgod pa'ang yod do //
analyzed: lam bsgom pa'ang yod pas na 'bras bu rnam par dgod pa'ang yod do //
translated: and do have a path cultivated, so they have a path set forth as a fruit.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord!

original: ci lam bsgom pas 'bras bu 'byung zhing 'bras bu thob par 'gyur lags sam /
analyzed: ci lam bsgom pas 'bras bu 'byung zhing 'bras bu thob par 'gyur lags sam /
translated: Do the fruits of the śrāvaka arise from cultivating the path, and are the fruits obtained?🔽”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin te /
translated: “Subhūti, that is not so.

original: lam bsgom pas 'bras bu 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: lam bsgom pas 'bras bu 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: The fruits of the śrāvaka do not arise from cultivating the path,

original: 'bras bu thob par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu thob par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and the fruits are not obtained.

original: rab 'byor / lam ma bsgom par yang 'bras bu thob par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / lam ma bsgom par yang 'bras bu thob par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Subhūti, the fruits are not obtained without cultivating the path,

original: lam gyis kyang 'bras bu mi 'thob la /
analyzed: lam gyis kyang 'bras bu mi 'thob la /
translated: but the fruits are not obtained through the path,

original: lam ma yin pas kyang ma yin zhing lam la mi gnas par yang ma yin te /
analyzed: lam ma yin pas kyang ma yin zhing lam la mi gnas par yang ma yin te /
translated: nor are they obtained through what is not the path, nor are they obtained without abiding in the path.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: Subhūti, in that way bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: sems can rnams la 'bras bu rnam par 'god par byed de /
analyzed: sems can rnams la 'bras bu rnam par 'god par byed de /
translated: set out the fruits for beings.

original: chos kyi dbyings la tshar gcad pa'i tshul gyis 'bras bu rnam par 'god pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la tshar gcad pa'i tshul gyis 'bras bu rnam par 'god pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The result is not established by way of overcoming the dharmadhātu.🔽Śāriputra said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /🔽gal te 'dus byas kyi khams sam /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / gal te 'dus byas kyi khams sam /
translated: Blessed One,🔽if the result is not established by way of overcoming the compounded element

original: 'dus ma byas kyi khams la tshar bcad pas 'bras bu rnam par dgod pa ma mchis par gyur na /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di ni kun tu sbyor ba gsum spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi khams la tshar bcad pas 'bras bu rnam par dgod pa ma mchis par gyur na / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di ni kun tu sbyor ba gsum spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: or the uncompounded element,🔽then, Blessed One, how is it that the Blessed One has said,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu yin no //🔽'di ni 'dod pa'i @137b 'dod chags dang / gnod sems bsrabs pa'i phyir lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu yin no // 'di ni 'dod pa'i @137b 'dod chags dang / gnod sems bsrabs pa'i phyir lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: ‘This is the result of stream enterer, due to abandoning the three fetters.🔽This is the result of once-returner, due to weakening desire and anger.

original: 'di ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun tu sbyor ba rnams spangs pa'i phyir /🔽phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun tu sbyor ba rnams spangs pa'i phyir / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: This is the result of non-returner, due to abandoning the fetters that correspond to the desire realm.

original: 'di ni gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun tu sbyor ba lnga spangs pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun tu sbyor ba lnga spangs pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa nyid yin no //
translated: This is the state of an arhat, due to abandoning the five fetters that correspond to the higher realms.’

original: kun 'byung ba'i chos gang ci'ang rung ba de dag thams cad 'gog pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i chos gang ci'ang rung ba de dag thams cad 'gog pa'i chos can no //
translated: All those dharmas that are the origination of suffering are dharmas that are cessation.

original: zhes bya ba ni rang byang chub yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rang byang chub yin no //
translated: This is the Pratyekabuddha’s Awakening.

original: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spangs pa ni /
analyzed: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spangs pa ni /
translated: The abandonment of all residual impression connections is

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yin no //🔽zhes bka' stsal na /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yin no // zhes bka' stsal na /
translated: perfect, complete Awakening.”

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams la tshar bcad pas 'bras bu rnam par dgod pa med do zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa de bdag gis ji ltar 'tshal bar bgyi /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams la tshar bcad pas 'bras bu rnam par dgod pa med do zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa de bdag gis ji ltar 'tshal bar bgyi /
translated: how should I understand the Lord’s statement that ‘in conditioned and unconditioned dharmas, there is no cutting off, and no establishment of results’?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / ci rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ci rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: “Subhūti, is the result of Stream-Enterer,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: the result of Once-Returner,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: the result of Non-Returner,

original: dgra bcom pa nyid dam /🔽rang byang chub bam /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid dam / rang byang chub bam /
translated: the state of a Worthy One,🔽the Awakening of a Solitary Buddha,

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dus byas yin nam /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dus byas yin nam /
translated: or perfect, complete Awakening conditioned?

original: 'on te 'dus ma byas pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te 'dus ma byas pa yin /
translated: Or is it unconditioned?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

original: de ni 'dus ma bgyis lags so //
analyzed: de ni 'dus ma bgyis lags so //
translated: it is unconditioned.

original: bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: Sugata,

original: 'dus ma bgyis lags so //
analyzed: 'dus ma bgyis lags so //
translated: it is unconditioned.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal @138a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal @138a *//
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: pa / rab 'byor /
analyzed: pa / rab 'byor /
translated: “Subhūti,

original: ci 'dus ma byas kyi chos la tshar gcod pa yod dam /
analyzed: ci 'dus ma byas kyi chos la tshar gcod pa yod dam /
translated: is there any refutation of unconditioned phenomena?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

original: de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma lags so //
translated: there is not.”

original: bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / ci gang gi tshe rigs kyi bu'am /🔽rigs kyi bu mos 'dus byas sam /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / ci gang gi tshe rigs kyi bu'am / rigs kyi bu mos 'dus byas sam /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Subhūti, when sons or daughters of noble family realize conditioned and unconditioned phenomena

original: mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig tu rtogs pa de'i tshe /🔽'dus byas sam /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig tu rtogs pa de'i tshe / 'dus byas sam /
translated: to be the same in being devoid of characteristics,

original: 'dus ma byas kyi chos gang la'ang tshar gcod par byed dam /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi chos gang la'ang tshar gcod par byed dam /
translated: do they then refute any conditioned or unconditioned phenomena?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,🔽they do not.”

original: de ni ma lags so; ;bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de ni ma lags so; ;bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni / 'di lta ste /
translated: In this way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom🔽teach the doctrine to sentient beings

original: nang stong pa nyid nas rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi tshul gyis tshar bcad pa med pa'i phyir sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid nas rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi tshul gyis tshar bcad pa med pa'i phyir sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: by way of the emptiness of internal phenomena, up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities, without being defeated.🔽They teach the doctrine to sentient beings

original: de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'am /
analyzed: de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'am /
translated: by way of the perfection of generosity,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'am /🔽bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'am /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'am / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'am /
translated: the perfection of moral discipline,🔽the perfection of patience,

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'am /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'am /
translated: the perfection of perseverance,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'am /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'am /
translated: the perfection of concentration,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'am /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'am /
translated: the perfection of wisdom,

original: bsam gtan dang po nas bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar ram /🔽byams pa'am / snying rje'am /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po nas bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar ram / byams pa'am / snying rje'am /
translated: the first concentration up to the fourth concentration,🔽love,🔽compassion,🔽appreciative joy,

original: dga' ba'am / btang snyoms sam /
analyzed: dga' ba'am / btang snyoms sam /
translated: and equanimity,

original: 'du shes med @138b 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar ram /
analyzed: 'du shes med @138b 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar ram /
translated: up to the station of neither perception nor non-perception,

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams sam /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams sam /
translated: the applications of mindfulness,

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar ram /🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi chos gang la'ang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar ram / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi chos gang la'ang /
translated: up to the eightfold noble path,🔽or up to omniscience,

original: bdag nyid kyang mngon par zhen par mi byed la /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang mngon par zhen par mi byed la /
translated: he himself does not settle down on any dharma,

original: gzhan yang mngon par zhen par mi byed do //
analyzed: gzhan yang mngon par zhen par mi byed do //
translated: and he does not cause others to settle down on it.

original: de mngon par zhen pa med pas gang la'ang chags pa med do //
analyzed: de mngon par zhen pa med pas gang la'ang chags pa med do //
translated: Since he does not settle down, he is not attached to anything.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa ni sbyin pa'ang sbyin par byed la /
analyzed: dper na / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa ni sbyin pa'ang sbyin par byed la /
translated: For example, a Tathāgata emanation gives a gift,

original: sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i don ma gtogs par sbyin pa'i 'bras bu la'ang chags pa med cing /
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i don ma gtogs par sbyin pa'i 'bras bu la'ang chags pa med cing /
translated: but is not attached to the result of the gift, except for the purpose of completely liberating all sentient beings,

original: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu'ang nyams su myong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu'ang nyams su myong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and does not experience the result of the gift.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi bar dag dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyi bar dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams gang la'ang mi gnas so //🔽rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'ang chos thams cad la'ang spyod la /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi bar dag dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyi bar dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams gang la'ang mi gnas so // rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'ang chos thams cad la'ang spyod la /
translated: He does not stand in any dharma, from the four applications of mindfulness up to the knowledge of all modes.

original: chos gang la'ang mi gnas shing chags pa med do //
analyzed: chos gang la'ang mi gnas shing chags pa med do //
translated: In the same way, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, coursing in the perfection of wisdom, does not stand in any dharma, and yet he does not pass beyond the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar des chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid legs par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar des chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid legs par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has fully understood the Dharma-element.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines

original: @139a *// mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po dang / yi ge mngon par bsgrub pa bstan pa'i le'u zhes bya ste bdun cu rtsa gsum bya'o ////
analyzed: @139a *// mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po dang / yi ge mngon par bsgrub pa bstan pa'i le'u zhes bya ste bdun cu rtsa gsum bya'o ////
translated: This concludes The Teaching of the Signs, the Excellent Major and Minor Marks, and the Attainment of the Syllables, the seventy-third chapter of the Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti addressed the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen mos chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid legs par rtogs pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen mos chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid legs par rtogs pa lags /
translated: how do Bodhisattva-Mahāsattvas understand the dharmatā of dharmas?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: rab 'byor / dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / dper na /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: sprul pa 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la kun tu spyod pa med pa dang / gzugs la kun tu spyod pa med pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i bar la kun tu spyod pa med pa dang / de bzhin du nang dang /
analyzed: sprul pa 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la kun tu spyod pa med pa dang / gzugs la kun tu spyod pa med pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i bar la kun tu spyod pa med pa dang / de bzhin du nang dang /
translated: An emanation does not engage in desire, hatred, or delusion, does not engage in form, up to does not engage in consciousness, and likewise does not engage in the internal,

original: phyi'i chos rnams la kun tu spyod pa med pa dang / bag la nyal dang / kun nas ldang ba rnams la kun tu spyod pa med pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams la kun tu spyod pa med pa dang /
analyzed: phyi'i chos rnams la kun tu spyod pa med pa dang / bag la nyal dang / kun nas ldang ba rnams la kun tu spyod pa med pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams la kun tu spyod pa med pa dang /
translated: not engaging with external phenomena, not engaging with latent tendencies and reactive emotions, not engaging with phenomena that are corruptible or incorruptible,

original: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams la kun tu spyod pa med pa dang / lam la kun tu spyod pa med pa dang / 'bras bu rnams la kun tu spyod pa med pa de ltar /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams la kun tu spyod pa med pa dang / lam la kun tu spyod pa med pa dang / 'bras bu rnams la kun tu spyod pa med pa de ltar /
translated: not engaging with mundane or supramundane phenomena, not engaging with conditioned or unconditioned phenomena, not engaging with the path, and not engaging with the fruits.

original: rab 'byor / chos rnams kyi chos kyi tshul legs par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos rnams kyi chos kyi tshul legs par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Su­bhūti, this is the correct understanding of the way of the Dharma.”🔽Su­bhūti then made the following request:

original: gsol ba / bcom @139b ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol ba / bcom @139b ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: sprul pa'i lam bsgom pa ji lta bu lags /
analyzed: sprul pa'i lam bsgom pa ji lta bu lags /
translated: how does one cultivate the path of a magical creation?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: rab 'byor / lam bsgom pa gang la brten nas kun nas nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / lam bsgom pa gang la brten nas kun nas nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: “Su­bhūti, one cultivates the path in such a way that one does not become afflicted,

original: rnam par byang bar yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: rnam par byang bar yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: and one does not become purified.

original: 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba na'ang mi snang ba yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba na'ang mi snang ba yin no //
translated: and they do not appear in the five destinies of saṃsāra.🔽Śāriputra said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dngos po ma mchis pa'i chos thams cad rtogs pa lags /
