analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dngos po ma mchis pa'i chos thams cad rtogs pa lags /
translated: how do bodhisattva great beings understand all dharmas, which are non-existent?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa la dngos po 'ga' zhig la brten nas kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa la dngos po 'ga' zhig la brten nas kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: “Subhūti, what do you think?🔽Is there any basis for the imputation of a tathāgata emanation,

original: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po gang yang dmigs su yod snyam mam /🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po gang yang dmigs su yod snyam mam / gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: on the basis of which it would become afflicted or purified?”🔽Śāriputra said,

original: de ni ma lags te /
analyzed: de ni ma lags te /
translated: “Blessed One, there is not.

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa la ni dngos po 'ga' zhig la brten nas kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa la ni dngos po 'ga' zhig la brten nas kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Blessed One,🔽there is no basis for the imputation of a tathāgata emanation,

original: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: on the basis of which it would become afflicted or purified,

original: 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba na gda' ba'i dngos po gang yang ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba na gda' ba'i dngos po gang yang ma mchis lags so //
translated: or on the basis of which it would appear in the five destinies of saṃsāra.”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: rab 'byor / de ltar chos rnams kyi chos kyi tshul legs par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar chos rnams kyi chos kyi tshul legs par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: “Subhūti, that is how the Dharma-method of phenomena is well understood.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ci gzugs thams cad de @140a *//
analyzed: ci gzugs thams cad de @140a *//
translated: are all forms

original: bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa lta bu lags sam /
analyzed: bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa lta bu lags sam /
translated: like emanations of the Tathāgata?

original: tshor ba thams cad dang / 'du shes thams cad dang / 'du byed thams cad dang / rnam par shes pa thams cad kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa lta bu lags sam /
analyzed: tshor ba thams cad dang / 'du shes thams cad dang / 'du byed thams cad dang / rnam par shes pa thams cad kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa lta bu lags sam /
translated: Are all feelings, all perceptions, all formations, and all consciousnesses like emanations of the Tathāgata?”

original: rab 'byor / gzugs thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzugs thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa lta bu yin no //
translated: “Subhūti, all forms are like emanations of the Tathāgata.

original: tshor ba thams cad dang / 'du shes thams cad dang / 'du byed thams cad dang / rnam par shes pa thams cad kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba thams cad dang / 'du shes thams cad dang / 'du byed thams cad dang / rnam par shes pa thams cad kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa lta bu yin no //
translated: All feelings, all perceptions, all formations, and all consciousnesses are like emanations of the Tathāgata.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Blessed One,

original: gal te thams cad sprul pa lta bu lags na /
analyzed: gal te thams cad sprul pa lta bu lags na /
translated: If all is like an emanation,

original: sprul pa la ni gzugs ma mchis /
analyzed: sprul pa la ni gzugs ma mchis /
translated: then in an emanation there is no form,

original: tshor ba ma mchis /
analyzed: tshor ba ma mchis /
translated: no feeling,

original: 'du shes ma mchis /
analyzed: 'du shes ma mchis /
translated: no perception,

original: 'du byed rnams ma mchis /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ma mchis /
translated: no volitional factors,

original: rnam par shes pa ma mchis /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ma mchis /
translated: and no consciousness;

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ma mchis /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ma mchis /
translated: there is no affliction,

original: rnam par byang ba ma mchis shing /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba ma mchis shing /
translated: and there is no purification;

original: gang las sems can rnams yongs su thar bar bgyi ba'i 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba'ang ma mchis lags na /
analyzed: gang las sems can rnams yongs su thar bar bgyi ba'i 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba'ang ma mchis lags na /
translated: and there is no five-sector cyclic existence from which sentient beings are to be completely liberated.

original: 'o na ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i skyes bu'i mthur 'gyur lags /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i skyes bu'i mthur 'gyur lags /
translated: Well then, how can it be a bodhisattva great being’s power of a person?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Subhūti, what do you think?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sngon byang chub sems @140b dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na gang sems can dmyal ba'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sngon byang chub sems @140b dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na gang sems can dmyal ba'am /
translated: When bodhisattva great beings previously practiced the bodhisattva’s way of life, did they see any sentient beings in a hell,

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas sam /
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas sam /
translated: in an animal realm,

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten nam /
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten nam /
translated: in the world of Yama,🔽or

original: mi'am lha dag las yongs su thar bar bya ba'i sems can dga' yang dmigs snyam mam /
analyzed: mi'am lha dag las yongs su thar bar bya ba'i sems can dga' yang dmigs snyam mam /
translated: “Do you think that there are any beings to be liberated from the realms of gods, humans, or hell-beings?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Bhagavān,

original: de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma lags so //
translated: no, I do not.”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is so!

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang khams gsum nas yongs su thar bar bya ba'i sems can 'ga' yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang khams gsum nas yongs su thar bar bya ba'i sems can 'ga' yang mi dmigs so //
translated: Bodhisattva mahāsattvas do not apprehend any beings to be liberated from the three realms.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: 'di ltar des chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bur shes shing mthong la rnam par rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar des chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bur shes shing mthong la rnam par rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is because they know and see all phenomena as like an illusion and like a magical creation, and they are aware of them.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He asked, “Bhagavān,

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bur 'tshal zhing mthong la rnam par rig lags na /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bur 'tshal zhing mthong la rnam par rig lags na /
translated: if bodhisattva mahāsattvas know, see, and are aware that all phenomena are like an illusion and like a magical creation,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gi don du pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gi don du pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang /
translated: the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening,

original: byang chub kyi lam la spyod cing /
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam la spyod cing /
translated: and the path to awakening?

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bgyid pa dang / sems can rnams yongs su smin par bgyid lags /🔽de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das @141a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bgyid pa dang / sems can rnams yongs su smin par bgyid lags / de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das @141a *//
translated: For what purpose do they purify a buddhafield and bring beings to maturity?”

original: kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Lord replied to Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / gal te sems can rnams rang rang gi chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bur shes su zin na ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te sems can rnams rang rang gi chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bur shes su zin na ni /
translated: “Subhūti, if beings knew that all phenomena are like a dream and like an emanation,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang sems can rnams kyi don du bskal pa grangs med par byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa mi spyod pa zhig na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang sems can rnams kyi don du bskal pa grangs med par byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa mi spyod pa zhig na /
translated: and the bodhisattva mahāsattva does not practice the bodhisattva conduct for countless eons for the sake of sentient beings.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar sems can rnams rang rang gis chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bur mi shes te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar sems can rnams rang rang gis chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bur mi shes te /
translated: Subhūti, it is because sentient beings do not understand that all phenomena are like a dream, like an illusion.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bskal pa grangs med par pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bskal pa grangs med par pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva mahāsattva practices the six perfections for countless eons,

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed /
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed /
translated: ripens sentient beings,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do //
translated: and purifies a buddhafield.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la che dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la che dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to /
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gal te chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu lags na /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu lags na /
translated: if all phenomena are like a dream, like a mirage, like an illusion, like an optical illusion, and like a magical creation,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: sems can rnams kyang ci la gnas na /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang ci la gnas na /
translated: on what do sentient beings dwell

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
translated: that the bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: gang las bskyod par bgyid lags /
analyzed: gang las bskyod par bgyid lags /
translated: should cause them to be moved from it?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor / @141b sems can rnams ni yod pa ma yin pa'i ming dang mtshan ma dag la gnas pas na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / @141b sems can rnams ni yod pa ma yin pa'i ming dang mtshan ma dag la gnas pas na /
translated: “Su­bhūti, sentient beings dwell in unreal names and signs,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
translated: and the bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: de dag ming dang mtshan ma las skyod par byed do //
analyzed: de dag ming dang mtshan ma las skyod par byed do //
translated: cause them to be moved from names and signs.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: ” Then the venerable Su­bhūti said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ming ni gang lags /
analyzed: ming ni gang lags /
translated: what is a name?

original: mtshan ma ni gang lags /
analyzed: mtshan ma ni gang lags /
translated: What is a sign?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Su­bhūti, it is as follows:

original: ming zhes bya ba dang / mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni glo bur du ming du btags pa ste /
analyzed: ming zhes bya ba dang / mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni glo bur du ming du btags pa ste /
translated: “Name” and “sign” are names that are adventitiously ascribed.

original: 'di lta ste ming zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: 'di lta ste ming zhes bya ba'am /
translated: For example, “name,”

original: mtshan ma zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: mtshan ma zhes bya ba'am /
translated: “sign,”

original: gzugs zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba'am /
translated: “form,”

original: rnam par shes pa'i bar zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bar zhes bya ba'am /
translated: up to “consciousness,”

original: bud med ces bya ba'am /🔽skyes pa zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: bud med ces bya ba'am / skyes pa zhes bya ba'am /
translated: “woman,”🔽“man,”

original: khye'u zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: khye'u zhes bya ba'am /
translated: “boy,”

original: bu mo zhes bya ba'am /🔽sems can dmyal ba pa zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: bu mo zhes bya ba'am / sems can dmyal ba pa zhes bya ba'am /
translated: “girl,”🔽“hell being,”🔽“animal,”

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas pa zhes bya ba'am /🔽gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas pa zhes bya ba'am / gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa zhes bya ba'am /
translated: “departed one,”

original: lha zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: lha zhes bya ba'am /
translated: “god,”

original: mi zhes bya ba'am /🔽'dus byas kyi chos zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: mi zhes bya ba'am / 'dus byas kyi chos zhes bya ba'am /
translated: “human,”🔽“conditioned phenomenon,”

original: 'dus ma byas kyi chos zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi chos zhes bya ba'am /
translated: “unconditioned phenomenon,”

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'am /
translated: “result of stream enterer,”

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'am /
translated: “result of once-returner,”

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'am /
translated: “result of non-returner,”

original: dgra bcom pa nyid ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid ces bya ba'am /
translated: “state of a worthy one,”

original: @142a *// rang sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: @142a *// rang sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'am /
translated: “Pratyekabuddha,”

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba de dag ni bcos mar ming du btags pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba de dag ni bcos mar ming du btags pa'o //
translated: or “samyak-saṃbuddha,” are all merely nominal designations.

original: rab 'byor / ches thams cad kyi rang bzhin ni ming ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ches thams cad kyi rang bzhin ni ming ste /
translated: Su­bhūti, all things are simply names,

original: gzhol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are inclined toward the nominal.

original: 'dus byas thams cad ni ming tsam du zad na /
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad ni ming tsam du zad na /
translated: Since all conditioned things are merely names,

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams de la chags pas /
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams de la chags pas /
translated: immature, ordinary people are attached to them.

original: de dag la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: de dag la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: Therefore, bodhisattva great beings who practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom

original: thabs la mkhas pas 'di skad du ming 'di ni yongs su rtog pas kun nas bskyed pa yin pas /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pas 'di skad du ming 'di ni yongs su rtog pas kun nas bskyed pa yin pas /
translated: skillfully say, ‘This name is produced by conceptualization.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong zhing dngos po med pa la khyed cag yod pa ma yin par yongs su rtog pas chags par ma byed cig /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong zhing dngos po med pa la khyed cag yod pa ma yin par yongs su rtog pas chags par ma byed cig /
translated: Since it is empty of inherent nature and does not exist, you should not be attached to it by conceptualizing it as existent.

original: mkhas pa rnams ni chos stong pa dag la mngon par zhen par mi byed do //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams ni chos stong pa dag la mngon par zhen par mi byed do //
translated: The wise do not become attached to empty phenomena.’

original: zhes kun nas 'bral bar byed de /
analyzed: zhes kun nas 'bral bar byed de /
translated: Thus, they are completely separated.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: thabs la mkhas pas de ltar sems can rnams la chos ston par byed do //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pas de ltar sems can rnams la chos ston par byed do //
translated: teach the Dharma to sentient beings in that way through skill in means.

original: rab 'byor / mtshan ma gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / mtshan ma gang zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, what are the signs?

original: rab 'byor / gnyis po 'di dag ni gang la byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams chags par 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gnyis po 'di dag ni gang la byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams chags par 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma ste /
translated: Subhūti, these two are the signs to which foolish ordinary beings become attached.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: gzugs kyi mtshan ma dang / gzugs med pa'i mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi mtshan ma dang / gzugs med pa'i mtshan ma'o //
translated: The sign of form and the sign of formlessness.

original: rab 'byor / de @142b la gzugs kyi mtshan ma gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de @142b la gzugs kyi mtshan ma gang zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, what is the sign of form?

original: rab 'byor / gzugs gang ci'ang rung ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzugs gang ci'ang rung ste /
translated: Subhūti, any form at all,

original: rags pa'am / phra ba'am /
analyzed: rags pa'am / phra ba'am /
translated: whether coarse or subtle,

original: bzang ba'am / ngan pa dag ste /
analyzed: bzang ba'am / ngan pa dag ste /
translated: whether good or bad,

original: gang skad cig pa'i chos de dag thams cad la yongs su rtog pas 'dzin par byed pa de ni gzugs kyi mtshan ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang skad cig pa'i chos de dag thams cad la yongs su rtog pas 'dzin par byed pa de ni gzugs kyi mtshan ma zhes bya'o //
translated: is a sign of form when it is apprehended through conceptualizing all those momentary phenomena.

original: gzugs med pa'i mtshan ma gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i mtshan ma gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the sign of the formless realm?

original: gzugs med pa'i chos gang ci'ang rung ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i chos gang ci'ang rung ste /
translated: Any phenomenon of the formless realm

original: mtshan mar bzung zhing yongs su btags pa las nyon mongs pa skye ba de ni gzugs med pa'i mtshan ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan mar bzung zhing yongs su btags pa las nyon mongs pa skye ba de ni gzugs med pa'i mtshan ma zhes bya'o //
translated: that arises from apprehending and designating a sign is called the sign of the formless realm.

original: de la byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams chags pas na /
analyzed: de la byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams chags pas na /
translated: Because childish ordinary beings are attached to that,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs mkhas pas mtshan ma de dag dang phral nas mtshan ma med pa'i dngos po la 'dzud cing 'god par byed de /🔽ci nas kyang 'di ni mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs mkhas pas mtshan ma de dag dang phral nas mtshan ma med pa'i dngos po la 'dzud cing 'god par byed de / ci nas kyang 'di ni mtshan ma'o //
translated: the bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom, through skill in means, separate them from those signs and introduce them to and establish them in the thing that is signless.🔽In such a way that they do not fall into the duality

original: 'di ni mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: of ‘this is a sign’

original: zhes gnyis su mi ltung ba de ltar 'dzud cing de ltar 'god par byed do //
analyzed: zhes gnyis su mi ltung ba de ltar 'dzud cing de ltar 'god par byed do //
translated: and ‘this is signless,’ they introduce them and establish them in that way.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: thabs la mkhas pas de ltar sems can rnams mtshan ma dang phral nas mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings la 'dzud cing 'god par byed do //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pas de ltar sems can rnams mtshan ma dang phral nas mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings la 'dzud cing 'god par byed do //
translated: With skillful means, they thus separate sentient beings from their signs and cause them to enter and be established in the expanse without signs.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Su­bhūti said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽gal te chos @143a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / gal te chos @143a *//
translated: “Blessed One,🔽if all these

original: 'di dag thams cad de tsam du bas te /
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad de tsam du bas te /
translated: dharmas are just that much,

original: 'di ltar mtshan ma ma mchis pa tsam du bas pa lags na /
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan ma ma mchis pa tsam du bas pa lags na /
translated: in that they are just that much empty of signs,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: how do bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: ji ltar bdag kyang dge ba'i chos rnams kyis bye brag tu 'bogs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag kyang dge ba'i chos rnams kyis bye brag tu 'bogs par 'gyur la /
translated: cause themselves to be distinguished by virtuous qualities,

original: gzhan dag kyang dge ba'i chos rnams kyi bye brag tu 'bogs pa la 'god par bgyid pa dang / sa nas sa yongs su rdzogs par bgyid cing sems can rnams kyang de dag nyid la sbyor bar bgyid lags /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang dge ba'i chos rnams kyi bye brag tu 'bogs pa la 'god par bgyid pa dang / sa nas sa yongs su rdzogs par bgyid cing sems can rnams kyang de dag nyid la sbyor bar bgyid lags /
translated: and they also establish others in the special qualities of virtue, and they perfect the stages and also connect beings with them.

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Lord having said that, he said to the venerable Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / gal te mtshan ma dngos po zhig yin te; dngos po med pa ma yin par gyur na ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te mtshan ma dngos po zhig yin te; dngos po med pa ma yin par gyur na ni /
translated: “Subhūti, if a causal sign were a thing and not a nonthing,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: dge ba'i chos rnams kyis khyad par thob par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams kyis khyad par thob par mi 'gyur la /
translated: would not attain the special qualities of virtue,

original: gzhan dag kyang khyad par 'thob pa la 'god par mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang khyad par 'thob pa la 'god par mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: and they would not establish others in the attainment of the special qualities.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar mtshan ma ni dngos po ma yin zhing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar mtshan ma ni dngos po ma yin zhing /
translated: Subhūti, it is because a causal sign is not a thing

original: dngos po med de /
analyzed: dngos po med de /
translated: and is not a nonthing.

original: rab 'byor / de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: Subhūti, for that reason, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis /
translated: in a way that is signless

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa @143b yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa @143b yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: perfect the perfection of concentration.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: In a way that is signless they perfect the perfection of perseverance.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: In the same vein, in a way that is signless they perfect the perfection of patience,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: the perfection of moral discipline,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do; ;tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do; ;tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: and the perfection of generosity. They perfect the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, and the applications of mindfulness.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dag yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dag yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: up to they perfect the noble eightfold path.

original: nang stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do //🔽phyi stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do // phyi stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: They perfect inner emptiness.🔽They perfect outer emptiness.

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: They perfect inner and outer emptiness.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same vein, it should be applied extensively.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dag yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dag yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: They perfect the emptiness of essential nature without entityness.

original: rnam par thar pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: They perfect the aspects of liberation.

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: They perfect the meditative stabilities of the serial and nondiscriminatory aspects.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same vein, it should be applied extensively.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: They perfect the ten powers of the tathāgatas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag yongs su rdzogs par byed do /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag yongs su rdzogs par byed do /
translated: They perfect the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas.

original: des dge ba'i chos @144a *//
analyzed: des dge ba'i chos @144a *//
translated: That is the virtuous dharmas.🔽

original: de dag yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: de dag yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: Having perfected those wholesome dharmas,

original: mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis gzhan dag kyang dge ba'i chos de dag la sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis gzhan dag kyang dge ba'i chos de dag la sbyor bar byed do //
translated: they connect others to those wholesome dharmas by way of the absence of attributes.

original: rab 'byor / gal te chos rnams la tha na skra'i rtse mo'i cha shas bzhag pa tsam gyi mtshan ma zhig yod par gyur na'ang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te chos rnams la tha na skra'i rtse mo'i cha shas bzhag pa tsam gyi mtshan ma zhig yod par gyur na'ang /
translated: Subhūti, if dharmas had attributes, even to the extent of the tip of a hair,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa mtshan ma med pa dang / dran pa med pa dang / yid la byed pa med pas chos rnams mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa mtshan ma med pa dang / dran pa med pa dang / yid la byed pa med pas chos rnams mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: then, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom would not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by way of the absence of attributes, the absence of attention, and the absence of mental involvement.

original: sems can rnams kyang zag pa med pa'i chos rnams la de bzhin nyid du 'god par yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang zag pa med pa'i chos rnams la de bzhin nyid du 'god par yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: They would not connect beings to the uncontaminated dharmas in such a way.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar chos thams cad ni zag pa med cing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar chos thams cad ni zag pa med cing /
translated: Subhūti, it is because all dharmas are uncontaminated,

original: mtshan nyid med pa dang / dran pa med pa dang / yid la byed pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa dang / dran pa med pa dang / yid la byed pa med pa yin te /
translated: They are without characteristics, without recollection, and without mental activity.

original: rab 'byor / de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: Subhūti, for this reason, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyis sems can thams cad kyi don byed do //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyis sems can thams cad kyi don byed do //
translated: work for the welfare of all sentient beings through uncontaminated dharmas.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Lord,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: gal te chos thams cad mtshan ma ma mchis shing /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad mtshan ma ma mchis shing /
translated: if all dharmas are without characteristics,

original: dran pa ma mchis la yid la bgyid pa ma mchis pa lags na /
analyzed: dran pa ma mchis la yid la bgyid pa ma mchis pa lags na /
translated: without recollection, and without mental activity,

original: bcom ldan 'das @144b 'o na 'di dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das @144b 'o na 'di dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos so //
translated: Lord, then how is it that these are contaminated dharmas,

original: 'di dag ni zag pa med pa'i chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni zag pa med pa'i chos so //
translated: these are uncontaminated dharmas,

original: 'di dag ni thun mong gi chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni thun mong gi chos so //
translated: these are shared dharmas,

original: 'di dag ni thun mong ma yin pa'i chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni thun mong ma yin pa'i chos so //
translated: these are unshared dharmas,

original: 'di dag ni nyan thos kyi chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni nyan thos kyi chos so //
translated: these are śrāvaka dharmas,

original: 'di dag ni rang sangs rgyas kyi chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni rang sangs rgyas kyi chos so //
translated: These are the qualities of a pratyekabuddha.

original: 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos so //
translated: These are the qualities of a bodhisattva.

original: 'di dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos so zhes bgyi bar ji ltar bgrang bar bgyi lags /
analyzed: 'di dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos so zhes bgyi bar ji ltar bgrang bar bgyi lags /
translated: These are the qualities of a buddha.”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Venerable Subhūti having made this request, the Lord said to him,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: “What do you think, Subhūti?

original: mtshan ma med pa'ang gzhan la /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'ang gzhan la /
translated: Is signlessness one thing and

original: nyan thos kyi chos rnams kyang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi chos rnams kyang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam / gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: the qualities of a śrāvaka another?”

original: de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma lags so //
translated: He replied, “No, Lord.”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: “What do you think, Subhūti?

original: mtshan ma med pa'ang gzhan la /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'ang gzhan la /
translated: Is signlessness one thing and

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
translated: the qualities of a pratyekabuddha another?”🔽“No, Lord.”🔽“What do you think, Subhūti?

original: mtshan ma med pa'ang gzhan la /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'ang gzhan la /
translated: Is signlessness one thing and

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams kyang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams kyang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
translated: the qualities of a bodhisattva another?”🔽“No, Lord.”

original: mtshan ma med pa'ang gzhan la /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'ang gzhan la /
translated: “Subhūti, do you think that the signless is one thing,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam / gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: and the buddhadharmas another?”🔽He replied, “No, Blessed One.”

original: de ni ma lags so; ;bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de ni ma lags so; ;bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'o na mtshan ma med pa nyid rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa @145a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'o na mtshan ma med pa nyid rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa @145a *//
translated: “Well then, Subhūti, is the signless the fruit of entering the stream, the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth,

original: nyid dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yin nam /
analyzed: nyid dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yin nam /
translated: the state of a worthy one, the dharmas of a pratyekabuddha, the dharmas of a bodhisattva, or the dharmas of a buddha?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de de lta lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de de lta lags so //
translated: He replied, “Blessed One, that is so.”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des kyang 'di ltar chos thams cad ni mtshan ma med par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des kyang 'di ltar chos thams cad ni mtshan ma med par rig par bya ste /
translated: “Subhūti, by this one of many explanations you should know that all phenomena are signless.

original: rab 'byor / mtshan ma med pa'i chos de dag thams cad la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni dge ba'i chos thams cad kyis rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / mtshan ma med pa'i chos de dag thams cad la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni dge ba'i chos thams cad kyis rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur te /
translated: Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, who trains in all these dharmas without a sign, he grows in all wholesome dharmas.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Namely,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang /
translated: in the six perfections, the four trances, the four Unlimited, the four formless attainments, the four applications of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four bases of psychic power,

original: dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi bar dag gis rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi bar dag gis rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the five dominants, the five powers, the seven limbs of enlightenment, the holy eightfold path, up to the knowledge of all modes.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i chos rnams la bslab par bya ba ma gtogs par bslab par bya ba gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i chos rnams la bslab par bya ba ma gtogs par bslab par bya ba gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, Subhūti, there is no other training for bodhisattva great beings than this training in the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness of dharmas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum po 'dir @145b dge ba'i chos thams cad 'dus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum po 'dir @145b dge ba'i chos thams cad 'dus pa'i phyir te /
translated: Subhūti, it is because all wholesome dharmas are included in these three gateways to liberation.

original: 'di ltar rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, the emptiness of its own mark is the gateway to liberation that is emptiness.

original: mtshan ma dang bral ba ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang bral ba ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa yin no //
translated: Freedom from signs is the gateway to liberation that is signlessness.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa med pa ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa med pa ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa yin te /
translated: The absence of an active process is the gateway to liberation that is wishlessness.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum po de dag la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni phung po la la slob pa yin /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum po de dag la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni phung po la la slob pa yin /
translated: The bodhisattva great beings who train in those three gateways to liberation train in the aggregates,

original: skye mched bcu gnyis la slob pa yin /
analyzed: skye mched bcu gnyis la slob pa yin /
translated: They train in the twelve sense sources.

original: khams bco brgyad la slob pa yin /
analyzed: khams bco brgyad la slob pa yin /
translated: They train in the eighteen elements.

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi la slob pa yin /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi la slob pa yin /
translated: They train in the four formless absorptions.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la slob pa yin /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la slob pa yin /
translated: They train in the four truths of the noble ones.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis la slob pa yin /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis la slob pa yin /
translated: They train in the twelve links of dependent origination.

original: nang stong pa nyid la slob pa yin /🔽phyi stong pa nyid la slob pa yin /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid la slob pa yin / phyi stong pa nyid la slob pa yin /
translated: They train in inner emptiness.🔽They train in outer emptiness.

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid la slob pa yin /
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid la slob pa yin /
translated: They train in outer and inner emptiness.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la slob pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la slob pa yin no //
translated: They train in . . . up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te pha rol tu phyin pa drug la slob pa yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te pha rol tu phyin pa drug la slob pa yin /
translated: In the same vein, they train in the six transcendent perfections.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi la slob pa yin /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi la slob pa yin /
translated: They train in the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar la slob pa yin /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar la slob pa yin /
translated: They train in . . . up to the eightfold noble path.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la slob pa yin /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la slob pa yin /
translated: They train in the ten powers of the tathāgatas.

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la slob pa yin no //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la slob pa yin no //
translated: they train in the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol @146a *//
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol @146a *//
translated: Then venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: to; ;bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: to; ;bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: how do bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: ji ltar nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la slob pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la slob pa lags /
translated: train in the five appropriated aggregates?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: “Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: gzugs rab tu shes te; gzugs ji ltar skye ba dang / gzugs ji ltar 'gag pa dang / gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa'ang rab tu shes so //
analyzed: gzugs rab tu shes te; gzugs ji ltar skye ba dang / gzugs ji ltar 'gag pa dang / gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa'ang rab tu shes so //
translated: know form, know how form arises, know how form ceases, and know the suchness of form.

original: gzugs ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: gzugs ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
translated: How do they know form?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / dbu ba rdos pa la snying po med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na / dbu ba rdos pa la snying po med pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, just as a lump of foam has no essence,

original: gzugs kyang shin tu gtse tshags dang / shin tu gsong ldong dang / shin tu snying po med par rab tu shes so //
analyzed: gzugs kyang shin tu gtse tshags dang / shin tu gsong ldong dang / shin tu snying po med par rab tu shes so //
translated: so too should one understand form to be extremely fragile, extremely hollow, and extremely insubstantial.

original: gzugs kyi skye ba ji ltar rab tu shes she na /🔽gzugs ni gang nas kyang 'ong ba med la /
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye ba ji ltar rab tu shes she na / gzugs ni gang nas kyang 'ong ba med la /
translated: How does one understand the origination of form?🔽Form does not come from anywhere

original: gzugs ni gang du'ang 'gro ba med pas /
analyzed: gzugs ni gang du'ang 'gro ba med pas /
translated: and form does not go anywhere.🔽It does not come from anywhere

original: gang nas kyang mi 'ong /
analyzed: gang nas kyang mi 'ong /
translated: and does not go anywhere.

original: gang du'ang mi 'gro ba de ltar gzugs kyi skye ba rab tu shes so //🔽rab 'byor / gang nas kyang ma 'ongs /
analyzed: gang du'ang mi 'gro ba de ltar gzugs kyi skye ba rab tu shes so // rab 'byor / gang nas kyang ma 'ongs /
translated: Thus, one understands the origination of form.🔽Subhūti, one understands the origination and destruction of form

original: gang du'ang ma song ba de ltar gzugs kyi skye ba dang / 'jig pa rab tu shes so //
analyzed: gang du'ang ma song ba de ltar gzugs kyi skye ba dang / 'jig pa rab tu shes so //
translated: in that it does not come from anywhere and does not go anywhere.

original: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
translated: How does one understand the suchness of form?

original: de bzhin nyid la skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / 'ong ba med pa dang / 'gro ba med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par @146b byang ba med pa dang / 'phel ba med pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / 'ong ba med pa dang / 'gro ba med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par @146b byang ba med pa dang / 'phel ba med pa dang /
translated: and no decrease.

original: 'grib pa med pa de ltar de bzhin nyid rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'grib pa med pa de ltar de bzhin nyid rab tu shes so //
translated: Suchness is known in that way.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang de bzhin nyid ni ma nor ba de bzhin nyid yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang de bzhin nyid ni ma nor ba de bzhin nyid yin te /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, suchness is the unmistaken suchness.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called suchness.

original: de la log pa nyid med pas de'i phyir yang de bzhin nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: de la log pa nyid med pas de'i phyir yang de bzhin nyid ces bya ste /
translated: Since there is no falsity in it, it is also called suchness.

original: de ltar gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de ltar gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid rab tu shes so //
translated: In that way, the suchness of form is well known.

original: tshor ba ji ltar rab tu shes /🔽tshor ba'i skye ba ji ltar rab tu shes /
analyzed: tshor ba ji ltar rab tu shes / tshor ba'i skye ba ji ltar rab tu shes /
translated: How is feeling well known?🔽How is the arising of feeling well known?

original: tshor ba'i 'jig pa ji ltar rab tu shes /
analyzed: tshor ba'i 'jig pa ji ltar rab tu shes /
translated: How is the destruction of feeling well known?

original: tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
translated: How is the suchness of feeling well known?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / chu'i chu bur gyi skye ba dang / 'jig pa gsog tu 'dug pa de ltar tshor ba rab tu shes so //🔽de gang nas kyang 'ong ba med cing /
analyzed: dper na / chu'i chu bur gyi skye ba dang / 'jig pa gsog tu 'dug pa de ltar tshor ba rab tu shes so // de gang nas kyang 'ong ba med cing /
translated: For example, just as the arising and passing away of water bubbles is insignificant, so too should you understand feelings.🔽You should understand that feelings do not come from anywhere or go anywhere.

original: gang du'ang 'gro ba med pa de ltar tshor ba'i skye ba dang / 'jig pa rab tu shes so //
analyzed: gang du'ang 'gro ba med pa de ltar tshor ba'i skye ba dang / 'jig pa rab tu shes so //
translated: You should understand the arising and passing away of feelings in this way.

original: tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
translated: How should you understand the suchness of feelings?

original: de bzhin nyid ni ma nor ba de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni ma nor ba de bzhin nyid de /
translated: Suchness is the unmistaken,

original: de ltar tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de ltar tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid rab tu shes so //
translated: and thus you should understand the suchness of feelings.

original: 'du shes ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: 'du shes ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
translated: How should you understand perceptions?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: dper na / smig rgyu'i tshogs la chu shin tu dmigs su med pa de ltar 'du shes rab tu shes so //
analyzed: dper na / smig rgyu'i tshogs la chu shin tu dmigs su med pa de ltar 'du shes rab tu shes so //
translated: just as water is utterly unapprehendable in a mirage, so should you understand perceptions.🔽You should understand that perceptions do not come from anywhere or go anywhere.

original: de gang nas kyang 'ong ba med cing gang du'ang 'gro ba med pa de ltar 'du shes kyi skye ba dang / 'jig pa rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de gang nas kyang 'ong ba med cing gang du'ang 'gro ba med pa de ltar 'du shes kyi skye ba dang / 'jig pa rab tu shes so //
translated: You should understand the arising and passing away of perceptions in this way.

original: 'du shes kyi de bzhin nyid ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi de bzhin nyid ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
translated: How should you understand the suchness of perceptions?

original: tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid ji lta ba de ltar 'du shes kyi de bzhin nyid rab tu shes so //
analyzed: tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid ji lta ba de ltar 'du shes kyi de bzhin nyid rab tu shes so //
translated: Just as he knows the suchness of feeling, so he knows the suchness of perception.

original: 'du byed rnams ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
translated: “How does he know volitional factors?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: @147a *// dper na /
analyzed: @147a *// dper na /
translated: For example,

original: chu shing shun pa so sor phye na snying po mi dmigs pa de ltar 'du byed rnams rab tu shes so //
analyzed: chu shing shun pa so sor phye na snying po mi dmigs pa de ltar 'du byed rnams rab tu shes so //
translated: when the bark of a plantain tree is peeled away, the trunk is not found, and so on, until the innermost part is not found. In the same way, he knows volitional factors.

original: 'du byed rnams kyi skye ba dang / 'jig pa ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi skye ba dang / 'jig pa ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
translated: “How does he know the arising and passing away of volitional factors?

original: de gang nas kyang 'ong ba med cing /
analyzed: de gang nas kyang 'ong ba med cing /
translated: They do not come from anywhere,

original: gang du'ang 'gro ba med pa de ltar 'du byed rnams kyi skye ba dang / 'jig pa rab tu shes so //
analyzed: gang du'ang 'gro ba med pa de ltar 'du byed rnams kyi skye ba dang / 'jig pa rab tu shes so //
translated: and they do not go anywhere. In the same way, he knows the arising and passing away of volitional factors.

original: 'du byed rnams kyi de bzhin nyid ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi de bzhin nyid ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
translated: “How does he know the suchness of volitional factors?

original: tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid ji lta ba de ltar 'du byed rnams kyi de bzhin nyid rab tu shes so //
analyzed: tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid ji lta ba de ltar 'du byed rnams kyi de bzhin nyid rab tu shes so //
translated: Just as he knows the suchness of feeling, so he knows the suchness of volitional factors.

original: rnam par shes pa ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
translated: “How does he know consciousness?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa ji lta ba de ltar rnam par shes pa rab tu shes so //
analyzed: dper na / sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa ji lta ba de ltar rnam par shes pa rab tu shes so //
translated: Just as a magician conjures up a four-fold army, such as elephants, horses, chariots, and foot-soldiers, so consciousness should be understood.

original: de gang nas kyang 'ong ba med cing /
analyzed: de gang nas kyang 'ong ba med cing /
translated: It does not come from anywhere,🔽and it does not go anywhere.

original: gang du'ang 'gro ba med pa de ltar rnam par shes pa'i skye ba dang / 'jig pa rab tu shes so //
analyzed: gang du'ang 'gro ba med pa de ltar rnam par shes pa'i skye ba dang / 'jig pa rab tu shes so //
translated: Thus, the arising and cessation of consciousness should be understood.

original: rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
translated: How should the suchness of consciousness be understood?

original: tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid ji lta ba de ltar rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid rab tu shes te /
analyzed: tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid ji lta ba de ltar rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid rab tu shes te /
translated: The suchness of consciousness should be understood just as the suchness of feeling.

original: de ltar na rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid rab tu shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid rab tu shes pa yin no //
translated: This is the understanding of the suchness of consciousness.

original: khams rnams ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: khams rnams ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How should the elements be understood?

original: mig gi khams ni mig gi khams kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa de ltar mig gi khams rab tu shes so //
analyzed: mig gi khams ni mig gi khams kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa de ltar mig gi khams rab tu shes so //
translated: The eye element is empty of the intrinsic nature of the eye element.

original: gzugs kyi khams ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How should the form element be understood?

original: gzugs kyi khams ni gzugs kyi khams kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa de ltar @147b gzugs kyi khams rab tu shes so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams ni gzugs kyi khams kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa de ltar @147b gzugs kyi khams rab tu shes so //
translated: The form element is empty of the intrinsic nature of the form element. Thus the form element is discerned.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
translated: How is the eye-consciousness element discerned?

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa de ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams rab tu shes so //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa de ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams rab tu shes so //
translated: The eye-consciousness element is empty of the intrinsic nature of the eye-consciousness element. Thus the eye-consciousness element is discerned.

original: rna ba'i khams dang / sgra'i khams dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / sna'i khams dang / dri'i khams dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / lce'i khams dang / ro'i khams dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang /
analyzed: rna ba'i khams dang / sgra'i khams dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / sna'i khams dang / dri'i khams dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / lce'i khams dang / ro'i khams dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang /
translated: The ear element, sound element, and ear-consciousness element; the nose element, smell element, and nose-consciousness element; the tongue element, taste element, and tongue-consciousness element;

original: lus kyi khams dang / reg bya'i khams dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / yid kyi khams ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: lus kyi khams dang / reg bya'i khams dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / yid kyi khams ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
translated: the body element, tangible object element, and body-consciousness element; the mind element. How is the mind element discerned?

original: yid kyi khams ni yid kyi khams kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa de ltar yid kyi khams rab tu shes so //
analyzed: yid kyi khams ni yid kyi khams kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa de ltar yid kyi khams rab tu shes so //
translated: The mind element is empty of the intrinsic nature of the mind element. Thus, the mind element is thoroughly known.

original: chos kyi khams ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: chos kyi khams ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
translated: How is the phenomena element thoroughly known?

original: chos kyi khams ni chos kyi khams kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa de ltar chos kyi khams rab tu shes so //
analyzed: chos kyi khams ni chos kyi khams kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa de ltar chos kyi khams rab tu shes so //
translated: The phenomena element is empty of the intrinsic nature of the phenomena element. Thus, the phenomena element is thoroughly known.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams ji ltar rab tu shes sha na /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams ji ltar rab tu shes sha na /
translated: How is the mind consciousness element thoroughly known?

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa de ltar yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams rab tu shes te /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa de ltar yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams rab tu shes te /
translated: The mind consciousness element is empty of the intrinsic nature of the mind consciousness element. Thus, the mind consciousness element is thoroughly known.

original: de ltar na khams bco brgyad rab tu shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na khams bco brgyad rab tu shes pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the eighteen constituents are thoroughly known.

original: skye mched rnams ji ltar rab tu shes she na /🔽nang gi skye mched rnams ni nang gi skye mched rnams kyis stong la /
analyzed: skye mched rnams ji ltar rab tu shes she na / nang gi skye mched rnams ni nang gi skye mched rnams kyis stong la /
translated: How are the sense spheres thoroughly known?🔽The inner sense spheres are empty of the inner sense spheres.

original: phyi'i skye mched rnams ni phyi'i skye mched rnams kyis @148a *//
analyzed: phyi'i skye mched rnams ni phyi'i skye mched rnams kyis @148a *//
translated: The outer sense spheres are empty of the outer sense spheres.

original: stong pa de ltar skye mched rnams rab tu shes so //
analyzed: stong pa de ltar skye mched rnams rab tu shes so //
translated: Thus he knows the sense-fields as empty.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
translated: How does he know the Four Noble Truths?

original: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa rab tu shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam 'phags pa'i bden pa rab tu shes pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa rab tu shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam 'phags pa'i bden pa rab tu shes pa'o //
translated: He knows the noble truth of suffering, the noble truth of the arising of suffering, the noble truth of the cessation of suffering, and the noble truth of the path leading to the cessation of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden par ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden par ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
translated: How does he know the noble truth of suffering?

original: sdug bsngal rab tu shes pa dang / bden pa rab tu shes dang / 'phags pa rnams kyi bden pa'o zhes rab tu shes la /🔽gnyis las rnam par grol zhing /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rab tu shes pa dang / bden pa rab tu shes dang / 'phags pa rnams kyi bden pa'o zhes rab tu shes la / gnyis las rnam par grol zhing /
translated: He knows suffering, he knows the truth, and he knows it is the truth of the noble ones.🔽He knows it is free from the duality and is not a duality.

original: gnyis ma yin pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa yin par rab tu shes pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis ma yin pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa yin par rab tu shes pa ste /
translated: Thus he knows it is the noble truth.

original: kun 'byung ba'ang de bzhin /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'ang de bzhin /
translated: The same applies to the arising of suffering.

original: 'gog pa'ang de bzhin /
analyzed: 'gog pa'ang de bzhin /
translated: The same applies to the cessation of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam yang de bzhin du 'phags pa'i bden par rab tu shes so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam yang de bzhin du 'phags pa'i bden par rab tu shes so //
translated: The same applies to the path leading to the cessation of suffering. Thus he knows it is the noble truth.

original: sdug bsngal gyi de bzhin nyid ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi de bzhin nyid ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
translated: How does one understand the suchness of suffering?

original: sdug bsngal gyi de bzhin nyid ni de bzhin nyid yin pa de ltar sdug bsngal gyi de bzhin nyid rab tu shes te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi de bzhin nyid ni de bzhin nyid yin pa de ltar sdug bsngal gyi de bzhin nyid rab tu shes te /
translated: The suchness of suffering is suchness in the sense of being just as it is, and thus one understands the suchness of suffering.

original: de bzhin du kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam gyi de bzhin nyid kyang rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam gyi de bzhin nyid kyang rab tu shes so //
translated: Similarly, one understands the suchness of origination, cessation, and the path.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
translated: How does one understand dependent origination?

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni skye ba med par rab tu shes so //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni skye ba med par rab tu shes so //
translated: Dependent origination is understood as non-arising.

original: de bzhin du rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'gag pa med pa dang / chad pa med pa dang / rtag pa med pa dang / don @148b gcig pa ma yin pa dang / don tha dad pa ma yin pa dang / 'ong ba med pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'gag pa med pa dang / chad pa med pa dang / rtag pa med pa dang / don @148b gcig pa ma yin pa dang / don tha dad pa ma yin pa dang / 'ong ba med pa dang /
translated: Similarly, dependent origination is understood as non-ceasing, non-annihilation, non-eternality, not a single meaning, not a different meaning, not coming,

original: 'gro ba med pa dang / spros pa med pa dang / zhi bar rab tu shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba med pa dang / spros pa med pa dang / zhi bar rab tu shes pa'o //
translated: not going, not conceptualized, and peaceful.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord!

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: If bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: phan tshun tha dad pa'i chos de dag de ltar rab tu 'tshal na /
analyzed: phan tshun tha dad pa'i chos de dag de ltar rab tu 'tshal na /
translated: know those phenomena that are mutually different in that way,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord!

original: 'o na des chos kyi dbyings rnam par dkrugs par mi 'gyur lags sam /
analyzed: 'o na des chos kyi dbyings rnam par dkrugs par mi 'gyur lags sam /
translated: then does that not disturb the dharma-constituent?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; rab 'byor /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; rab 'byor /
translated: The Lord said, “Subhūti,

original: gal te chos kyi dbyings su ma gtogs pa'i chos gzhan 'ga' zhig dmigs su yod na ni /
analyzed: gal te chos kyi dbyings su ma gtogs pa'i chos gzhan 'ga' zhig dmigs su yod na ni /
translated: if you could apprehend any other phenomenon that is not included in the dharma-constituent,

original: rnam par dkrugs par yang 'gyur na /
analyzed: rnam par dkrugs par yang 'gyur na /
translated: then it would be disturbed.

original: rab 'byor / chos kyi dbyings su ma gtogs pa gang mi dmigs pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos kyi dbyings su ma gtogs pa gang mi dmigs pas /
translated: Subhūti, since you do not apprehend any other phenomenon that is not included in the dharma-constituent,

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dkrugs par 'gyur ba'i chos gzhan ni gang yang dmigs su med do //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dkrugs par 'gyur ba'i chos gzhan ni gang yang dmigs su med do //
translated: you do not apprehend any other phenomenon that would disturb the dharma-constituent.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor / chos kyi dbyings su ma gtogs pa'i chos gzhan ni de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos kyi dbyings su ma gtogs pa'i chos gzhan ni de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
translated: Subhuti: The Tathagata, the Arhat, the fully Enlightened Buddha has been proclaimed by the Lord as the foremost of all things.🔽

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos rnams kyis kyang gang yang ma dmigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos rnams kyis kyang gang yang ma dmigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Subhūti, it is because the Tathāgata and the Tathāgata’s śrāvakas do not apprehend any dharma other than the dharma-constituent.

original: ma dmigs pas na chos kyi dbyings su ma gtogs pa'i chos gzhan 'ga' zhig dmigs su yod do zhes 'dogs par mi byed de /🔽rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol @149a *//
analyzed: ma dmigs pas na chos kyi dbyings su ma gtogs pa'i chos gzhan 'ga' zhig dmigs su yod do zhes 'dogs par mi byed de / rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol @149a *//
translated: Since they do not apprehend, they do not designate that ‘some other dharma exists that is apprehended apart from the dharma-constituent.’

original: tu phyin pa la spyod pas de ltar chos kyi dbyings la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: tu phyin pa la spyod pas de ltar chos kyi dbyings la bslab par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom should train in the dharma-constituent like that.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to; ;bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to; ;bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Then venerable Subhūti asked the Lord, “Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos kyi dbyings la slob pas gang la bslabs pa lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos kyi dbyings la slob pas gang la bslabs pa lags /
translated: when bodhisattva great beings train in the dharma-constituent, what do they train in?”

original: de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One replied to the venerable Su­bhūti as follows:

original: rab 'byor / chos kyi dbyings la bslabs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos kyi dbyings la bslabs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
translated: “Su­bhūti, great bodhisattva beings who have trained in the expanse of reality

original: chos thams cad la bslabs pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad la bslabs pa yin no //
translated: have trained in all phenomena.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar chos thams cad ni chos kyi dbyings yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar chos thams cad ni chos kyi dbyings yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Su­bhūti, it is because all phenomena are the expanse of reality.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ” “Blessed One,

original: ci'i slad du chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings lags /
analyzed: ci'i slad du chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings lags /
translated: why are all phenomena the expanse of reality?

original: bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
translated: ” The Blessed One replied:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung /
translated: “Su­bhūti, whether the tathāgatas arise or whether the tathāgatas do not arise,

original: chos rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings 'di ni dbyer med pa'i tshul gyis gnas pa ste /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings 'di ni dbyer med pa'i tshul gyis gnas pa ste /
translated: this expanse of reality of phenomena remains indivisible.

original: rab 'byor / chos kyi dbyings de'ang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos kyi dbyings de'ang 'di lta ste /
translated: Su­bhūti, this expanse of reality is as follows:

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi bar gyi chos thams cad yin te /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi bar gyi chos thams cad yin te /
translated: all phenomena, from form up to omniscience, are the dharma-constituent.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas chos kyi dbyings la bslabs na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas chos kyi dbyings la bslabs na /
translated: Subhūti, in that way, when bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom train in the dharma-constituent,

original: chos thams cad la bslabs @149b pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad la bslabs @149b pa yin no //
translated: they train in all phenomena.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti asked him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: gal te chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings lags na /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings lags na /
translated: if all phenomena are the dharma-constituent,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar bslab par bgyi /
translated: how should bodhisattva great beings train in the perfection of wisdom?

original: de bzhin du ji ltar bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du ji ltar bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi /
translated: Similarly, how should they train in the perfection of concentration?

original: ji ltar brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in the perfection of perseverance?

original: ji ltar bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in the perfection of patience?

original: ji ltar tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in the perfection of discipline?

original: ji ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in the perfection of generosity?
