original: de bzhin du ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bsam gtan dang po la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bsam gtan dang po la bslab par bgyi /
translated: Similarly, how should bodhisattva great beings train in the first concentration?

original: ji ltar bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in the second concentration, the third concentration, and the fourth concentration?

original: de bzhin du ji ltar byams pa la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du ji ltar byams pa la bslab par bgyi /
translated: Similarly, how should they train in love?

original: ji ltar snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms la bslab par bgyi /🔽de bzhin du ji ltar nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / 'du shes med /
analyzed: ji ltar snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms la bslab par bgyi / de bzhin du ji ltar nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / 'du shes med /
translated: How should they train in compassion, joy, and equanimity?

original: 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar la bslab par bgyi /
translated: Similarly, how should they train in the station of endless space, and in the station of endless consciousness, the station of nothing-at-all, and the station of neither recognition nor non-recognition?

original: de bzhin du ji ltar dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du ji ltar dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la bslab par bgyi /
translated: Similarly, how should one train in the applications of mindfulness?

original: de bzhin du ji ltar yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi @150a *//
analyzed: de bzhin du ji ltar yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi @150a *//
translated: Similarly, how should one train in the right efforts,🔽the legs of miraculous power,🔽the faculties,🔽the powers,🔽the branches of awakening,

original: rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la bslab par bgyi /
translated: and the noble eightfold path?

original: ji ltar stong pa nyid la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar stong pa nyid la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should one train in emptiness?

original: ji ltar mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should one train in signlessness and wishlessness?

original: ji ltar rnam par thar pa brgyad la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par thar pa brgyad la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should one train in the eight liberations?

original: ji ltar snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should one train in the meditative stabilizations?

original: de bzhin du ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la bslab par bgyi /
translated: Similarly, how should one train in the ten powers of the tathāgatas?

original: ji ltar mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la bslab par bgyi /
translated: and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha?🔽How should they train in order to accomplish the six clairvoyances

original: ji ltar mngon par shes pa drug dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis bsgrub pa'i slad du bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar mngon par shes pa drug dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis bsgrub pa'i slad du bslab par bgyi /
translated: and the thirty-two major marks of a great person?

original: ji ltar dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu bsgrub pa'i slad du bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu bsgrub pa'i slad du bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in order to accomplish the eighty minor marks?

original: ji ltar rgyal rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag tu skye bar bgyi ba'i slad du bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyal rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag tu skye bar bgyi ba'i slad du bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in order to be reborn in great kṣatriya🔽families?

original: ji ltar bram ze'i rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag tu skye bar 'gyur ba'i slad du bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar bram ze'i rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag tu skye bar 'gyur ba'i slad du bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in order to be reborn in great brahmin🔽families?🔽How should they train in order to be reborn in great business

original: ji ltar khyim bdag gi rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag tu skye bar bgyi ba'i slad du bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar khyim bdag gi rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag tu skye bar bgyi ba'i slad du bslab par bgyi /
translated: families?

original: ji ltar rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar bgyi ba'i slad du bslab @150b par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar bgyi ba'i slad du bslab @150b par bgyi /
translated: How should I train in order to be reborn among the gods of the Heaven of the Four Great Kings?

original: ji ltar sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar bgyi ba'i slad du bslab par bgyi /🔽ji ltar 'thab bral dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams dang / tshangs ris kyi lha rnams dang / tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don dang / tshangs 'khor dang / 'od chung dang / tshad med 'od dang /
analyzed: ji ltar sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar bgyi ba'i slad du bslab par bgyi / ji ltar 'thab bral dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams dang / tshangs ris kyi lha rnams dang / tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don dang / tshangs 'khor dang / 'od chung dang / tshad med 'od dang /
translated: How should I train in order to be reborn among the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three?🔽How should I train in order to be reborn among the gods of the Heaven Free from Strife, the Heaven of Joy, the Heaven of Delighting in Emanations, the Heaven of Making Use of Others’ Emanations, the Heaven of Brahmā’s Assembly, the Heaven of Brahmā’s Ministers, the Heaven of Lesser than None, the Heaven of Great Fruition, and the Heaven of No Thought?

original: 'od gsal dang / dge chung dang / tshad med dge dang / dge rgyas dang / 'bras bu che dang / 'du shes ma mchis pa'i sems can rnams kyi nang du skye bar bgyi ba'i slad du bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: 'od gsal dang / dge chung dang / tshad med dge dang / dge rgyas dang / 'bras bu che dang / 'du shes ma mchis pa'i sems can rnams kyi nang du skye bar bgyi ba'i slad du bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should I train in order to be reborn among the gods of the Heaven of Limited Radiance, the Heaven of Immeasurable Radiance, the Heaven of Luster, the Heaven of Limited Virtue, the Heaven of Immeasurable Virtue, the Heaven of Universal Purity, the Heaven of Great Fruition, and the Heaven of No Thought?

original: ji ltar der mi skye bar bgyi ba'i slad du'ang bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar der mi skye bar bgyi ba'i slad du'ang bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should I train in order not to be reborn there?

original: ji ltar gnas gtsang ma mi che dang / mi gdung dang / shin tu mthong dang / gya nom snang dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar bgyi ba'i slad du bslab par bgyi /🔽ji ltar nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / 'du shes med /
analyzed: ji ltar gnas gtsang ma mi che dang / mi gdung dang / shin tu mthong dang / gya nom snang dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar bgyi ba'i slad du bslab par bgyi / ji ltar nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / 'du shes med /
translated: How should they train in order to be reborn among the gods of the Pure Abodes, the gods of the Heaven of the Great Assembly, the gods of the Heaven of No Hardship, the gods of the Heaven of Perfect Joy, the gods of the Heaven of Manifold Joy, and the gods of the Highest Heaven?

original: 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar dag la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar dag la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in the sphere of infinite space, the sphere of infinite consciousness, the sphere of nothingness, and the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception?

original: ji ltar sems dang po bskyed pa la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar sems dang po bskyed pa la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in the first generation of the mind of awakening?

original: ji ltar gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa dang / lnga pa dang / drug pa dang / bdun pa dang / brgyad pa dang / dgu pa dang / sems bskyed pa bcu pa la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa dang / lnga pa dang / drug pa dang / bdun pa dang / brgyad pa dang / dgu pa dang / sems bskyed pa bcu pa la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in the second, third, fourth, fifth, sixth, seventh, eighth, ninth, and tenth generations of the mind of awakening?

original: ji ltar nyan thos kyi sa la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar nyan thos kyi sa la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in the level of the hearers?

original: ji ltar rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in the level of the solitary buddhas?

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in the bodhisattva levels?

original: ji ltar sems can yongs @151a *//
analyzed: ji ltar sems can yongs @151a *//
translated: How should they train in bringing sentient beings to full maturity?

original: su smin par bgyi ba la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: su smin par bgyi ba la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in bringing sentient beings to maturity?

original: ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bgyi ba la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bgyi ba la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in purifying a buddhafield?

original: ji ltar gzungs kyi sgo thams cad la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar gzungs kyi sgo thams cad la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in all the dhāraṇī gateways?

original: ji ltar ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thams cad la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thams cad la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in all the samādhi gateways?

original: ji ltar gang la bslab pas chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du 'tshal bar 'gyur ba'i byang chub kyi lam la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar gang la bslab pas chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du 'tshal bar 'gyur ba'i byang chub kyi lam la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in the path to enlightenment, training in which they will know all phenomena in all their aspects?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: chos kyi dbyings la ni rnam par rtog pa de dag ma mchis te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la ni rnam par rtog pa de dag ma mchis te /
translated: those conceptual thoughts do not exist in the realm of phenomena.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyin ci log la spyod pa'am /
analyzed: de'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyin ci log la spyod pa'am /
translated: so how could bodhisattva great beings who engage in error

original: ma spros pa spros par bgyid par mi 'gyur lags grang /
analyzed: ma spros pa spros par bgyid par mi 'gyur lags grang /
translated: or who have not elaborated elaborations?

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: chos kyi dbyings la ni rnam par rtog pa de dag ma mchis pa'i slad du ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la ni rnam par rtog pa de dag ma mchis pa'i slad du ste /
translated: those conceptual thoughts do not exist in the realm of phenomena.

original: gzugs kyang chos kyi dbyings ma lags /
analyzed: gzugs kyang chos kyi dbyings ma lags /
translated: Form is not the dharma-constituent.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'ang chos kyi dbyings ma lags la /🔽gzugs las gud na'ang /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'ang chos kyi dbyings ma lags la / gzugs las gud na'ang /
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not the dharma-constituent.

original: chos kyi dbyings ma mchis /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ma mchis /
translated: The dharma-constituent is not other than form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa las gud na'ang chos kyi dbyings ma mchis te /🔽gzugs nyid kyang chos kyi dbyings lags la /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa las gud na'ang chos kyi dbyings ma mchis te / gzugs nyid kyang chos kyi dbyings lags la /
translated: The dharma-constituent is not other than feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.🔽Form itself is the dharma-constituent.

original: chos kyi dbyings nyid kyang gzugs lags so //🔽rnam par shes pa'i bar nyid kyang chos kyi dbyings lags la /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings nyid kyang gzugs lags so // rnam par shes pa'i bar nyid kyang chos kyi dbyings lags la /
translated: The dharma-constituent itself is form.🔽Consciousness itself is the dharma-constituent.

original: chos kyi dbyings nyid kyang rnam par shes pa @151b lags so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings nyid kyang rnam par shes pa @151b lags so //
translated: The dharma-constituent itself is consciousness.

original: ji ltar nang gi chos bsgres pa de bzhin du chos thams cad la'ang sbyar bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: ji ltar nang gi chos bsgres pa de bzhin du chos thams cad la'ang sbyar bar bgyi'o //
translated: Just as the internal dharmas are to be extended, so all dharmas are to be extended.”🔽The Lord having been asked this, said to the venerable Subhūti:

original: de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so! It is so!

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin te /🔽de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin te / de de bzhin no //
translated: Subhūti, it is so,🔽it is just as you have said.

original: ji skad smras pa de bzhin te /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: rab 'byor / gzugs nyid kyang chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzugs nyid kyang chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: Subhūti, form itself is the dharma-dhātu.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa nyid kyang chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa nyid kyang chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness itself is the dharma-dhātu.

original: chos kyi dbyings nyid kyang gzugs so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings nyid kyang gzugs so //
translated: The dharma-dhātu itself is form.

original: chos kyi dbyings nyid kyang tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings nyid kyang tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The dharma-dhātu itself is feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva mahāsattvas practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: gal te chos kyi dbyings su ma gtogs pa'i chos 'ga' zhig mthong na ni /
analyzed: gal te chos kyi dbyings su ma gtogs pa'i chos 'ga' zhig mthong na ni /
translated: if they see any dharma that is not included in the dharma-dhātu,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la gnas par yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la gnas par yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: they would not stand in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings yin te /
translated: However, all dharmas are the dharma-dhātu.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: know the realm of reality of all phenomena just as it is.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: chos de dag thams cad chos kyi dbyings su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes nas kyang ming med pa'i chos rnams @152a *//
analyzed: chos de dag thams cad chos kyi dbyings su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes nas kyang ming med pa'i chos rnams @152a *//
translated: know all those phenomena just as they are in the realm of reality, and then, with regard to those phenomena that are without names,🔽they teach with names and conventional terms:

original: la 'di ni gzugs so //
analyzed: la 'di ni gzugs so //
translated: ‘This is form,

original: 'di ni tshor ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni tshor ba'o //
translated: this is feeling,

original: 'di ni 'du shes so //
analyzed: 'di ni 'du shes so //
translated: this is perception,

original: 'di ni 'du byed rnams so //
analyzed: 'di ni 'du byed rnams so //
translated: these are volitional factors,

original: 'di ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: this is consciousness,

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: ’ and similarly, connect this with each, up to

original: 'di ni byang chub po zhes bya ba'i bar du ming dang brdas ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub po zhes bya ba'i bar du ming dang brdas ston par byed do //
translated: ‘this is awakening.’

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / sgyu ma mkhan nam /
analyzed: dper na / sgyu ma mkhan nam /
translated: For example, a magician

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pa zhig gis rdzas kyi rnam pa gang yang rung ba zhig la byin gyis brlabs nas gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pa zhig gis rdzas kyi rnam pa gang yang rung ba zhig la byin gyis brlabs nas gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs 'di lta ste /
translated: A skilled student of a magician, having empowered some substance, may display various forms, such as

original: bud med kyi gzugs sam /
analyzed: bud med kyi gzugs sam /
translated: the form of a woman,

original: skyes pa'i gzugs sam /🔽glang po che'i gzugs sam /🔽rta'i gzugs sam /
analyzed: skyes pa'i gzugs sam / glang po che'i gzugs sam / rta'i gzugs sam /
translated: the form of a man,🔽the form of an elephant,🔽the form of a horse,

original: glang gi gzugs sam /
analyzed: glang gi gzugs sam /
translated: the form of an ox,

original: skyed mos tshal lam /
analyzed: skyed mos tshal lam /
translated: a delightful park,

original: kun dga'i rab nyams dga' ba dag gam /🔽chu klung nyams dga' ba dag gam /
analyzed: kun dga'i rab nyams dga' ba dag gam / chu klung nyams dga' ba dag gam /
translated: a delightful pleasure grove,🔽a delightful river,

original: rdzing bu nyams dga' ba dag nye bar bstan te /
analyzed: rdzing bu nyams dga' ba dag nye bar bstan te /
translated: or a delightful pond.

original: der gding ba dang / rol dbyam sna tshogs bting ba dag kyang nye bar bstan nas /
analyzed: der gding ba dang / rol dbyam sna tshogs bting ba dag kyang nye bar bstan nas /
translated: Having displayed there various kinds of bedding and musical instruments,

original: me tog dang / me tog phreng gi yon tan dang / bza' ba dang / bca' ba dag kyang kun tu bstan /
analyzed: me tog dang / me tog phreng gi yon tan dang / bza' ba dang / bca' ba dag kyang kun tu bstan /
translated: he displays the qualities of flowers and flower garlands, food and drink,

original: glu dbyangs dang rol mo mang pos skye bo dga' bar byed pa dag kyang kun tu bstan nas sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa'am /
analyzed: glu dbyangs dang rol mo mang pos skye bo dga' bar byed pa dag kyang kun tu bstan nas sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa'am /
translated: and delights people with many songs and musical instruments.

original: tshul khrims srung ba'am /🔽bzod pa sgrub pa'am /
analyzed: tshul khrims srung ba'am / bzod pa sgrub pa'am /
translated: or who are observing moral discipline,🔽or who are practicing patience,

original: brtson 'grus rtsom pa'am /
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom pa'am /
translated: or who are undertaking perseverance,

original: ting nge 'dzin gyis rnam par rtse ba'am /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyis rnam par rtse ba'am /
translated: or who are playing with the meditative stabilization,

original: shes rab sgom par byed pa'am /🔽des der rnam pa de lta bu dag gis rgyal rigs shing @152b s'a la chen po lta bu dag gam /
analyzed: shes rab sgom par byed pa'am / des der rnam pa de lta bu dag gis rgyal rigs shing @152b s'a la chen po lta bu dag gam /
translated: or who are cultivating wisdom,🔽or who are teaching the kṣatriyas who are like great śāla trees,

original: bram ze'i rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag gam /
analyzed: bram ze'i rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag gam /
translated: or who are teaching the brahmins who are like great śāla trees,

original: khyim bdag gi rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag kyang bstan tam /
analyzed: khyim bdag gi rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag kyang bstan tam /
translated: or who are teaching the householders who are like great śāla trees,

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha dag bstan tam /
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha dag bstan tam /
translated: or who are teaching the Cāturmahā­rājika gods,

original: ri rab bstan tam /
analyzed: ri rab bstan tam /
translated: or who are teaching Sumeru,🔽or who are teaching the Trāyastriṃśa gods,

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha dag bstan tam /🔽'thab bral lam /🔽dga' ldan nam /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha dag bstan tam / 'thab bral lam / dga' ldan nam /
translated: or who are teaching the Yāma gods,🔽or who are teaching the Tuṣita gods,

original: 'phrul dga'am / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha dag bstan tam /🔽gzugs 'du shes med /
analyzed: 'phrul dga'am / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha dag bstan tam / gzugs 'du shes med /
translated: or who are teaching the Nirmāṇarati gods, or who are teaching the Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin gods,🔽or who are teaching the gods of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception,🔽or who are teaching the stream entrants,🔽or who are teaching the once-returners,

original: 'du shes med min skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba'i bar gyi lha dag bstan tam /
analyzed: 'du shes med min skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba'i bar gyi lha dag bstan tam /
translated: or who are teaching the non-returners,🔽or who are teaching the arhats,🔽or who are teaching the pratyekabuddhas,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'am /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'am /
translated: or who are teaching the bodhisattvas,🔽or who are teaching the tathāgatas, arhats, genuinely perfect buddhas,🔽or who are teaching the śrāvakas of the tathāgatas, arhats, genuinely perfect buddhas,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'am /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'am /
translated: or who are teaching the pratyekabuddhas of the tathāgatas, arhats, genuinely perfect buddhas,🔽or who are teaching the bodhisattvas of the tathāgatas, arhats, genuinely perfect buddhas,🔽or who are teaching the tathāgatas, arhats, genuinely perfect buddhas,🔽or who are teaching the śrāvakas of the tathāgatas, arhats, genuinely perfect buddhas,🔽or who are teaching the pratyekabuddhas of the tathāgatas, arhats, genuinely perfect buddhas,🔽or who are teaching the bodhisattvas of the tathāgatas, arhats, genuinely perfect buddhas,🔽or who are teaching the tathāgatas, arhats, genuinely perfect buddhas,🔽or who are teaching the śrāvakas of the tathāgatas,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'am /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'am /
translated: the non-returners,

original: dgra bcom pa'am /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'am /
translated: the arhats,

original: rang sangs rgyas gang yin pa de dag bstan tam /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas gang yin pa de dag bstan tam /
translated: or the pratyekabuddhas?🔽“Have you taught the bodhisattva great beings who, from the first production of the thought of awakening, practice the perfection of generosity,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste; sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste; sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: the perfection of conduct, the perfection of patience,

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / sa dang po la spyod pa dang / sa bcu pa'i bar la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / sa dang po la spyod pa dang / sa bcu pa'i bar la spyod pa dang /
translated: the perfection of diligence, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom, and who practice the first ground, up to and including the tenth ground,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams mngon par sgrub cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams mngon par sgrub cing /
translated: enter into the bodhisattva’s faultlessness, and accomplish the superknowledges,

original: de dag gis rnam par rtse ba dang / sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag @153a *//
analyzed: de dag gis rnam par rtse ba dang / sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag @153a *//
translated: their play, their bringing of beings to maturity, their purification of buddha realms,

original: par byed pa dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar ba dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dag gis rnam par rtse ba dang / yan lag dang / nying lag dag yongs su gtong ba dang / dga' ba spyod pa dang /
analyzed: par byed pa dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar ba dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dag gis rnam par rtse ba dang / yan lag dang / nying lag dag yongs su gtong ba dang / dga' ba spyod pa dang /
translated: their play with the meditative stabilizations, liberations, samādhis, and samāpattis, their giving away of their major and minor body parts, their enjoyment of the pleasures of the senses,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams snang bar byed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu sgrub par byed pa dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po mngon par sgrub pa dag bstan tam /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams snang bar byed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu sgrub par byed pa dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po mngon par sgrub pa dag bstan tam /
translated: their illumination of world systems, their accomplishment of the ten tathāgata powers, their accomplishment of the fearlessnesses, their accomplishment of the detailed and thorough knowledges, their accomplishment of great love, and their accomplishment of great compassion?

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku yan lag dang / nying lag thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa dag bstan na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku yan lag dang / nying lag thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa dag bstan na /
translated: If you were to teach the complete perfection of the body of a buddha, with all its major and minor parts,

original: de la sems can byis pa'i rang bzhin can dag 'di snyam du /
analyzed: de la sems can byis pa'i rang bzhin can dag 'di snyam du /
translated: The childish, who are of an inferior nature, think, Oh!

original: kye ma mi 'dis ji tsam du 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kye ma mi 'dis ji tsam du 'di lta ste /
translated: This man has taught us so many things,🔽from various kinds of forms up to the body of a Buddha.

original: gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs dag dang / de bzhin du sbyar te sangs rgyas kyi sku'i bar dag bstan pas skye bo 'di dag yang dag par 'dzin cing /🔽ci nas kyang mdzes dgu sha stag byed pa ni /
analyzed: gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs dag dang / de bzhin du sbyar te sangs rgyas kyi sku'i bar dag bstan pas skye bo 'di dag yang dag par 'dzin cing / ci nas kyang mdzes dgu sha stag byed pa ni /
translated: He has made us understand so many things,

original: shin tu legs par bslab pa yin no snyam du shes so //🔽de na mi gang dag mkhas pa'i rang bzhin can /
analyzed: shin tu legs par bslab pa yin no snyam du shes so // de na mi gang dag mkhas pa'i rang bzhin can /
translated: and has taught us so well!

original: gsal zhing yid gzhungs la gzugs de dag la dpyod pa dang ldan pa de dag ni 'di snyam du 'di la chos gang yang dmigs su med na /
analyzed: gsal zhing yid gzhungs la gzugs de dag la dpyod pa dang ldan pa de dag ni 'di snyam du 'di la chos gang yang dmigs su med na /
translated: But the people there who are wise by nature, who are clear and intelligent and who examine those forms, think, Here, no phenomenon can be apprehended at all.

original: mi 'dis yod pa ma yin pa'i chos rnams kyis skye bo'i tshogs 'di dag dga' bar byed pa dang / 'di ltar @153b 'di ni de dag la skye bo 'di dag ni rdzas med pa la rdzas su 'du shes pa yin no snyam pa'i shes pa 'byung ba ni ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos yin no snyam mo //
analyzed: mi 'dis yod pa ma yin pa'i chos rnams kyis skye bo'i tshogs 'di dag dga' bar byed pa dang / 'di ltar @153b 'di ni de dag la skye bo 'di dag ni rdzas med pa la rdzas su 'du shes pa yin no snyam pa'i shes pa 'byung ba ni ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos yin no snyam mo //
translated: This man delights these people with things that do not exist, and so it occurs to him, ‘These people have the idea that what is not a substance is a substance.’

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'ang chos kyi dbyings su ma gtogs pa'i chos gzhan gang yang mi mthong la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'ang chos kyi dbyings su ma gtogs pa'i chos gzhan gang yang mi mthong la /
translated: “Subhūti, in the same way, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom do not see any other phenomenon apart from the dharma-constituent.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: They practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: sems can dang sems can du gdags pa'ang mi dmigs mod kyi /
analyzed: sems can dang sems can du gdags pa'ang mi dmigs mod kyi /
translated: and they do not apprehend a sentient being or the designation of a sentient being.

original: de thabs la mkhas pa dang ldan pas bdag kyang sbyin pa sbyin par byed la /
analyzed: de thabs la mkhas pa dang ldan pas bdag kyang sbyin pa sbyin par byed la /
translated: However, they are skilled in means, and so they themselves give gifts,

original: gzhan dag kyang sbyin pa la sbyor bar byed cing /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang sbyin pa la sbyor bar byed cing /
translated: and they connect others to giving gifts.

original: sbyin pa'i bsngags pa'ang brjod la /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i bsngags pa'ang brjod la /
translated: He also praises generosity.

original: gzhan gang dag sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa de dag gi bsngags pa'ang brjod cing rjes su dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: gzhan gang dag sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa de dag gi bsngags pa'ang brjod cing rjes su dga' bar byed do //
translated: He praises and rejoices in others who practice generosity.

original: bdag kyang tshul khrims srung bar byed /🔽bdag kyang bzod pa sgom par byed /
analyzed: bdag kyang tshul khrims srung bar byed / bdag kyang bzod pa sgom par byed /
translated: He also practices morality.🔽He also cultivates patience.

original: bdag kyang brtson 'grus rtsom par byed /
analyzed: bdag kyang brtson 'grus rtsom par byed /
translated: He also makes an effort at perseverance.

original: bdag kyang bsam gtan la mnyam par 'jog par byed /
analyzed: bdag kyang bsam gtan la mnyam par 'jog par byed /
translated: He also becomes absorbed in concentration.

original: bdag kyang shes rab sgom par byed la /
analyzed: bdag kyang shes rab sgom par byed la /
translated: He also cultivates wisdom.

original: gzhan dag kyang shes rab la sbyor bar byed cing /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang shes rab la sbyor bar byed cing /
translated: He also connects others to wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi bsngags pa'ang brjod la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi bsngags pa'ang brjod la /
translated: He also praises wisdom.

original: gzhan gang dag shes rab bsgom pa de dag gi bsngags pa'ang brjod cing rjes su dga' bar byed do //🔽de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: gzhan gang dag shes rab bsgom pa de dag gi bsngags pa'ang brjod cing rjes su dga' bar byed do // de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: He praises and rejoices in others who cultivate wisdom.

original: bdag kyang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par 'dzin la /
analyzed: bdag kyang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par 'dzin la /
translated: In the same way, he also takes up the ten wholesome courses of action.

original: gzhan dag kyang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par @154a *//🔽'dzin du 'jug cing /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par @154a *//🔽'dzin du 'jug cing /
translated: He also encourages others to take up the ten wholesome courses of action.🔽He also praises the ten wholesome courses of action.

original: rjes su dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: rjes su dga' bar byed do //
translated: and rejoice in it.

original: bdag kyang bslab pa'i gzhi lnga yang dag par 'dzin par byed cing rjes su dga' ba'i bar du byed do //
analyzed: bdag kyang bslab pa'i gzhi lnga yang dag par 'dzin par byed cing rjes su dga' ba'i bar du byed do //
translated: I too will take up the five precepts and rejoice in it.

original: bdag kyang yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i gso sbyong la gnas par byed cing rjes su dga' ba'i bar du byed do //🔽bdag kyang bsam gtan dang po dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar dang / byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / 'du shes med /
analyzed: bdag kyang yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i gso sbyong la gnas par byed cing rjes su dga' ba'i bar du byed do // bdag kyang bsam gtan dang po dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar dang / byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / 'du shes med /
translated: I too will take up the eight-branched poṣadha vow and rejoice in it.

original: 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar dag bsgrubs te gnas shing rjes su dga' ba'i bar du byed do //
analyzed: 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar dag bsgrubs te gnas shing rjes su dga' ba'i bar du byed do //
translated: I too will accomplish and abide in the first concentration, the fourth concentration, love, compassion, joy, equanimity, the sphere of infinite space, the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, and rejoice in it.

original: bdag kyang dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang /
analyzed: bdag kyang dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang /
translated: I too have meditated on the applications of mindfulness, up to the noble eightfold path, the three gateways to liberation, the eight deliverances, the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, the ten powers of the tathāgatas,

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu sgom zhing rjes su dga' ba'i bar du byed do //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu sgom zhing rjes su dga' ba'i bar du byed do //
translated: the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas, the thirty-two major marks of a superior man, and the eighty minor marks, and I have rejoiced in them.

original: rab 'byor / gal te chos kyi dbyings sngon ji lta bar phyis kyang de bzhin ma yin la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te chos kyi dbyings sngon ji lta bar phyis kyang de bzhin ma yin la /
translated: Subhūti, if the expanse of reality were not just as it was before,

original: bar du'ang de bzhin ma yin du zin na ni /
analyzed: bar du'ang de bzhin ma yin du zin na ni /
translated: and it were not just as it will be later,🔽and it were not just as it is now,

original: byang chub @154b sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: byang chub @154b sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: “Subhūti, if the bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom were not to make the Dharma-constituent their vehicle,

original: thabs la mkhas pas chos kyi dbyings brjod pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed par yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pas chos kyi dbyings brjod pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed par yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: they would not become skilled in means, and would not ripen beings and purify a buddhafield.”

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar chos kyi dbyings ni sngon ji lta bar phyis kyang de bzhin la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar chos kyi dbyings ni sngon ji lta bar phyis kyang de bzhin la /
translated: “Subhūti, it is because the Dharma-constituent is just as it was before, just as it will be later,

original: bar du'ang de bzhin te /
analyzed: bar du'ang de bzhin te /
translated: and just as it is in the present.

original: rab 'byor / da'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs la mkhas pas sems can rnams kyi don du byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod par byed do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / da'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs la mkhas pas sems can rnams kyi don du byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod par byed do //
translated: “Subhūti, therefore bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom, skilled in means, practice the bodhisattva’s way of life for the sake of beings.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
translated: From the Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines

original: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du bstan pa'i le'u zhes bya ste bdun cu rtsa bzhi pa'o ////🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du bstan pa'i le'u zhes bya ste bdun cu rtsa bzhi pa'o //// de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Chapter 75🔽The Perfection of Wisdom🔽The Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhuti:

original: gal te sems can shin tu dmigs su ma mchis la sems can du gdags pa'ang ma mchis na /🔽gang gi don du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par bgyid lags /
analyzed: gal te sems can shin tu dmigs su ma mchis la sems can du gdags pa'ang ma mchis na / gang gi don du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par bgyid lags /
translated: If, as you say, the very idea of a being is not something real, and if there is no being to be apprehended,🔽for whose sake does the Bodhisattva course in the perfection of wisdom?

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Lord: The Bodhisattva, the great being, courses in the perfection of wisdom, having made the very limit of reality his objective support.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni yang dag pa'i mtha' tshad mar byas nas shes rab @155a *//🔽kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni yang dag pa'i mtha' tshad mar byas nas shes rab @155a *// kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: Subhuti: The Bodhisattva, the great being, courses in the perfection of wisdom, having made the very limit of reality his objective support.

original: rab 'byor / gal te yang dag pa'i mtha' yang gzhan la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te yang dag pa'i mtha' yang gzhan la /
translated: Subhuti: If the very limit of reality is one thing, and the perfection of wisdom another, and the Bodhisattva another, then the Bodhisattva, the great being, should not course in the perfection of wisdom.

original: sems can gyi mtha' yang gzhan pa zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: sems can gyi mtha' yang gzhan pa zhig yin na ni /
translated: If the end of sentient beings were something other,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then the bodhisattva great beings would not practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar yang dag pa'i mtha' yang gzhan ma yin la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar yang dag pa'i mtha' yang gzhan ma yin la /
translated: Subhūti, it is because the end of reality is not something other,

original: sems can gyi mtha' yang gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: sems can gyi mtha' yang gzhan ma yin te /
translated: and the end of sentient beings is not something other.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can rnams kyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par byed do; ;rab 'byor /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can rnams kyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par byed do; ;rab 'byor /
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom for the sake of sentient beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' rnam par 'khrugs pa med pas sems can rnams yang dag pa'i mtha' la 'god par byed do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' rnam par 'khrugs pa med pas sems can rnams yang dag pa'i mtha' la 'god par byed do //
translated: without disturbing the end of reality, establish sentient beings in the end of reality.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti said to him,

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te yang dag pa'i mtha' nyid sems can gyi mtha' lags na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te yang dag pa'i mtha' nyid sems can gyi mtha' lags na /
translated: “Lord, if the very limit of reality is the limit of sentient beings,

original: 'o na ji ltar yang dag pa'i mtha' la yang dag pa'i mtha' gnas par 'gyur lags /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar yang dag pa'i mtha' la yang dag pa'i mtha' gnas par 'gyur lags /
translated: then how could the very limit of reality stand in the very limit of reality?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: gal te yang dag pa'i mtha' la yang dag pa'i mtha' gnas par 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te yang dag pa'i mtha' la yang dag pa'i mtha' gnas par 'gyur na ni /
translated: if the very limit of reality stood in the very limit of reality,

original: de lta na ngo bo nyid la ngo bo nyid gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ngo bo nyid la ngo bo nyid gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: then in that case an intrinsic nature would stand in an intrinsic nature.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: ngo bo nyid la ngo bo nyid gnas @155b pa ni ma mchis lags na /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid la ngo bo nyid gnas @155b pa ni ma mchis lags na /
translated: since an intrinsic nature does not stand in an intrinsic nature,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ji ltar sems can gyi mtha' yang dag pa'i mtha' la dgod par bgyid lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ji ltar sems can gyi mtha' yang dag pa'i mtha' la dgod par bgyid lags /
translated: how will bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom set sentient beings in the very limit of reality?”🔽“Subhūti, it is because the very limit of reality is empty of the very limit of reality.

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One replied to the venerable Su­bhūti as follows:

original: rab 'byor / yang dag pa'i mtha' yang yang dag pa'i mtha' la mi gnas la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / yang dag pa'i mtha' yang yang dag pa'i mtha' la mi gnas la /
translated: “Su­bhūti, the real nature does not abide in the real nature,

original: ngo bo nyid kyang ngo bo nyid la mi gnas mod kyi /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyang ngo bo nyid la mi gnas mod kyi /
translated: and the essential nature does not abide in the essential nature.

original: rab 'byor / 'on kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs la mkhas pas sems can gyi mtha' yang dag pa'i mtha' la 'god cing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'on kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs la mkhas pas sems can gyi mtha' yang dag pa'i mtha' la 'god cing /
translated: Su­bhūti, however, great bodhisattva beings who practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom, through skill in means, establish sentient beings in the real nature,

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' rnam par 'khrugs par yang mi byed de /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' rnam par 'khrugs par yang mi byed de /
translated: without disturbing the real nature.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na yang dag pa'i mtha' yang gzhan ma yin la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na yang dag pa'i mtha' yang gzhan ma yin la /
translated: Su­bhūti, in that way, the real nature is not one thing,

original: sems can gyi mtha' yang gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: sems can gyi mtha' yang gzhan ma yin te /
translated: and the finality of sentient beings is another.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / sems can gyi mtha' 'di ni gnyis su med de /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / sems can gyi mtha' 'di ni gnyis su med de /
translated: The real nature and the finality of sentient beings are not two different things.

original: gnyis su dbyer med cing tha mi dad de /
analyzed: gnyis su dbyer med cing tha mi dad de /
translated: They are not divided into two, and they are not differentiated.

original: bcad du med do //
analyzed: bcad du med do //
translated: They cannot be severed.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to; ;bcom ldan 'das /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to; ;bcom ldan 'das / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Subhūti said to him,

original: thabs la mkhas pa gang dang ldan pas sems can rnams yang @156a *//
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa gang dang ldan pas sems can rnams yang @156a *//
translated: “Lord, what is the bodhisattva great beings’ skillful means, endowed with which bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom🔽establish beings in the very limit of reality without disturbing the very limit of reality?

original: dag pa'i mtha' la 'god kyang yang dag pa'i mtha' rnam par 'khrugs par yang mi bgyid pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i thabs la mkhas pa de gang lags /
analyzed: dag pa'i mtha' la 'god kyang yang dag pa'i mtha' rnam par 'khrugs par yang mi bgyid pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i thabs la mkhas pa de gang lags /
translated: What is that bodhisattva great beings’ skillful means?”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Lord having been asked that, said to the venerable Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: “Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: from the first production of the thought of awakening

original: sems can rnams sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la 'god par byed do //
analyzed: sems can rnams sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la 'god par byed do //
translated: They establish beings in the perfection of generosity.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bkod nas kyang sbyin pa de'i sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus ston par byed de /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bkod nas kyang sbyin pa de'i sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus ston par byed de /
translated: Having established them in the perfection of generosity, they teach them the beginning, middle, and end of that generosity.

original: ji ltar sbyin pa 'di sngon gyi mtha' yang stong la /🔽phyi ma'i mtha' yang stong zhing /
analyzed: ji ltar sbyin pa 'di sngon gyi mtha' yang stong la / phyi ma'i mtha' yang stong zhing /
translated: “ ‘They teach, “Generosity is empty of a beginning.🔽Generosity is empty of an end.

original: dbus kyang stong pa de bzhin du sbyin pa 'di'ang stong ngo //
analyzed: dbus kyang stong pa de bzhin du sbyin pa 'di'ang stong ngo //
translated: Generosity is empty of a middle.

original: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu'ang stong ngo //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu'ang stong ngo //
translated: The result of generosity is empty.

original: sbyin pa dag kyang stong ngo //
analyzed: sbyin pa dag kyang stong ngo //
translated: Generosity is empty.

original: len pa po'ang stong ste /
analyzed: len pa po'ang stong ste /
translated: The recipient is empty.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Noble son,

original: de ltar na don de dag thams cad ni yang dag pa'i mtha' la yod pa ma yin gyi /🔽sbyin pa'ang gzhan la sbyin pa'i 'bras bu'ang gzhan no snyam du ma sems shig /
analyzed: de ltar na don de dag thams cad ni yang dag pa'i mtha' la yod pa ma yin gyi / sbyin pa'ang gzhan la sbyin pa'i 'bras bu'ang gzhan no snyam du ma sems shig /
translated: all these things do not exist within the limit of reality.🔽Do not think that generosity is one thing and the result of generosity is another.

original: sbyin bdag kyang gzhan la len pa po'ang gzhan no snyam du ma sems shig /
analyzed: sbyin bdag kyang gzhan la len pa po'ang gzhan no snyam du ma sems shig /
translated: Do not think that the benefactor is one thing and the recipient is another.

original: rigs kyi bu khyod gang gi tshe sbyin pa'ang gzhan la /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod gang gi tshe sbyin pa'ang gzhan la /
translated: Son of noble family, when you give, do not think of the recipient,🔽

original: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu'ang gzhan no @156b snyam du mi sems la /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu'ang gzhan no @156b snyam du mi sems la /
translated: Son of good family, when you do not think that generosity is one thing and the result of generosity another,

original: sbyin bdag kyang gzhan la len pa po'ang gzhan no snyam du mi sems pa de'i tshe khyod kyi sbyin pa 'di ni gnyis ka la bdud rtsir 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyin bdag kyang gzhan la len pa po'ang gzhan no snyam du mi sems pa de'i tshe khyod kyi sbyin pa 'di ni gnyis ka la bdud rtsir 'gyur te /
translated: and you do not think that the benefactor is one thing and the recipient another, then this generosity of yours will be nectar for both,

original: bdud rtsi'i 'bras bu dang / bdud rtsi'i mtha' sbyin par byed kyi /
analyzed: bdud rtsi'i 'bras bu dang / bdud rtsi'i mtha' sbyin par byed kyi /
translated: and you will be giving the result of nectar and the limit of nectar.

original: khyod sbyin pa 'dis gzugs yongs su ma 'dzin cig /
analyzed: khyod sbyin pa 'dis gzugs yongs su ma 'dzin cig /
translated: “Do not grasp at form through this generosity of yours.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su ma 'dzin cig /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su ma 'dzin cig /
translated: Do not grasp at feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: 'di ltar khyod kyi sbyin pa 'di ni sbyin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyod kyi sbyin pa 'di ni sbyin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong /
translated: It is because this generosity of yours is empty of the essence of generosity,

original: 'bras bu de'ang 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong /
analyzed: 'bras bu de'ang 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong /
translated: and that result is also empty of the essence of a result,

original: sbyin bdag kyang sbyin bdag gi ngo bo nyid kyis stong /
analyzed: sbyin bdag kyang sbyin bdag gi ngo bo nyid kyis stong /
translated: and the benefactor is also empty of the essence of a benefactor,🔽and the recipient is also empty of the essence of a recipient.

original: len pa po'ang len pa po'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pas na /
analyzed: len pa po'ang len pa po'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pas na /
translated: The one who takes up is also empty of the entityness of the one who takes up.

original: stong pa nyid la ni sbyin pa'ang dmigs su med la /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la ni sbyin pa'ang dmigs su med la /
translated: In emptiness, giving is not apprehended,

original: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu dang / sbyin bdag dang / len pa po'ang dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu dang / sbyin bdag dang / len pa po'ang dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the result of giving, the giver, and the one who receives are not apprehended.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar chos de dag ni ngo bo nyid kyis shin tu stong pa'i phyir ro zhes ston to //🔽rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs la mkhas pas sems can rnams tshul khrims la rab tu 'god de /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos de dag ni ngo bo nyid kyis shin tu stong pa'i phyir ro zhes ston to // rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs la mkhas pas sems can rnams tshul khrims la rab tu 'god de /
translated: It is because those phenomena are utterly empty of entityness.

original: rigs kyi bu tshur shog /🔽khyod kyis srog gcod pa spongs la /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu tshur shog / khyod kyis srog gcod pa spongs la /
translated: “Moreover, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom with skillful means establish beings in morality, saying, ‘Come here, son of a good family!

original: srog gcod pa las phyir ldog par gyis shig /🔽de bzhin du sbyar te khyod kyis log par lta ba'i bar du spongs la /
analyzed: srog gcod pa las phyir ldog par gyis shig / de bzhin du sbyar te khyod kyis log par lta ba'i bar du spongs la /
translated: You should give up killing and turn back from killing.

original: log par lta ba las phyir ldog par gyis shig /
analyzed: log par lta ba las phyir ldog par gyis shig /
translated: Similarly, connect this with each, up to you should give up wrong views and turn back from wrong views.

original: @157a *// rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: @157a *// rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: chos 'di dag thams cad la ji ltar khyod kyis yongs su brtags pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin gang yang med kyi /
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad la ji ltar khyod kyis yongs su brtags pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin gang yang med kyi /
translated: none of these phenomena have any intrinsic nature whatsoever, as you have imagined them to be.

original: rigs kyi bu chos 'di dag la gang srog gcad par bya ba'i srog chags dang / gang gis srog gcad par bya ba'i chos de dag gang yin zhes nye bar rtogs shig /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu chos 'di dag la gang srog gcad par bya ba'i srog chags dang / gang gis srog gcad par bya ba'i chos de dag gang yin zhes nye bar rtogs shig /
translated: Son of noble family, you should investigate these phenomena, asking: ‘What is the living being whose life is to be taken? What is the phenomenon by which the life is to be taken?’

original: log par lta ba'i bar la'ang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o zhes ston te /
analyzed: log par lta ba'i bar la'ang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o zhes ston te /
translated: The same should be applied up to and including wrong views.”

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: thabs la mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pas sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed cing sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu'ang ston la /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pas sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed cing sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu'ang ston la /
translated: who are endowed with such skillful means bring sentient beings to maturity and reveal the results of generosity and discipline.

original: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu dang / tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu de'ang ngo bo nyid kyis stong par bstan pas /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu dang / tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu de'ang ngo bo nyid kyis stong par bstan pas /
translated: And by teaching that the results of generosity and discipline are empty of any essence,

original: rigs kyi bu des sbyin pa'i 'bras bu dang / tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu de dag 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong par rig nas /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu des sbyin pa'i 'bras bu dang / tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu de dag 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong par rig nas /
translated: Son of noble family, when you know that the results of generosity and the results of moral discipline are empty of the essence of results,🔽you will not cling to them.

original: de la mngon par zhen par mi byed do; ;mngon par zhen pa med pas rnam par g-yeng ba med pa bskyed nas /
analyzed: de la mngon par zhen par mi byed do; ;mngon par zhen pa med pas rnam par g-yeng ba med pa bskyed nas /
translated: When you do not cling to them, you will not be distracted,

original: shes rab bskyed par byed do //
analyzed: shes rab bskyed par byed do //
translated: and you will develop wisdom.

original: shes rab des bag la nyal dang / kun nas ldang ba thams cad bcad nas phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das te /
analyzed: shes rab des bag la nyal dang / kun nas ldang ba thams cad bcad nas phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das te /
translated: With that wisdom, you will cut through all latent tendencies and reactive patterns, and you will pass into complete nirvāṇa in the realm of nirvāṇa without any residual aggregates.

original: de'ang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad yin gyi /
analyzed: de'ang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad yin gyi /
translated: And that is just a worldly convention,

original: don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: not the ultimate.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽stong @157b pa nyid la ni gang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / stong @157b pa nyid la ni gang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'am /
translated: And why is that?🔽Because in emptiness no phenomenon can be apprehended that passes into complete nirvāṇa,

original: gang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos gang yang dmigs su med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos gang yang dmigs su med pa'i phyir te /
translated: or that would pass into complete nirvāṇa,🔽or that would cause passing into complete nirvāṇa.

original: gzhan du na de'i yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa de ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan du na de'i yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa de ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Otherwise, that complete nirvāṇa of theirs would be this:

original: mtha' las 'das pa'i stong pa nyid yin no ////
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa'i stong pa nyid yin no ////
translated: the emptiness of what transcends limits.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines

original: bam po lnga bcu rtsa gsum pa /
analyzed: bam po lnga bcu rtsa gsum pa /
translated: Fascicle Fifty-Three

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: sems can gzhan rnams dang / gang zag gzhan dag phan tshun 'khrugs shing gnod sems su gyur pa dag mthong na /
analyzed: sems can gzhan rnams dang / gang zag gzhan dag phan tshun 'khrugs shing gnod sems su gyur pa dag mthong na /
translated: see other sentient beings, other individuals, who are angry and hostile toward each other.

original: 'di skad 'doms shing rjes su ston par byed de /
analyzed: 'di skad 'doms shing rjes su ston par byed de /
translated: They instruct and teach them like this:

original: rigs kyi bu tshur shog /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu tshur shog /
translated: ‘Come here, sons of a good family!

original: gang la khyod gnod sems su byed pa'i chos de dag thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin gyi /🔽khyod cag bzod pa sgrubs shig /
analyzed: gang la khyod gnod sems su byed pa'i chos de dag thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin gyi / khyod cag bzod pa sgrubs shig /
translated: All those dharmas that you are hostile toward are empty of their own intrinsic nature.🔽You should practice patience.

original: bzod pa sgoms shig /
analyzed: bzod pa sgoms shig /
translated: You should cultivate patience.

original: dang du len pa'i rang bzhin can du gyis shig /
analyzed: dang du len pa'i rang bzhin can du gyis shig /
translated: You should have a nature that is patient and accepting.

original: kye gang la gnod sems su bya ba dang / gang gnod sems su byed pa dang / gang gis gnod sems su byed pa'i chos de dag thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid du nye bar rtogs shig /
analyzed: kye gang la gnod sems su bya ba dang / gang gnod sems su byed pa dang / gang gis gnod sems su byed pa'i chos de dag thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid du nye bar rtogs shig /
translated: “Oh! You should realize that all phenomena, including the one who is to be harmed, the one who harms, and the one who causes harm, are empty of inherent nature.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa gang yin pa de ni nam yang mi stong par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa gang yin pa de ni nam yang mi stong par mi 'gyur te /
translated: That which is empty of inherent nature will never become non-empty.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis ma mdzad /
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis ma mdzad /
translated: This was not created by the Tathāgatas,🔽nor by the Pratyekabuddhas,

original: rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / nyan thos rnams dang / @158a *//
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / nyan thos rnams dang / @158a *//
translated: nor by the Śrāvakas,🔽nor by the Bodhisattvas,🔽nor by the gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, kiṃnaras, mahoragas, nor by the gods of the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika realm up to the Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin realm,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / lha rnams dang / klu rnams dang / gnod sbyin rnams dang / dri za rnams dang / mi'am ci rnams dang / lto 'phye chen po rnams dang / rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi bar gyi lha rnams dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / lha rnams dang / klu rnams dang / gnod sbyin rnams dang / dri za rnams dang / mi'am ci rnams dang / lto 'phye chen po rnams dang / rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi bar gyi lha rnams dang /
translated: nor by humans or non-humans.

original: tshangs pa rnams dang / dge rgyas kyi bar dag dang / gnas gtsang ma pa rnams dang / 'du shes med /
analyzed: tshangs pa rnams dang / dge rgyas kyi bar dag dang / gnas gtsang ma pa rnams dang / 'du shes med /
translated: the Brahmakāyika gods,🔽up to the gods of the Pure Abodes, and the gods of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception,

original: 'du shes med min skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba'i bar dag gis kyang ma byas te /
analyzed: 'du shes med min skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba'i bar dag gis kyang ma byas te /
translated: have not done so.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of a good family,

original: gang la gnod sems su bya ba dang / gang gnod sems su byed pa dang / gang gis gnod sems su byed pa'i chos de dag thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yin par nye bar rtogs shig dang / stong pa nyid ni gang la'ang gnod sems su byed par mi 'gyur ro zhes /
analyzed: gang la gnod sems su bya ba dang / gang gnod sems su byed pa dang / gang gis gnod sems su byed pa'i chos de dag thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yin par nye bar rtogs shig dang / stong pa nyid ni gang la'ang gnod sems su byed par mi 'gyur ro zhes /
translated: you should realize that all those phenomena—the one who is to be harmed, the one who harms, and the one who harms through that—are emptiness by nature, and emptiness does not harm anything at all.”

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: thabs la mkhas pas de ltar sems can rnams rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la sbyor bar byed cing /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pas de ltar sems can rnams rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la sbyor bar byed cing /
translated: like that, with skill in means, connect beings to emptiness by nature

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu la'ang sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu la'ang sbyor bar byed de /
translated: and connect them to causes and effects.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la sbyor ba na /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la sbyor ba na /
translated: When they are engaged in the emptiness of inherent nature,

original: rim gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yang dag par dga' bar byed /🔽yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug /🔽'dzud par byed /
analyzed: rim gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yang dag par dga' bar byed / yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug / 'dzud par byed /
translated: they gradually cause them to delight in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,🔽they cause them to take it up,

original: 'god par byed de /
analyzed: 'god par byed de /
translated: they cause them to enter into it,🔽and they cause them to be established in it.

original: de'ang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad yin @158b gyi; don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'ang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad yin @158b gyi; don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: And that is a worldly convention, not the ultimate.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang bzhin gyi stong pa nyid la ni gang thob par bya ba dang / gang thob par byed pa dang / gang gis thob par byed pa'i chos de dag thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi stong pa nyid la ni gang thob par bya ba dang / gang thob par byed pa dang / gang gis thob par byed pa'i chos de dag thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in the emptiness of inherent nature all those dharmas—that which is to be attained, that which causes attainment, and that by which there is attainment—are not apprehended.

original: rab 'byor / sems can rnams kyi don du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang dag pa'i mtha' gang la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa 'di ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sems can rnams kyi don du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang dag pa'i mtha' gang la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa 'di ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yin te /
translated: Subhūti, the emptiness of inherent nature is that in which bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom for the sake of beings.

original: de la ni sems can yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: de la ni sems can yang mi dmigs /
translated: In it beings are not apprehended,

original: sems can du gdags pa'ang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: sems can du gdags pa'ang mi dmigs so //
translated: and also sentient beings are not apprehended.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: chos thams cad ni sems can gyis dben pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni sems can gyis dben pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all dharmas are void of sentient beings.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: “Moreover, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: sems can brtson 'grus zhan pa dag mthong na /
analyzed: sems can brtson 'grus zhan pa dag mthong na /
translated: see sentient beings with weak perseverance,

original: thabs la mkhas pas lus dang / sems kyi brtson 'grus yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug ste /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pas lus dang / sems kyi brtson 'grus yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug ste /
translated: and with skillful means they get them to take up perseverance in body and mind.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of a good family,

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid la ni gang la zhum par 'gyur ba dang / gang zhum par 'gyur ba dang / gang gis zhum par 'gyur ba'i chos gang yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid la ni gang la zhum par 'gyur ba dang / gang zhum par 'gyur ba dang / gang gis zhum par 'gyur ba'i chos gang yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: in the emptiness of a basic nature there is no dharma at all that is weak, or that is weak, or that is weak because of anything else.

original: chos de dag thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid las rnam par mi 'da' ba yin gyi /
analyzed: chos de dag thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid las rnam par mi 'da' ba yin gyi /
translated: All those dharmas do not go beyond emptiness of a basic nature.

original: khyod lus dang sems kyi brtson 'grus bskyed cing la lo spongs la /
analyzed: khyod lus dang sems kyi brtson 'grus bskyed cing la lo spongs la /
translated: So you should give up laziness and generate perseverance in body and mind.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dge ba'i chos sbyin pa'am /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos sbyin pa'am /
translated: the virtue of generosity,🔽or

original: tshul khrims sam /
analyzed: tshul khrims sam /
translated: the virtue of moral discipline,🔽or

original: bzod pa'am / @159a *//
analyzed: bzod pa'am / @159a *//
translated: the virtue of patience,🔽or🔽the virtue of perseverance,

original: brtson 'grus sam /
analyzed: brtson 'grus sam /
translated: or diligence,🔽🔽

original: ting nge 'dzin tam /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin tam /
translated: the virtue of meditative stabilization,🔽or

original: shes rab bam /
analyzed: shes rab bam /
translated: the virtue of wisdom,🔽or

original: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnams sam /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnams sam /
translated: the concentrations, the liberations, the meditative stabilizations, and the absorptions,🔽or

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams sam /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams sam /
translated: the applications of mindfulness,🔽up to🔽the eightfold noble path,

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dag gam /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dag gam /
translated: up to the eightfold noble path,🔽

original: stong pa nyid dam /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dam /
translated: emptiness,🔽or

original: mtshan ma med pa'am /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'am /
translated: signlessness,🔽or

original: smon pa med pa'am /
analyzed: smon pa med pa'am /
translated: wishlessness,🔽up to

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi bar dag la brtson par gyis shig /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi bar dag la brtson par gyis shig /
translated: all buddhadharmas.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of a good family,

original: stong pa nyid kyis chos de dag sgrib pa med par ltos shig dang / sgrib pa med pa'i chos rnams la zhum par 'gyur ba gang yang med do zhes /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis chos de dag sgrib pa med par ltos shig dang / sgrib pa med pa'i chos rnams la zhum par 'gyur ba gang yang med do zhes /
translated: you should see those dharmas as empty, and you should see those dharmas as unobscured, and you should see those dharmas as baseless, and you should see those dharmas as not to be agitated, and you should see those dharmas as not to be agitated by anything at all.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: thabs la mkhas pas de ltar sems can rnams rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud la 'god par byed de /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pas de ltar sems can rnams rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud la 'god par byed de /
translated: With skillful means, they cause sentient beings to take up, enter into, and be established in the emptiness of inherent existence.

original: ci nas kyang gnyis su med pa de ltar 'god par byed do //
