translated: advise and instruct sentient beings like this.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la 'dzud par byed do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la 'dzud par byed do //
translated: They introduce them to emptiness of essential nature.

original: de de ltar 'doms shing de ltar rjes su ston pa dang / rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la 'dzud par byed pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de de ltar 'doms shing de ltar rjes su ston pa dang / rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la 'dzud par byed pa'i tshe /
translated: When they advise and instruct like this and introduce them to emptiness of essential nature,

original: nam du'ang bya ba ma yin pa mi byed de /🔽de bdag kyang rtag par rgyun du dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par 'dzin par byed la /
analyzed: nam du'ang bya ba ma yin pa mi byed de / de bdag kyang rtag par rgyun du dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par 'dzin par byed la /
translated: they never do what should not be done.🔽They themselves always and continuously take up the ten wholesome actions,

original: gzhan dag kyang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug go /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug go /
translated: and they cause others to take up the ten wholesome actions.

original: de bzhin du bdag kyang bslab pa'i gzhi lnga dang / yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i gso sbyong gi bar dag la gnas par byed la /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag kyang bslab pa'i gzhi lnga dang / yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i gso sbyong gi bar dag la gnas par byed la /
translated: In the same way, I will abide by the five basic precepts and the purificatory fast with its eight branches,

original: gzhan dag kyang yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug go /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug go /
translated: and I will encourage others to do the same.

original: bdag kyang bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug la /
analyzed: bdag kyang bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug la /
translated: I will enter into the first meditative concentration,

original: gzhan dag kyang bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug go /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug go /
translated: and I will encourage others to enter into the first meditative concentration.🔽I will enter into the second meditative concentration, and so on up to:

original: bdag kyang bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar dag la snyoms par 'jug la /
analyzed: bdag kyang bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar dag la snyoms par 'jug la /
translated: I will enter into the fourth meditative concentration,

original: gzhan dag kyang bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar dag la snyoms par 'jug pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug go /🔽bdag kyang rtag par rgyun du byams @162b pa la gnas pa yin zhing gzhan dag kyang rtag par rgyun du byams pa bsgom pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug go /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar dag la snyoms par 'jug pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug go / bdag kyang rtag par rgyun du byams @162b pa la gnas pa yin zhing gzhan dag kyang rtag par rgyun du byams pa bsgom pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug go /
translated: and I will encourage others to enter into the fourth meditative concentration.🔽I will always abide in loving kindness,🔽and I will encourage others to cultivate loving kindness.🔽I will cultivate equanimity,

original: bdag kyang btang snyoms kyi bar dag sgom la /
analyzed: bdag kyang btang snyoms kyi bar dag sgom la /
translated: and I will encourage others to cultivate equanimity.

original: gzhan dag kyang btang snyoms kyi bar dag la bsgom pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug go /🔽bdag kyang 'du shes med /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang btang snyoms kyi bar dag la bsgom pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug go / bdag kyang 'du shes med /
translated: They also encourage others to practice the four immeasurables.

original: 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar dag la snyoms par 'jug la /🔽gzhan dag kyang 'du shes med /🔽'du shes med min /
analyzed: 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar dag la snyoms par 'jug la / gzhan dag kyang 'du shes med / 'du shes med min /
translated: They themselves enter into the meditative absorption of the sphere of neither perception nor nonperception,

original: mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug go /
analyzed: mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug go /
translated: and they encourage others to enter into the meditative absorption of the sphere of neither perception nor nonperception.

original: bdag kyang dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi sgom la /
analyzed: bdag kyang dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi sgom la /
translated: They themselves cultivate the four applications of mindfulness,

original: gzhan dag kyang dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug ste /
translated: and they encourage others to cultivate the four applications of mindfulness.

original: 'dul zhing 'dzud la 'god par byed do //🔽bdag kyang 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dag la sgom la /
analyzed: 'dul zhing 'dzud la 'god par byed do // bdag kyang 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dag la sgom la /
translated: They train them, introduce them, and establish them in them.🔽They themselves cultivate the noble eightfold path,

original: gzhan dag kyang 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dag bsgom pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug go /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dag bsgom pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug go /
translated: and they encourage others to cultivate the noble eightfold path.

original: bdag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la slob la /
analyzed: bdag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la slob la /
translated: I too will train in the ten powers of the Tathāgata,

original: gzhan dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la bslab pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la bslab pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug ste /
translated: and I will encourage others to take up the ten powers of the Tathāgata,

original: 'dul zhing 'dzud pa 'god par byed do //🔽bdag kyang dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bar dag sgrub pa la slob la /
analyzed: 'dul zhing 'dzud pa 'god par byed do // bdag kyang dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bar dag sgrub pa la slob la /
translated: to train in them, to be tamed, to enter into them, and to be established in them.🔽I too will train in the accomplishment of the eighty minor marks,

original: gzhan dag kyang dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu bsgrub @163a *//🔽pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu bsgrub @163a *// pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug ste /
translated: and I will encourage others to take up the accomplishment of the eighty minor marks,

original: 'dul zhing 'dzud la 'god par byed do //
analyzed: 'dul zhing 'dzud la 'god par byed do //
translated: to train in them, to be tamed, to enter into them, and to be established in them.

original: bdag kyang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i shes pa skyed cing /
analyzed: bdag kyang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i shes pa skyed cing /
translated: I too will generate the knowledge of the fruit of stream enterer

original: de la gnas par yang mi byed la /
analyzed: de la gnas par yang mi byed la /
translated: and I will not abide in it,

original: gzhan dag kyang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i shes pa la 'god par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i shes pa la 'god par byed do //
translated: and I will establish others in the knowledge of the fruit of stream enterer.

original: bdag kyang dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar dag gi shes pa skyed cing /
analyzed: bdag kyang dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar dag gi shes pa skyed cing /
translated: I too will generate the knowledge of up to the state of a worthy one

original: de la gnas par yang mi byed la /
analyzed: de la gnas par yang mi byed la /
translated: and I will not abide in it,🔽and I will establish others in the knowledge of up to the state of a worthy one.

original: gzhan dag kyang dgra bcom pa nyid kyi shes pa la 'god par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang dgra bcom pa nyid kyi shes pa la 'god par byed do //
translated: and they also establish others in the knowledge of an arhat.

original: bdag kyang rang byang chub kyi shes pa skyed cing de la gnas par yang mi byed la /
analyzed: bdag kyang rang byang chub kyi shes pa skyed cing de la gnas par yang mi byed la /
translated: They themselves produce the knowledge of a pratyekabuddha, but they do not remain in that.

original: gzhan dag kyang rang byang chub kyi shes pa la 'dul zhing 'dzud de 'god par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang rang byang chub kyi shes pa la 'dul zhing 'dzud de 'god par byed do //
translated: They also train, introduce, and establish others in the knowledge of a pratyekabuddha.

original: bdag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam skyed par byed la /
analyzed: bdag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam skyed par byed la /
translated: They themselves produce the path to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: gzhan dag kyang lam de la 'doms shing rjes su ston pa dang / 'dul zhing 'dzud de 'god par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang lam de la 'doms shing rjes su ston pa dang / 'dul zhing 'dzud de 'god par byed do //
translated: and they also instruct, teach, train, introduce, and establish others in that path.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom like that

original: thabs la mkhas pas nam du'ang bya ba ma yin pa mi byed do //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pas nam du'ang bya ba ma yin pa mi byed do //
translated: with skillful means never do what should not be done.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord!

original: gal te chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa lags na /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa lags na /
translated: If all phenomena are empty of a basic nature,

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la ni sems @163b can yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la ni sems @163b can yang mi dmigs /
translated: in emptiness of a basic nature no sentient beings are apprehended,

original: chos dang lam yang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: chos dang lam yang mi dmigs na /
translated: no phenomena and no path are apprehended,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gnas par 'gyur lags /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gnas par 'gyur lags /
translated: how will bodhisattva great beings come to abide in the knowledge of all aspects?”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One replied to the venerable Su­bhūti as follows:

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin te /🔽de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin te / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Su­bhūti, that is so!

original: ji skad smras pa de bzhin te /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said!

original: chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yin te /
translated: All phenomena are empty of a basic nature.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la ni sems can yang dmigs su med /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la ni sems can yang dmigs su med /
translated: In emptiness of a basic nature, no sentient beings are apprehended,

original: chos dang lam yang dmigs su med do //
analyzed: chos dang lam yang dmigs su med do //
translated: no phenomena and no path are apprehended.

original: rab 'byor / gal te chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa ma yin na ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa ma yin na ni /
translated: Su­bhūti, if all phenomena were not empty of a basic nature,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la gnas te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la gnas te /
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings standing in the emptiness of a basic nature

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi chos ston par yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi chos ston par yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: and teach the Dharma of the emptiness of a basic nature.

original: rab 'byor / gzugs ni rang bzhin gyis stong la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzugs ni rang bzhin gyis stong la /
translated: Subhūti, form is empty of a basic nature.

original: rab 'byor / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'ang rang bzhin gyis stong /
analyzed: rab 'byor / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'ang rang bzhin gyis stong /
translated: Subhūti, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are empty of a basic nature.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong /
translated: Up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are empty of a basic nature.

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'ang rang bzhin gyis stong /
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'ang rang bzhin gyis stong /
translated: The eighty minor signs are empty of a basic nature.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / bag chags kyi mtshams @164a *//
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / bag chags kyi mtshams @164a *//
translated: In the same way, connect this with each, up to🔽the knowledge of all aspects and the elimination of all residual impression connections.

original: sbyor ba thams cad spangs pa'i bar dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba thams cad spangs pa'i bar dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: They are empty of a basic nature.

original: rab 'byor / gang gi tshe chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang gi tshe chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: Subhūti, when all dharmas are empty of their own intrinsic nature, then bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: phung po lnga po dag rang bzhin gyis stong zhes bya bar chos ston to //
analyzed: phung po lnga po dag rang bzhin gyis stong zhes bya bar chos ston to //
translated: teach the doctrine that the five aggregates are empty of their own intrinsic nature.

original: skye mched bcu gnyis dang / khams bco brgyad rang bzhin gyis stong shes bya bar chos ston to //
analyzed: skye mched bcu gnyis dang / khams bco brgyad rang bzhin gyis stong shes bya bar chos ston to //
translated: They teach the doctrine that the twelve sense fields and the eighteen elements are empty of their own intrinsic nature.

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They teach the doctrine that the four concentrations, four immeasurables, four formless absorptions, four establishments of mindfulness, and in the same way connect this with each, up to

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dag rang bzhin gyis stong zhes bya bar chos ston to //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dag rang bzhin gyis stong zhes bya bar chos ston to //
translated: the eightfold noble path are empty of their own intrinsic nature.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
translated: the three gateways to liberation, the eight aspects of liberation, the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four forms of fearlessness, the four forms of correct and thorough knowledge,

original: byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bar dag rang bzhin gyis stong zhes bya bar chos ston to //
analyzed: byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bar dag rang bzhin gyis stong zhes bya bar chos ston to //
translated: great loving kindness, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas, up to and including the eighty minor marks.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub @164b dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor pa thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong zhes bya bar chos ston to //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub @164b dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor pa thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong zhes bya bar chos ston to //
translated: the fruit of stream enterer, the fruit of once-returner, the fruit of non-returner, the state of a worthy one, a pratyekabuddha’s awakening, the knowledge of all aspects, and all the latent propensities are empty of a basic nature.”

original: rab 'byor / gal te nang stong pa nyid rang bzhin gyis stong pa ma yin na ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur la /🔽de bzhin du phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / de bzhin du sbyar te dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dag /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te nang stong pa nyid rang bzhin gyis stong pa ma yin na ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur la / de bzhin du phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / de bzhin du sbyar te dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dag /
translated: Subhūti, if inner emptiness were not empty of a basic nature, then bodhisattva great beings would not teach the doctrine that ‘all phenomena are empty of a basic nature.’

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa ma yin na ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa ma yin na ni /
translated: Similarly, if outer emptiness, inner and outer emptiness, and so on up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature were not empty of a basic nature,🔽then bodhisattva great beings would not teach the doctrine that ‘all phenomena are empty of a basic nature.’

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong zhes bya bar chos ston par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong zhes bya bar chos ston par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: The bodhisattva great beings would not teach the Dharma saying, ‘All phenomena are empty of inherent nature.’

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang bshig par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang bshig par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: Therefore, the emptiness of inherent nature would be destroyed.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid ni 'jig par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid ni 'jig par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: However, the emptiness of inherent nature is not destroyed.

original: ther zug tu gnas pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: ther zug tu gnas pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: It does not endure permanently.

original: phyis med par 'gyur ba'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: phyis med par 'gyur ba'ang ma yin no //
translated: It does not become nonexistent later.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni yul na mi gnas /
analyzed: de ni yul na mi gnas /
translated: It does not exist in a place.

original: phyogs na mi gnas shing /🔽de ni gang nas kyang 'ong ba ma yin /
analyzed: phyogs na mi gnas shing / de ni gang nas kyang 'ong ba ma yin /
translated: It does not exist in a direction.🔽It does not come from anywhere.

original: gang du'ang 'gro ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang du'ang 'gro ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It does not go anywhere.

original: de ni chos gnas pa nyid yin te /🔽de la ni 'phel ba'am /
analyzed: de ni chos gnas pa nyid yin te / de la ni 'phel ba'am /
translated: That is the abiding nature of phenomena.🔽There is no increase or decrease

original: 'grib pa'am / sogs pa'am /🔽'jig pa'am / skye ba'am /
analyzed: 'grib pa'am / sogs pa'am / 'jig pa'am / skye ba'am /
translated: in it.🔽There is no accumulation or destruction🔽in it.

original: 'gag pa'am / kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
analyzed: 'gag pa'am / kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
translated: There is no arising or cessation🔽in it.🔽There is no defiled or pure

original: rnam par byang ba'i chos gang yang dmigs su med do //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i chos gang yang dmigs su med do //
translated: in it.

original: de ni chos rnams kyi rang bzhin yin te /🔽de la gnas nas byang chub sems @165a *//
analyzed: de ni chos rnams kyi rang bzhin yin te / de la gnas nas byang chub sems @165a *//
translated: This is the nature of phenomena.🔽Abiding in this, bodhisattva great beings

original: dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la gnas kyang /
analyzed: dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la gnas kyang /
translated: abide in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: chos gang yang 'jug par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: chos gang yang 'jug par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: But they do not see any phenomenon that engages.

original: chos thams cad ni gnas pa'ang med cing 'jug pa med pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni gnas pa'ang med cing 'jug pa med pa ste /
translated: All phenomena are without abiding and without engagement.

original: de ni chos rnams kyi chos gnas pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni chos rnams kyi chos gnas pa nyid yin no //
translated: This is the abiding of phenomena.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: Therefore, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong par mthong bas /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong par mthong bas /
translated: seeing all phenomena as empty of a basic nature,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog go /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog go /
translated: do not turn back from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar des chos gang la'ang sgrib pa'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar des chos gang la'ang sgrib pa'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: It is because they do not see any phenomenon that is an obscuration.

original: des chos thams cad sgrib pa med par yang dag par rjes su mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des chos thams cad sgrib pa med par yang dag par rjes su mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they see all phenomena as they truly are, without obscuration.

original: de ni 'di ltar rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid de la bdag mi dmigs shing /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid de la bdag mi dmigs shing /
translated: “In this way, they do not observe a self in the emptiness of inherent nature.

original: bdag tu gdags pa'ang mi dmigs la /🔽sems can dang / srog dang / skye ba po dang / shed las skyes dang / shed bu dang / gso ba po dang / gang zag dang / byed pa po dang / byed du 'jug pa po dang / slong ba po dang / kun nas slong ba po dang /
analyzed: bdag tu gdags pa'ang mi dmigs la / sems can dang / srog dang / skye ba po dang / shed las skyes dang / shed bu dang / gso ba po dang / gang zag dang / byed pa po dang / byed du 'jug pa po dang / slong ba po dang / kun nas slong ba po dang /
translated: They do not observe the designation of a self.

original: tshor ba po dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po'ang mi dmigs /
analyzed: tshor ba po dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po'ang mi dmigs /
translated: They do not observe a sentient being, a living being, a creature, one born of Manu, a child of Manu, one who lives, an individual, one who does, one who makes happen, one who feels, one who knows, or one who sees.

original: mthong ba por gdags pa'ang mi dmigs /
analyzed: mthong ba por gdags pa'ang mi dmigs /
translated: They do not observe the designation of one who sees.

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'ang mi dmigs /
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'ang mi dmigs /
translated: They do not observe form, feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness.

original: rnam par shes @165b par gdags pa'ang mi dmigs /
analyzed: rnam par shes @165b par gdags pa'ang mi dmigs /
translated: They do not observe the designation of consciousness.

original: de bzhin du nang dang phyi'i chos rnams kyang mi dmigs /
analyzed: de bzhin du nang dang phyi'i chos rnams kyang mi dmigs /
translated: In the same way, they do not observe inner and outer phenomena.

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bar dag kyang mi dmigs /
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bar dag kyang mi dmigs /
translated: up to the eighty minor signs are not apprehended,

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cur gdags pa'ang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cur gdags pa'ang mi dmigs na /
translated: and even the designation of the eighty minor signs is not apprehended,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la the tshom zab bar 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la the tshom zab bar 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: how could there be any doubt about unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?”

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pas sprul pa'i dge slong ngam /🔽dge slong ma'am /
analyzed: dper na / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pas sprul pa'i dge slong ngam / dge slong ma'am /
translated: for example, a tathāgata emanation teaches the doctrine continuously for quintillions of eons to an emanated bhikṣu,🔽bhikṣuṇī,🔽upāsaka,

original: dge bsnyen nam /🔽dge bsnyen ma zhig la bskal pa khrag khrig snyed du rgyun ma chad par chos bstan par gyur na /
analyzed: dge bsnyen nam / dge bsnyen ma zhig la bskal pa khrag khrig snyed du rgyun ma chad par chos bstan par gyur na /
translated: or upāsikā.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: Subhūti, what do you think?

original: sprul pa de dag la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'thob pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: sprul pa de dag la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'thob pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: Would those emanations obtain the result of stream enterer, the result of once-returner,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid 'thob pa'am /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid 'thob pa'am /
translated: the result of non-returner, or the state of a worthy one,

original: rang byang chub bam /
analyzed: rang byang chub bam /
translated: or a pratyekabuddha’s awakening,🔽or unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?”

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'thob pa'i skal ba yod snyam mam /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'thob pa'i skal ba yod snyam mam /
translated: Do you think that they have the good fortune to attain unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

original: de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma lags so //
translated: they do not.”

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de dag la dngos po ma mchis pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag la dngos po ma mchis pa'i slad du'o //
translated: It is because they do not have any substance.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: The Blessed One said, “Subhūti,

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: it is so, it is so.

original: chos thams cad dngos po med pa la /
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po med pa la /
translated: All phenomena are without substance.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang zhig rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang zhig rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: Subhūti, what sentient beings would bodhisattva great beings lead to the result of stream enterer,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: the result of once-returner,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /🔽@166a *// dgra bcom pa nyid dam /🔽rang byang chub bam /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am / @166a *// dgra bcom pa nyid dam / rang byang chub bam /
translated: the result of non-returner,🔽the state of a worthy one,🔽the state of a pratyekabuddha,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la gzung bar bya ba'i sems can gang zhig yod pa de /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la gzung bar bya ba'i sems can gang zhig yod pa de /
translated: or unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?

original: gzhan du na phyin ci log gis kun nas dkris pa'i skye dgu rnams phyin ci log med pa la 'dzud cing 'god par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan du na phyin ci log gis kun nas dkris pa'i skye dgu rnams phyin ci log med pa la 'dzud cing 'god par byed do //
translated: Otherwise, he would lead and establish beings who are completely bound by error in the absence of error.

original: rtog pa'i rgyu mthun pa yin pa'i phyir phyin ci log gang yin pa de nyid phyin ci log ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: rtog pa'i rgyu mthun pa yin pa'i phyir phyin ci log gang yin pa de nyid phyin ci log ma yin pa ste /
translated: Because it is the natural outcome of conceptual thought, error itself is non-error.

original: rtog pa med cing phyin ci log med pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa med cing phyin ci log med pa'o //
translated: It is free from conceptual thought and error.

original: gang la phyin ci log med pa de la ni bdag med do //
analyzed: gang la phyin ci log med pa de la ni bdag med do //
translated: For one who is free from error, there is no self.

original: sems can med do //
analyzed: sems can med do //
translated: There are no sentient beings.

original: shes pa po dang / mthong ba bo'i bar dag med do //
analyzed: shes pa po dang / mthong ba bo'i bar dag med do //
translated: There is no one who knows and sees up to the one who directly experiences.

original: de la ni gzugs med do //
analyzed: de la ni gzugs med do //
translated: There is no form.

original: tshor ba med do //
analyzed: tshor ba med do //
translated: There is no feeling.

original: 'du shes med do //
analyzed: 'du shes med do //
translated: There is no conception.

original: 'du byed rnams med do //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams med do //
translated: There are no formations.

original: rnam par shes pa med do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa med do //
translated: There is no consciousness.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same way,

original: byang chub kyi bar dag med do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi bar dag med do //
translated: there is no enlightenment.

original: gang la bdag med pa dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po'i bar dag med pa dang / gzugs med pa dang / tshor ba med pa dang / 'du shes med pa dang / 'du byed rnams med pa dang / rnam par shes pa med pa dang /
analyzed: gang la bdag med pa dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po'i bar dag med pa dang / gzugs med pa dang / tshor ba med pa dang / 'du shes med pa dang / 'du byed rnams med pa dang / rnam par shes pa med pa dang /
translated: It is the emptiness of inherent nature that there is no self, up to and no one who knows and sees, no form, no feeling, no perception, no volitional factors, and no consciousness,

original: byang chub kyi bar dag med pa de ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi bar dag med pa de ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yin te /
translated: up to and no awakening.

original: de la gnas nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: de la gnas nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: Abiding in that, bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: sems can phyin ci log tu gyur ba rnams /
analyzed: sems can phyin ci log tu gyur ba rnams /
translated: They liberate sentient beings who have gone wrong

original: sems can gyi 'du shes las grol bar byed do /
analyzed: sems can gyi 'du shes las grol bar byed do /
translated: from the notion of sentient beings.

original: @166b gzugs kyi 'du shes dang / gzugs med pa'i 'du shes kyi bar dag las grol bar byed do //🔽de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: @166b gzugs kyi 'du shes dang / gzugs med pa'i 'du shes kyi bar dag las grol bar byed do // de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They liberate them from the notion of form, up to the notion of the formless.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams las rnam par grol bar byed do //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams las rnam par grol bar byed do //
translated: In the same way, they liberate them from all phenomena, whether with defilements or without defilements.

original: zag pa med pa'i chos gang yin pa de dag kyang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos gang yin pa de dag kyang 'di lta ste /
translated: Those dharmas that are uncontaminated are as follows:

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
translated: the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four legs of supernatural power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven factors of awakening, the eightfold noble path,

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag ste /
translated: the four formless absorptions, up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: de'ang de la don dam pa ji lta ba bzhin du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'ang de la don dam pa ji lta ba bzhin du ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, they are not the ultimate just as it is.

original: de ltar 'dus ma byas pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa de ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'dus ma byas pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa de ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, that which is unconditioned, unborn, insubstantial, and non-arisen is the emptiness of inherent nature.

original: de ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub yin te de la ni bdag med do //
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub yin te de la ni bdag med do //
translated: That is the awakening of the blessed buddhas, and in that there is no self,

original: sems can med do //
analyzed: sems can med do //
translated: there is no sentient being,

original: shes pa po dang / mthong ba bo'i bar dag med do //
analyzed: shes pa po dang / mthong ba bo'i bar dag med do //
translated: There is no one who knows, up to no one who sees.

original: gzugs med do //🔽tshor ba med do //
analyzed: gzugs med do // tshor ba med do //
translated: There is no form.

original: 'du shes med do //
analyzed: 'du shes med do //
translated: There is no feeling, no perception, no volitional factors, and no consciousness.🔽In the same way, there is no eye, up to no mind.🔽There is no ignorance, up to no old age and death.🔽There is no suffering, no origin, no cessation, and no path.🔽There is no fruit of the stream-enterer, no fruit of the once-returner, no fruit of the non-returner, no fruit of the worthy one, and no pratyekabuddha’s awakening.🔽There is no awakening of the bodhisattva, and there is no awakening of the Buddha.🔽There is no perfection of giving, up to no perfection of wisdom.🔽There is no emptiness, up to no marklessness.🔽There is no conditioned, and there is no unconditioned.🔽There is no Buddha, and there is no Dharma.

original: 'du byed rnams med do //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams med do //
translated: There is no Saṅgha.🔽There is no world, and there is no world beyond.🔽There is no mother, and there is no father.🔽There is no sentient being, and there is no life-force.🔽There is no human, and there is no person.🔽There is no self, and there is no other.🔽There is no one who gives, no one who takes, and no one who fulfills.🔽There is no one who practices, and there is no one who perfects.🔽There is no one who knows, and there is no one who sees.🔽There is no form.

original: rnam par shes pa med do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa med do //
translated: There is no feeling, no perception, no volitional factors, and no consciousness.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same way, there is no eye, up to no mind.

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bar dag med do //🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yongs su shes par bya ba'i don ma @167a *//
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bar dag med do // byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yongs su shes par bya ba'i don ma @167a *//
translated: There is no ignorance, up to no old age and death.🔽There is no suffering, no origin, no cessation, and no path.

original: gtogs par lam gyi don du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la gnas par mi byed do //
analyzed: gtogs par lam gyi don du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la gnas par mi byed do //
translated: There is no fruit of the stream-enterer, no fruit of the once-returner, no fruit of the non-returner, no fruit of the worthy one, and no pratyekabuddha’s awakening.

original: gang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid de'ang sngon gyi mthar yang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yin la /🔽de ni phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus su'ang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid de'ang sngon gyi mthar yang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yin la / de ni phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus su'ang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yin te /
translated: There is no awakening of the bodhisattva, and there is no awakening of the Buddha.🔽There is no perfection of giving, up to no perfection of wisdom.🔽There is no emptiness, up to no marklessness.🔽There is no conditioned, and there is no unconditioned.

original: de ni nam yang rang bzhin gyis mi stong pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni nam yang rang bzhin gyis mi stong pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: There is no Buddha,

original: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas sems can rnams sems can du 'du shes pa dang / 'du shes thams cad las dgrol ba'i phyir lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la spyod par byed do //
analyzed: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas sems can rnams sems can du 'du shes pa dang / 'du shes thams cad las dgrol ba'i phyir lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la spyod par byed do //
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings standing in the perfection of the emptiness of a basic nature practice the knowledge of path aspects in order to liberate beings from the perception of beings and from all perceptions.

original: de lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la spyod pa'i tshe /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la spyod pa'i tshe / 'di lta ste /
translated: When they practice the knowledge of path aspects,🔽they practice all the paths,

original: nyan thos kyi lam dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lam dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lam dang / lam thams cad la'ang spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi lam dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lam dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lam dang / lam thams cad la'ang spyod pa yin no //
translated: that is to say, the śrāvaka path, the pratyekabuddha path, the bodhisattva path, and all paths.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byas nas sems can rnams yongs su smin par byas shing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byas nas sems can rnams yongs su smin par byas shing /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings, having completed all the paths, having brought beings to maturity,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byas te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byas te /
translated: and having purified a buddhafield,

original: tshe'i 'du byed byin gyis brlabs nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: tshe'i 'du byed byin gyis brlabs nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: and having blessed the constituents of life, they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par @167b sangs rgyas nas kyang /
analyzed: de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par @167b sangs rgyas nas kyang /
translated: And having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: sangs rgyas kyi tshul rgyun mi gcod de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi tshul rgyun mi gcod de /
translated: they do not cut off the way of the buddhas.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi tshul yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi tshul yin no //
translated: This emptiness of inherent existence is the way of the buddhas, the lord buddhas.

original: rab 'byor / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag 'das pa'i dus na byung bar gyur ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi sangs rgyas kyi tshul yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag 'das pa'i dus na byung bar gyur ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi sangs rgyas kyi tshul yang 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, the way of the buddhas, the lord buddhas who have appeared in the past is also like this:

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid 'di yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid 'di yin no //
translated: it is this emptiness of inherent existence.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ba rnams dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag de ltar phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na bzhugs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ba rnams dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag de ltar phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na bzhugs te /
translated: The Bhagavān buddhas who will appear in the future,🔽and the Bhagavān buddhas who are now present, dwelling and existing in the world in the ten directions, teaching the Dharma—

original: 'tsho zhing gzhes la chos kyang ston pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi sangs rgyas kyi tshul yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'tsho zhing gzhes la chos kyang ston pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi sangs rgyas kyi tshul yang 'di lta ste /
translated: the way of the buddhas of those Bhagavān buddhas is this:

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid 'di yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid 'di yin te /
translated: it is the emptiness of inherent nature.🔽Except for this emptiness of inherent nature, which comes from the Bhagavān buddhas,

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams las 'byung ba ma gtogs par gzhan las 'jig rten du 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams las 'byung ba ma gtogs par gzhan las 'jig rten du 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas na /
translated: no other way of the buddhas would appear in the world.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar spyad na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba de ltar rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar spyad na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba de ltar rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, bodhisattva great beings should practice the perfection of the emptiness of inherent nature in such a way that they do not regress from the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol ba /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol ba /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la'ang spyod la /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la'ang spyod la /
translated: thus bodhisattva great beings practice within the emptiness of inherent existence,

original: gzugs @168a *// kyang gzhan zhing /
analyzed: gzugs @168a *// kyang gzhan zhing /
translated: but form is not one thing

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyang gzhan ma lags /🔽tshor ba'ang gzhan /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyang gzhan ma lags / tshor ba'ang gzhan /

original: 'du shes kyang gzhan /
analyzed: 'du shes kyang gzhan /
translated: perception is not one thing,

original: 'du byed rnams kyang gzhan /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyang gzhan /
translated: mental formations are not one thing,

original: rnam par shes pa'ang gzhan zhing /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'ang gzhan zhing /
translated: and consciousness is not one thing

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyang gzhan ma lags la /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyang gzhan ma lags la /
translated: and the emptiness of inherent existence another;

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad dang / byang chub kyi bar dag kyang gzhan zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad dang / byang chub kyi bar dag kyang gzhan zhing /
translated: and likewise, all the buddhadharmas and even awakening are not one thing

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyang gzhan ma lags te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyang gzhan ma lags te /
translated: and the emptiness of inherent existence another.

original: gzugs nyid kyang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid lags la /
analyzed: gzugs nyid kyang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid lags la /
translated: Form itself is the emptiness of inherent existence,🔽and

original: rang bzhin gyi stong pa nyid kyang gzugs lags shing byang chub kyi bar nyid kyang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid lags la /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi stong pa nyid kyang gzugs lags shing byang chub kyi bar nyid kyang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid lags la /
translated: Form is also the emptiness of inherent nature, and awakening is also the emptiness of inherent nature.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyang byang chub lags par rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid de'ang rnam par 'khrugs pa mi bgyid pa de ni ngo mtshar lags so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyang byang chub lags par rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid de'ang rnam par 'khrugs pa mi bgyid pa de ni ngo mtshar lags so //
translated: That the emptiness of inherent nature does not disturb that emptiness of inherent nature is indeed amazing!🔽The Lord having said that, the venerable Su­bhūti then said to him, “Lord, it is amazing how the emptiness of inherent nature does not disturb the emptiness of inherent nature!”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //🔽rab 'byor / gal te gzugs kyang gzhan la /
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to // rab 'byor / gal te gzugs kyang gzhan la /

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyang gzhan /🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'ang gzhan la; rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyang gzhan zhing /🔽de bzhin du sbyar te /🔽byang chub kyi bar yang gzhan la /

translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Su­bhūti then said to him, “Lord, it is amazing how the emptiness of inherent nature does not disturb

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyang gzhan zhig yin par gyur na @168b ni; rab 'byor /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyang gzhan zhig yin par gyur na @168b ni; rab 'byor /
translated: If emptiness were one thing and form another,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gzugs rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gzugs rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings would not fully awaken to the knowledge of all aspects through form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'ang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'ang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: They would not fully awaken to the knowledge of all aspects through feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: byang chub kyi bar dag kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na /🔽rab 'byor / 'di ltar gzugs nyid kyang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: byang chub kyi bar dag kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na / rab 'byor / 'di ltar gzugs nyid kyang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yin la /
translated: They would not fully awaken to the knowledge of all aspects through , up to and including awakening.🔽Subhūti, it is because form itself is emptiness.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyang gzugs yin /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyang gzugs yin /
translated: Emptiness itself is form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'ang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'ang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yin la /
translated: feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are emptiness by nature,

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyang rnam par shes pa nyid yin /🔽byang chub kyi bar dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyang rnam par shes pa nyid yin / byang chub kyi bar dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yin la /
translated: and emptiness by nature is consciousness.🔽Up to enlightenment is emptiness by nature,

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyang byang chub nyid yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyang byang chub nyid yin te /
translated: and emptiness by nature is enlightenment.

original: de'i phyir rab 'byor /
analyzed: de'i phyir rab 'byor /
translated: Therefore, Subhūti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gzugs rang bzhin gyis stong par rig nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gzugs rang bzhin gyis stong par rig nas /
translated: bodhisattva great beings, having understood that form is empty by nature,

original: gzugs nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: awaken to form itself as the knowledge of all aspects.

original: byang chub kyi bar du'ang rang bzhin gyis stong par rig nas /
analyzed: byang chub kyi bar du'ang rang bzhin gyis stong par rig nas /
translated: Having understood that up to enlightenment is empty by nature,

original: byang chub nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar @169a *//
analyzed: byang chub nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar @169a *//
translated: they awaken to enlightenment itself as the knowledge of all aspects.

original: 'gyur ro // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la ni rnam par 'jig pa'am /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la ni rnam par 'jig pa'am /
translated: Because in emptiness there is no form, no feeling, no perception, no volitional formations, no consciousness;

original: ther zug tu gnas pa'am /
analyzed: ther zug tu gnas pa'am /
translated: no eye, no ear, no nose, no tongue, no body, no mind;

original: 'jig par 'gyur ba'i chos gang yang med pa'i phyir ro //🔽gzhan du na lha dang bcas pa dang / bdud dang bcas pa dang / tshangs pa dang bcas pa dang / dge sbyong dang / bram ze'i skye dgu dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis gzugs yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes so //
analyzed: 'jig par 'gyur ba'i chos gang yang med pa'i phyir ro // gzhan du na lha dang bcas pa dang / bdud dang bcas pa dang / tshangs pa dang bcas pa dang / dge sbyong dang / bram ze'i skye dgu dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis gzugs yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes so //
translated: no form, no sound, no smell, no taste, no texture, no mental object;🔽no visual consciousness, no auditory consciousness, no olfactory consciousness, no gustatory consciousness, no tactile consciousness, no mental consciousness;

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes so //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes so //
translated: no ignorance, no ending of ignorance, and so on up to🔽no aging and death, no ending of aging and death;🔽no suffering, origin, cessation, path, no wisdom, no attainment, and also no non-attainment.🔽Therefore, monks, because of the non-attainment of all wholesome and unwholesome dharmas, you have attained nirvana.

original: rab tu mi shes pas byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams gzugs la mngon par zhen to //
analyzed: rab tu mi shes pas byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams gzugs la mngon par zhen to //
translated: You should teach the Dharma to others in this way.🔽The Buddha said: Subhuti, do you see this Dharma?🔽Subhuti replied: I do not see this Dharma, Blessed One.🔽I do not see this Dharma, Sugata.🔽Why is that?🔽The Blessed One has said that all dharmas are unproduced.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la mngon par zhen to //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la mngon par zhen to //
translated: What is unproduced cannot be seen, cannot be heard, cannot be discerned, cannot be cognized.🔽Therefore, Blessed One, I do not see this Dharma, Sugata.

original: gzugs la mngon par zhen cing /
analyzed: gzugs la mngon par zhen cing /
translated: I do not see this Dharma, Blessed One.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la mngon par zhen nas ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa dag la spyod par byed de /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la mngon par zhen nas ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa dag la spyod par byed de /
translated: They are attached to feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness, and they engage in the grasping of ‘I’ and ‘mine.’

original: de dag ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa dag la mngon par zhen nas kyang /
analyzed: de dag ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa dag la mngon par zhen nas kyang /
translated: They are attached to the grasping of ‘I’ and ‘mine.’

original: nang dang phyi'i dngos po rnams la mngon par zhen to //
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i dngos po rnams la mngon par zhen to //
translated: They are attached to internal and external things.

original: mngon par zhen nas kyang skye ba'i skye mched dag tu gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su 'dzin par byed de /
analyzed: mngon par zhen nas kyang skye ba'i skye mched dag tu gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su 'dzin par byed de /
translated: Being attached, they grasp form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness in the places of rebirth.

original: de dag ni @169b skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khugs pa dag las yongs su mi 'grol zhing /
analyzed: de dag ni @169b skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khugs pa dag las yongs su mi 'grol zhing /
translated: They are not liberated from birth, aging, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, dejection, and anguish.

original: 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba las kyang yongs su mi thar ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba las kyang yongs su mi thar ro //
translated: They are not liberated from the five forms of life in saṃsāra.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas stong zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas stong zhes bya ba'am /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, standing in the perfection of the emptiness of inherent nature, does not consider whether phenomena are empty or not empty.

original: mi stong zhes bya bar gzugs rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed do //🔽stong zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: mi stong zhes bya bar gzugs rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed do // stong zhes bya ba'am /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, standing in the perfection of the emptiness of inherent nature, does not disturb form by saying ‘empty’ or ‘not empty.’

original: mi stong zhes bya bar tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed do //
analyzed: mi stong zhes bya bar tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed do //
translated: He does not disturb feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness by saying ‘empty’ or ‘not empty.’

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /🔽stong zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te / stong zhes bya ba'am /
translated: He does not disturb, up to

original: mi stong zhes bya bar byang chub kyi bar du rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed do //
analyzed: mi stong zhes bya bar byang chub kyi bar du rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed do //
translated: enlightenment by saying ‘empty’ or ‘not empty.’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ni gzugs so //
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs so //
translated: This is form.

original: 'di ni stong pa nyid do zhes gzugs kyi stong pa nyid rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed cing /
analyzed: 'di ni stong pa nyid do zhes gzugs kyi stong pa nyid rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed cing /
translated: He does not disturb the emptiness of form by saying ‘this is form’ or ‘this is emptiness.’

original: 'di ni rnam par shes pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par shes pa'i bar ro //
translated: This is consciousness.

original: 'di ni rnam par shes pa'i stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par shes pa'i stong pa nyid do //
translated: This is the emptiness of consciousness.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: He does not disturb, up to🔽enlightenment by saying ‘this is enlightenment’ or ‘this is emptiness.’

original: 'di ni byang chub kyi bar ro //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub kyi bar ro //
translated: This is the enlightenment.

original: 'di ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid do zhes rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid do zhes rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the emptiness of intrinsic nature.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / nam mkhas ni nam mkha' rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed de /🔽nang gi nam mkhas kyang phyi rol gyi nam mkha' rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed la /🔽phyi rol gyi nam mkhas kyang @170a *//
analyzed: dper na / nam mkhas ni nam mkha' rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed de / nang gi nam mkhas kyang phyi rol gyi nam mkha' rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed la / phyi rol gyi nam mkhas kyang @170a *//
translated: space does not disturb space.🔽The space within does not disturb the space without,

original: nang gi nam mkha' rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed do //
analyzed: nang gi nam mkha' rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed do //
translated: and the space without does not disturb the space within.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyis kyang gzugs rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed la /🔽gzugs kyis kyang stong pa nyid rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed do //
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyis kyang gzugs rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed la / gzugs kyis kyang stong pa nyid rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed do //
translated: Subhūti, in the same way, the emptiness of intrinsic nature does not disturb form,🔽and form does not disturb emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyis kyang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis kyang /
translated: Emptiness does not disturb🔽feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed la /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed la /
translated: and

original: rnam par shes pas kyang stong pa nyid rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pas kyang stong pa nyid rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed do //
translated: and emptiness does not disturb consciousness.

original: stong pa nyid kyis kyang byang chub kyi bar du rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed la; byang chub kyi bar gyis kyang stong pa nyid rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis kyang byang chub kyi bar du rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed la; byang chub kyi bar gyis kyang stong pa nyid rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed do //
translated: And emptiness does not disturb awakening, up to and including awakening, and awakening does not disturb emptiness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: de dag la 'di ni gzugs so //
analyzed: de dag la 'di ni gzugs so //
translated: Because in them, this is form,

original: 'di ni stong pa nyid do zhes bya ba dang / 'di ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni stong pa nyid do zhes bya ba dang / 'di ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: this is emptiness, this is feeling, this is perception, this is volitional factors, this is consciousness,

original: 'di ni stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni stong pa nyid do //
translated: this is emptiness,

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: and similarly, connect this with each,

original: 'di ni byang chub kyi bar ro //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub kyi bar ro //
translated: this is up to and including awakening,

original: 'di ni stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni stong pa nyid do //
translated: this is emptiness.

original: zhes gang rnam par 'khrugs par byed pa de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gang rnam par 'khrugs par byed pa de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not have that kind of essential nature.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti said to him,🔽“Lord, if all phenomena are empty,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gal te chos thams cad dbyer ma mchis pa lags na /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad dbyer ma mchis pa lags na /
translated: if all phenomena are indivisible,

original: bcom ldan 'das 'o na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bdag @170b bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bgyi'o zhes gang la yang dag par zhugs pa lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'o na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bdag @170b bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bgyi'o zhes gang la yang dag par zhugs pa lags /
translated: then, Blessed One, how is it that bodhisattva great beings set out, thinking, ‘I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening’?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub ni gnyis su dbyer ma mchis pa lags te /
analyzed: byang chub ni gnyis su dbyer ma mchis pa lags te /
translated: awakening is indivisible.

original: gnyis su 'byed pas ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar rngo mi thogs lags so //
analyzed: gnyis su 'byed pas ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar rngo mi thogs lags so //
translated: Those who divide it cannot fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said!🔽Subhūti, awakening is not practiced dualistically.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub ni gnyis la spyod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub ni gnyis la spyod pa ma yin te /
translated: Awakening is nondual and indivisible.”🔽“Blessed One,

original: byang chub ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med do //
analyzed: byang chub ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med do //
translated: if awakening is nondual and indivisible,🔽how can bodhisattva great beings set out, thinking, ‘I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening’?🔽Blessed One,🔽if awakening is indivisible,🔽how can bodhisattva great beings set out, thinking, ‘I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening’?🔽Blessed One,🔽if awakening is nondual,🔽how can bodhisattva great beings set out, thinking, ‘I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening’?🔽Blessed One,🔽if awakening is indivisible and nondual,🔽how can bodhisattva great beings set out, thinking, ‘I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening’?

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: Subhuti : This enlightenment, O Lord, is the enlightenment of a Bodhisattva.🔽

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub bo zhes byang chub la gnyis su dbye bas mi spyod do //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub bo zhes byang chub la gnyis su dbye bas mi spyod do //
translated: “Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being’s awakening is not practiced by dividing awakening into two, thinking, ‘This is the bodhisattva, and this is the bodhisattva’s awakening.’

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub ni gzugs la mi spyod do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub ni gzugs la mi spyod do //
translated: The bodhisattva great being’s awakening is not practiced in relation to form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la mi spyod do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la mi spyod do //
translated: It is not practiced in relation to feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: byang chub kyi bar la mi spyod do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi bar la mi spyod do //
translated: It is not practiced in relation to awakening.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: byang chub la ni bdag ces bya ba'i sgra med de /
analyzed: byang chub la ni bdag ces bya ba'i sgra med de /
translated: Because the word ‘self’ does not exist in awakening.

original: bdag gzugs la spyod do zhes bya ba dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la spyod do zhes bya ba dang / byang chub kyi bar la spyod do zhes bya ba'i sgra med pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag gzugs la spyod do zhes bya ba dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la spyod do zhes bya ba dang / byang chub kyi bar la spyod do zhes bya ba'i sgra med pa yin te /
translated: The words ‘I practice in relation to form,’ ‘I practice in relation to feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness,’ and ‘I practice in relation to awakening’ do not exist.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' @171a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' @171a *//
translated: Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara🔽

original: chen po'i byang chub ni 'dzin pa la'ang mi spyod /
analyzed: chen po'i byang chub ni 'dzin pa la'ang mi spyod /
translated: The enlightenment of bodhisattva great beings does not engage with grasping,

original: 'dzin pa med pa la'ang mi spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dzin pa med pa la'ang mi spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: nor does it engage with non-grasping.”

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti asked him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub 'dzin pa la'ang mi spyod /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub 'dzin pa la'ang mi spyod /
translated: if the enlightenment of bodhisattva great beings does not engage with grasping,

original: 'dzin pa ma mchis pa la'ang mi spyod lags na /
analyzed: 'dzin pa ma mchis pa la'ang mi spyod lags na /
translated: nor does it engage with non-grasping,

original: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub gang la spyod pa lags /
analyzed: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub gang la spyod pa lags /
translated: then what will bodhisattva great beings’ enlightenment engage with?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: “What do you think, Subhūti?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'i byang chub 'dzin pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'i byang chub 'dzin pa'am /
translated: Will the enlightenment of a tathāgata emanation engage with grasping or

original: 'dzin pa med pa gang zhig la spyod snyam mam /
analyzed: 'dzin pa med pa gang zhig la spyod snyam mam /
translated: non-grasping?”🔽He replied,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: de ni ma lags so; ;bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de ni ma lags so; ;bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Subhūti, what do you think?

original: dgra bcom pa'i rmi lam gyi blo 'dzin pa'am /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i rmi lam gyi blo 'dzin pa'am /
translated: Is it the mind of an arhat in a dream

original: 'dzin pa med pa gang zhig la spyod snyam mam /
analyzed: 'dzin pa med pa gang zhig la spyod snyam mam /
translated: that engages with something or does not engage with anything?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

original: de ni ma lags te /
analyzed: de ni ma lags te /
translated: it is not.

original: dgra bcom pa la g-yar lam yang gtan ma mchis lags na /🔽de'i g-yar lam gyi blo 'dzin pa'am /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa la g-yar lam yang gtan ma mchis lags na / de'i g-yar lam gyi blo 'dzin pa'am /
translated: Since arhats do not even have dreams,🔽how could the mind of an arhat in a dream

original: 'dzin pa ma mchis pa la spyod par 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
analyzed: 'dzin pa ma mchis pa la spyod par 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
translated: engage with something or not engage with anything?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyang 'dzin pa'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyang 'dzin pa'am /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: 'dzin @171b pa med pa la mi spyod do //
analyzed: 'dzin @171b pa med pa la mi spyod do //
translated: “Subhūti, in the same way, the awakening of bodhisattva great beings does not engage with something or not engage with anything.”

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: When this was said, the venerable Subhūti asked the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub 'dzin pa la'ang mi spyod /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub 'dzin pa la'ang mi spyod /
translated: If bodhisattva great beings do not practice with respect to the grasping of awakening,

original: 'dzin pa ma mchis pa la'ang mi spyod /
analyzed: 'dzin pa ma mchis pa la'ang mi spyod /
translated: do not practice with respect to the non-grasping of awakening,

original: gzugs la'ang mi spyod /
analyzed: gzugs la'ang mi spyod /
translated: do not practice with respect to form,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la'ang mi spyod lags na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la'ang mi spyod lags na /
translated: and do not practice with respect to , up to and including omniscience,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'o na ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad nas /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad nas /
translated: then how do bodhisattva great beings, having practiced the six perfections,

original: sa bcu dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stong pa nyid bcu bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / rnam par thar pa rnams dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la spyod cing de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang /
analyzed: sa bcu dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stong pa nyid bcu bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / rnam par thar pa rnams dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la spyod cing de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang /
translated: practice the ten grounds, the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the fourteen emptinesses, the three doors of liberation, the concentrations, the deliverances, and the absorptions, and accomplish the ten tathāgata powers,

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bar dag bsgrubs te /
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bar dag bsgrubs te /
translated: up to and including the eighty minor marks?

original: mngon par shes pa lnga la gnas nas /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga la gnas nas /
