translated: Having stood in the five clairvoyances,

original: sa bcu yongs su rdzogs par bgyis shing byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis pa la zhugs nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bgyis shing /
analyzed: sa bcu yongs su rdzogs par bgyis shing byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis pa la zhugs nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bgyis shing /
translated: Having completed the ten grounds, having entered into the faultlessness of a bodhisattva, having purified a buddhafield,

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin par bgyis te /
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin par bgyis te /
translated: and having brought beings to maturity,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur lags /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur lags /
translated: they will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.”

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la ma spyad cing sa bcu la ma gsal /🔽mngon par shes pa lnga'i @172a *//
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la ma spyad cing sa bcu la ma gsal / mngon par shes pa lnga'i @172a *//
translated: without practicing the six perfections, without illuminating the ten grounds,

original: bar dag la ma gnas /
analyzed: bar dag la ma gnas /
translated: without abiding in the five superknowledges,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis pa la ma zhugs /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis pa la ma zhugs /
translated: without entering the faultlessness of a bodhisattva,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par ma bgyis /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par ma bgyis /
translated: without purifying a buddhafield,

original: sems can yongs su smin par ma bgyis par ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar rngo mi thogs lags so //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par ma bgyis par ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar rngo mi thogs lags so //
translated: and without bringing beings to maturity, it is impossible to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti, it is so.

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin te /🔽de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin te / de de bzhin no //
translated: Subhuti: So it is, O Lord, so it is, O Well-Gone.

original: ji skad smras pa de bzhin te /🔽sa bcu la ma gnas shing pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi bar dag yongs su rdzogs par ma byas par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus gyi /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de bzhin te / sa bcu la ma gnas shing pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi bar dag yongs su rdzogs par ma byas par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus gyi /
translated: The Lord: So it is, Subhuti, so it is.🔽As you say, Subhuti, it is impossible that a Bodhisattva, a great being should win full enlightenment without having stood in the ten stages, without having fulfilled the six perfections and all the other dharmas of a Buddha.

original: rab 'byor / sa bcu yongs su rdzogs par byas shing pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sa bcu yongs su rdzogs par byas shing pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang /
translated: But, Subhuti, it is possible that a Bodhisattva, a great being who has stood in the ten stages, who has fulfilled the six perfections and all the other dharmas of a Buddha, should win full enlightenment.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum po stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bar dag dang / bsnyel pa mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum po stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bar dag dang / bsnyel pa mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid dang /
translated: signlessness, and wishlessness, up to the eighty minor marks, the nature of being without error,

original: rtag tu btang snyoms su gnas pa dag yongs su rdzogs par byas na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par nus so //
analyzed: rtag tu btang snyoms su gnas pa dag yongs su rdzogs par byas na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par nus so //
translated: and the constant abiding in equanimity, then they will be able to attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor / @172b de'ang gzugs kyi rang bzhin la gnas shing tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin la gnas la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / @172b de'ang gzugs kyi rang bzhin la gnas shing tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin la gnas la /
translated: “Subhūti, moreover, if they stand in the nature of form, stand in the nature of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness,

original: byang chub kyi bar gyi rang bzhin la gnas na /
analyzed: byang chub kyi bar gyi rang bzhin la gnas na /
translated: and stand in the nature of , up to awakening,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par nus so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par nus so //
translated: then they will be able to attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rang bzhin de'ang nye bar zhi ba ste /🔽de ni chos gang yang sogs pa'am /
analyzed: rang bzhin de'ang nye bar zhi ba ste / de ni chos gang yang sogs pa'am /
translated: That nature is also completely calm.🔽It is not the accumulation of any dharma,

original: 'bri ba'am / bskyed pa'am /
analyzed: 'bri ba'am / bskyed pa'am /
translated: nor is it a decrease,

original: 'gog pa'am / kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
analyzed: 'gog pa'am / kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
translated: nor does he make a distinction between the cessation of the compounded and the non-cessation of the uncompounded,

original: rnam par byang ba'am /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'am /
translated: nor does he make a distinction between defilement and purification,

original: 'thob pa'am / mngon par rtogs par mi byed do //🔽rab 'byor / de'ang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis btags pa'i chos nyid nye bar bzung nas /
analyzed: 'thob pa'am / mngon par rtogs par mi byed do // rab 'byor / de'ang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis btags pa'i chos nyid nye bar bzung nas /
translated: nor does he make a distinction between attainment and realization.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar zad kyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar zad kyi /
translated: Subhūti, this is because the bodhisattva great beings have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by taking up the reality-limit that is designated by the conventional usage of the world.

original: don dam par ni de la gzugs sam /
analyzed: don dam par ni de la gzugs sam /
translated: In the ultimate sense, however, there is no form,

original: byang chub kyi bar ram /
analyzed: byang chub kyi bar ram /
translated: up to no awakening,

original: gang byang chub la spyod pa gang yang med do //
analyzed: gang byang chub la spyod pa gang yang med do //
translated: and there is no one who practices for awakening.

original: chos de dag thams cad ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis btags par zad kyi /
analyzed: chos de dag thams cad ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis btags par zad kyi /
translated: All those dharmas are just designated by the conventional usage of the world.

original: don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not in the ultimate sense.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings, from the time when they first begin to set their thoughts on awakening,

original: byang chub kyi phyir spyod pa na sems de dang / sems can dang / byang chub dang / byang chub sems dpa' dag mi dmigs so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyir spyod pa na sems de dang / sems can dang / byang chub dang / byang chub sems dpa' dag mi dmigs so //
translated: When practicing for the sake of awakening, they do not apprehend that thought, sentient beings, awakening, or bodhisattvas.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: Subhūti, what do you think?

original: gang gi tshe rab 'byor khyod kyis 'jig tshogs la lta ba spangs pa'i phyir dbang po rnams thob bam /🔽bar chad med @173a *//
analyzed: gang gi tshe rab 'byor khyod kyis 'jig tshogs la lta ba spangs pa'i phyir dbang po rnams thob bam / bar chad med @173a *//
translated: When you, Subhūti, attained the faculties by abandoning the view of the transitory collection,

original: pa'i ting nge 'dzin tam /
analyzed: pa'i ting nge 'dzin tam /
translated: did you apprehend the uninterrupted samādhi,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob bam /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob bam /
translated: the result of stream enterer,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob bam /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob bam /
translated: the result of once-returner,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob bam /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob bam /
translated: the result of non-returner,

original: dgra bcom pa nyid thob par gyur pa de'i tshe rmi lam mam /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid thob par gyur pa de'i tshe rmi lam mam /
translated: or the state of a worthy one in a dream,

original: sems sam / lam mam /
analyzed: sems sam / lam mam /
translated: in the mind, or on the path?

original: 'bras bu dmigs snyam mam /
analyzed: 'bras bu dmigs snyam mam /
translated: Did you apprehend the result?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

original: de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma lags so //
translated: no, I did not.”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'o na ji ltar rab 'byor gyis dgra bcom pa nyid thob bo zhes shes pa brda sprad par gyur /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'o na ji ltar rab 'byor gyis dgra bcom pa nyid thob bo zhes shes pa brda sprad par gyur /
translated: “Well then, Subhūti, how did you come to understand and communicate that you attained the state of a worthy one?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Blessed One,

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du bzung ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du bzung ste /
translated: it is by taking up worldly conventions

original: shes pa brda sprad lags so //
analyzed: shes pa brda sprad lags so //
translated: that I have communicated knowledge.”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis btags pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis btags pa yin no //
translated: “Subhūti, in the same way, a bodhisattva is also designated by worldly conventions.

original: gzugs kyang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis btags pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis btags pa yin no //
translated: Form is also designated by worldly conventions.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'ang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis btags pa yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'ang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis btags pa yin no //
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are also designated by worldly conventions.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar dag kyang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis btags pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar dag kyang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis btags pa yin te /
translated: Up to the knowledge of all aspects is also designated by worldly conventions.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni chos rnams kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid nye bar bzung na byang chub la gang sogs pa'am /🔽'bri bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni chos rnams kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid nye bar bzung na byang chub la gang sogs pa'am / 'bri bar byed pa'am /
translated: When bodhisattva great beings take up the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of phenomena, they do not apprehend any phenomenon that is accumulated or diminished,🔽that is helpful or harmful,

original: phan 'dogs pa'am /🔽gnod par byed pa'i chos gang yang ma dmigs te /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa'am /🔽gnod par byed pa'i chos gang yang ma dmigs te /
translated: or that is produced or stopped,🔽or that is defiled or purified, or that increases or decreases.

original: chos rnams kyi rang bzhin de'ang @173b ma dmigs na sems dang po bskyed pa dmigs par 'gyur ba dang / sems bskyed pa bcu pa'i bar dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bar dag dmigs par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rang bzhin de'ang @173b ma dmigs na sems dang po bskyed pa dmigs par 'gyur ba dang / sems bskyed pa bcu pa'i bar dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bar dag dmigs par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: If the nature of phenomena is not apprehended, then the first generation of the mind of enlightenment would be apprehended, and so forth up to the tenth generation of the mind of enlightenment would be apprehended, and the six perfections, and so forth up to the thirty-seven factors of awakening would be apprehended.

original: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar dag dmigs par 'gyur ba lta ci smos te de ni gnas med do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar dag dmigs par 'gyur ba lta ci smos te de ni gnas med do //
translated: How much more so would the emptiness meditative stabilization, the signless meditative stabilization, the wishless meditative stabilization, and so forth up to the buddhadharmas be apprehended? That is not possible.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la spyad cing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la spyad cing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
translated: In this way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being, having practiced for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, works for the welfare of beings.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines

original: mi 'khrugs pa bstan pa'i le'u zhes bya ste bdun cu rtsa lnga pa'o ////
analyzed: mi 'khrugs pa bstan pa'i le'u zhes bya ste bdun cu rtsa lnga pa'o ////
translated: The chapter called “The Teaching of Akṣobhya,” the fifty-seventh.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord!

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
translated: If bodhisattva great beings practice the six perfections, the thirty-seven aspects of awakening, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyad cing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyad cing /
translated: and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas,

original: stong pa nyid bcu bzhi dang / byang chub kyi lam yongs su rdzogs par bgyis @174a *//
analyzed: stong pa nyid bcu bzhi dang / byang chub kyi lam yongs su rdzogs par bgyis @174a *//
translated: and if they complete the path to awakening,

original: kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i skal ba ma mchis lags na /
analyzed: kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i skal ba ma mchis lags na /
translated: but do not have the good fortune to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur lags /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur lags /
translated: how will bodhisattva great beings fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,🔽“Subhūti, it is because bodhisattva great beings have practiced the perfection of wisdom that they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rab 'byor / gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs la mkhas pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs la mkhas pas /
translated: Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom with skillful means

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing sbyin pa'ang mi dmigs /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing sbyin pa'ang mi dmigs /
translated: practice the perfection of generosity, they do not apprehend generosity,

original: sbyin bdag dang len pa po'ang mi dmigs shing /
analyzed: sbyin bdag dang len pa po'ang mi dmigs shing /
translated: they do not apprehend a giver or a recipient,

original: de las gzhan pa'i chos rnams la'ang mi spyod pa de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi lam thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i chos rnams la'ang mi spyod pa de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi lam thob par 'gyur te /
translated: and they do not practice any other phenomena. At that time, bodhisattva great beings will attain the path to awakening.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs la mkhas pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs la mkhas pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Subhūti, in that way, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom with skillful means will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po dag dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag la'ang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po dag dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag la'ang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to the five perfections up to the eighteen distinctive qualities of the buddhas.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes @174b rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes @174b rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: how do bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: ji ltar byang chub kyi lam la brtson par bgyid pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub kyi lam la brtson par bgyid pa lags /
translated: strive on the path to awakening?”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Lord said to the venerable Śāriputra:

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs la mkhas pas gzugs la sbyor bar mi byed /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs la mkhas pas gzugs la sbyor bar mi byed /
translated: here bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom, skilled in means, do not join with form,

original: 'byed par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'byed par mi byed do //
translated: nor do they divide it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: 'di ltar gzugs la gang sbyar bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs la gang sbyar bar bya ba'am /
translated: Thus, what is to be applied to form?🔽

original: dbye bar bya ba'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //🔽rnam par shes pa'i bar la'ang sbyor bar mi byed /
analyzed: dbye bar bya ba'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro // rnam par shes pa'i bar la'ang sbyor bar mi byed /
translated: Because form has no intrinsic nature that can be joined or🔽disjoined.

original: 'byed par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'byed par mi byed do //
translated: He does not join or disjoin it from feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar rnam par shes pa la gang la sbyar bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar rnam par shes pa la gang la sbyar bar bya ba'am /
translated: Why is that?🔽Because consciousness has no intrinsic nature that can be joined or

original: dbye bar bya ba'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbye bar bya ba'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: disjoined.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor bar mi byed /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor bar mi byed /
translated: He does not join the perfection of giving,

original: 'byed par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'byed par mi byed do //
translated: nor does he disjoin it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar de la gang sbyar bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar de la gang sbyar bar bya ba'am /
translated: Why is that?

original: dbye bar bya ba'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbye bar bya ba'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has no intrinsic nature that can be joined or disjoined.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag la'ang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag la'ang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to the perfection of wisdom, up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Lord,

original: gal te chos gang la'ang gang sbyar bar bgyi ba'am /
analyzed: gal te chos gang la'ang gang sbyar bar bgyi ba'am /
translated: if there is no dharma that can be joined or

original: dbye bar bgyi ba'i ngo bo nyid ma mchis lags na /
analyzed: dbye bar bgyi ba'i ngo bo nyid ma mchis lags na /
translated: “If there is no intrinsic nature to be differentiated,

original: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang la bslab par bgyi ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ji ltar mngon par 'grub @175a *//🔽par 'gyur lags /
analyzed: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang la bslab par bgyi ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ji ltar mngon par 'grub @175a *// par 'gyur lags /
translated: then how will the perfection of wisdom, in which the bodhisattva great beings should train, be accomplished?🔽Without training in the perfection of wisdom,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ma bslab par ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar rngo mi thogs lags so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ma bslab par ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar rngo mi thogs lags so //
translated: the bodhisattva great beings cannot fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sh'a ri'i bu /🔽de de bzhin te /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu / de de bzhin te /
translated: “Śāriputra!🔽It is so,

original: de de bzhin no //
analyzed: de de bzhin no //
translated: it is just as it is!

original: ji skad smras pa de bzhin te /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ma bslab par byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ma bslab par byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus te /
translated: Without training in the perfection of wisdom, the bodhisattva great beings cannot fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de'ang thabs la mkhas pas yin gyi /
analyzed: de'ang thabs la mkhas pas yin gyi /
translated: This is because of skill in means.

original: thabs la mi mkhas pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thabs la mi mkhas pas ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not because of lack of skill in means.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa chos 'ga' zhig gi rang bzhin dmigs na ni /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa chos 'ga' zhig gi rang bzhin dmigs na ni /
translated: if bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom were to apprehend the intrinsic nature of any dharma,

original: de dag 'dzin par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de dag 'dzin par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: they would grasp at them.

original: ci ste mi dmigs na go 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: ci ste mi dmigs na go 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: But since they do not apprehend anything, how could they grasp at this is the perfection of wisdom,

original: 'di ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //🔽'di ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o // 'di ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: this is the perfection of concentration,🔽this is the perfection of perseverance,

original: 'di ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: this is the perfection of patience,

original: 'di ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: this is the perfection of morality,

original: 'di ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: this is the perfection of generosity,

original: 'di ni gzugs so //
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs so //
translated: this is form,

original: 'di ni rnam par shes pa'i bar dag go /
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par shes pa'i bar dag go /
translated: up to this is consciousness,

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar dag go zhes bya bar ci zhig 'dzin par @175b 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar dag go zhes bya bar ci zhig 'dzin par @175b 'gyur te /
translated: up to this is a buddha’s qualities?

original: byang chub kyi bar dag kyang dmigs su med na de ci zhig 'dzin par 'gyur /
analyzed: byang chub kyi bar dag kyang dmigs su med na de ci zhig 'dzin par 'gyur /
translated: If even enlightenment is not apprehended, how could one apprehend anything else?

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gzung du med pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gzung du med pa ste /
translated: the perfection of wisdom is not apprehended.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar dag kyang gzung du med pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar dag kyang gzung du med pa yin no //
translated: Even the buddhadharmas are not apprehended.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni 'dzin pa med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni 'dzin pa med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: this perfection is the perfection of nonapprehension,

original: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: namely, the perfection of wisdom.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bslab par bya ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bslab par bya ste /
translated: Bodhisattva great beings should train in that.

original: de la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni slob pa'ang mi dmigs na byang chub lta ci smos /
analyzed: de la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni slob pa'ang mi dmigs na byang chub lta ci smos /
translated: Bodhisattva great beings who train in that do not apprehend training, let alone enlightenment,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lta'ang ci smos /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lta'ang ci smos /
translated: let alone the perfection of wisdom,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams lta'ang ci smos /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams lta'ang ci smos /
translated: let alone the bodhisattva dharmas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams lta'ang ci smos /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams lta'ang ci smos /
translated: let alone the buddhadharmas,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / nyan thos kyi chos rnams dang / so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams lta'ang ci smos /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / nyan thos kyi chos rnams dang / so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams lta'ang ci smos /
translated: how much more so the qualities of a pratyekabuddha, the qualities of a śrāvaka, and the qualities of an ordinary person!

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: 'di ltar chos gang la'ang ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos gang la'ang ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir te /
translated: it is because no phenomenon has any essence.

original: de la ngo bo nyid med pa'i chos thams cad la ni so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams kyang gang zhig yin /
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid med pa'i chos thams cad la ni so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams kyang gang zhig yin /
translated: In that regard, what are the qualities of an ordinary person in all phenomena that have no essence?

original: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang /
translated: What are the qualities of a stream enterer, a once-returner, a non-returner, and a worthy one, and what is a pratyekabuddha, a worthy one, a pratyekabuddha’s awakening, a bodhisattva,

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang gang zhig yin /🔽gal te gang zag de dag dmigs @176a *//
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang gang zhig yin / gal te gang zag de dag dmigs @176a *//
translated: and a perfect buddha?

original: su med na chos gang dag gis 'di ni so so'i skye bo'o //
analyzed: su med na chos gang dag gis 'di ni so so'i skye bo'o //
translated: If those persons are not apprehended, what are the qualities by which this is an ordinary person,🔽this is a stream enterer, this is a once-returner, this is a non-returner, this is a worthy one, this is a pratyekabuddha, this is a bodhisattva,🔽and this is a perfect buddha?

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bar dag gi zhes bya bar brjod pa'i chos de dag kyang 'byung bar ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bar dag gi zhes bya bar brjod pa'i chos de dag kyang 'byung bar ga la 'gyur /
translated: How could those phenomena that are described as ‘up to the tathāgatas, arhats, genuinely perfect buddhas’ come into being?

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Śāriputra replied, “Blessed One,

original: chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa la 'di ni so so'i skye bo lags so //
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa la 'di ni so so'i skye bo lags so //
translated: how could it be that all things, which are non-entities, are ordinary beings,

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bar dag lags so zhes bgyi ba gang nas 'byung zhing mchis par 'gyur lags /🔽de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bar dag lags so zhes bgyi ba gang nas 'byung zhing mchis par 'gyur lags / de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: and how could it be that they are tathāgatas, arhats, genuinely perfect buddhas?”

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: The Blessed One replied, “Śāriputra,

original: ci gzugs la ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo mngon par zhen par gyur pa lta bu'i dngos po yod par gyur tam /🔽yod par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: ci gzugs la ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo mngon par zhen par gyur pa lta bu'i dngos po yod par gyur tam /🔽yod par 'gyur ram /
translated: is there any existent thing in form that is as it is conceived by foolish, ordinary beings?🔽Is there any existent thing that will be as it is conceived by foolish, ordinary beings?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das so so'i skye bo bslad pa'i sems kyis gzugs so zhes mngon par zhen pa ma gtogs par de ni ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das so so'i skye bo bslad pa'i sems kyis gzugs so zhes mngon par zhen pa ma gtogs par de ni ma mchis lags so //
translated: He replied, “Blessed One, it is not, except for the ordinary person’s defiled mind that conceives of form and conceives of it as truly existent.”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sh'a ri'i bu /🔽ci tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo mngon par zhen par gyur pa lta bu'i dngos po yod par gyur tam /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu / ci tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo mngon par zhen par gyur pa lta bu'i dngos po yod par gyur tam /
translated: “Śāriputra,🔽is there any entity in feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness that is as the foolish ordinary beings are attached to it?

original: yod par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: yod par 'gyur ram /
translated: Is there any entity that will be as the foolish ordinary beings are attached to it?🔽”

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same way,

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: 'di ji snyam du sems /🔽sangs rgyas @176b kyi chos thams cad kyi bar dag la ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo mngon par zhen par gyur pa de lta bu'i dngos po yod par gyur tam /
analyzed: 'di ji snyam du sems / sangs rgyas @176b kyi chos thams cad kyi bar dag la ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo mngon par zhen par gyur pa de lta bu'i dngos po yod par gyur tam /
translated: what do you think?🔽Is there any entity in the perfection of giving, up to the knowledge of all aspects that is as the foolish ordinary beings are attached to it?

original: yod par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: yod par 'gyur ram /
translated: Is there any entity that will be as the foolish ordinary beings are attached to it?”🔽“Blessed One, it is not.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das so so'i skye bo bslad pa'i sems kyis rnam par shes pa'i bar dag dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi bar dag la dngos por rtog pa ma gtogs par de ni ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das so so'i skye bo bslad pa'i sems kyis rnam par shes pa'i bar dag dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi bar dag la dngos por rtog pa ma gtogs par de ni ma mchis lags so //
translated: He replied, “Blessed One, it is because ordinary beings, with their corrupted minds, conceive of all phenomena up to and including consciousness, and all the qualities of the buddhas, as real things. ”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sh'a ri'i bu /🔽de de bzhin no //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Śāriputra,🔽it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: so so'i skye bo ni bslad pa'i sems kyis dngos po med pa'i sems kyis dngos po med pa'i chos rnams la dngos por rtog ste /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo ni bslad pa'i sems kyis dngos po med pa'i sems kyis dngos po med pa'i chos rnams la dngos por rtog ste /
translated: Ordinary beings, with their corrupted minds, conceive of all phenomena, which are unreal, as real.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: Therefore, Śāriputra, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: thabs la mkhas pas chos de dag thams cad dngos po med par mthong nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la zhugs so //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pas chos de dag thams cad dngos po med par mthong nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la zhugs so //
translated: see all those phenomena as unreal through their skill in means and set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening. ”

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Śāriputra said to him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽thabs la mkhas pa gang gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis par yang dag par rjes su mthong nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / thabs la mkhas pa gang gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis par yang dag par rjes su mthong nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i
translated: “Lord,🔽what is the bodhisattva great beings’ skillful means by which, having seen all dharmas as nonentities, they set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?

original: thabs la mkhas pa de gang lags /🔽de skad ces gsol pa dang / @177a *//
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa de gang lags / de skad ces gsol pa dang / @177a *//
translated: What is that bodhisattva great beings’ skillful means?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Lord having been asked that, said to the venerable Śāriputra,

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: here bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: dngos po gang la khong khro bar 'gyur ba dang / gang la khong khro bas zhum par 'gyur ba dang / zhum nas kyang sgyid lug par 'gyur ba dang / sgyid lug nas le lor 'gyur ba'i chos kyi dngos po gang yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: dngos po gang la khong khro bar 'gyur ba dang / gang la khong khro bas zhum par 'gyur ba dang / zhum nas kyang sgyid lug par 'gyur ba dang / sgyid lug nas le lor 'gyur ba'i chos kyi dngos po gang yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: He does not see any dharma at all that would become angry, or that would become depressed through anger, or that would become lazy through depression, or that would become careless through laziness.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: 'di ltar sems can bdag tu rmongs pa dag phung po rnams zhes bya ba'am /🔽khams rnams zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can bdag tu rmongs pa dag phung po rnams zhes bya ba'am / khams rnams zhes bya ba'am /
translated: it is like this: except for the delusion of a self in sentient beings,

original: skye mched rnams zhes bya bar mngon par zhen pa ma gtogs par chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa dang / srog med pa dang / srog dang bral pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis stong pa dang /
analyzed: skye mched rnams zhes bya bar mngon par zhen pa ma gtogs par chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa dang / srog med pa dang / srog dang bral pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis stong pa dang /
translated: all dharmas are not things, are without life, are free from life, are the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, are empty of their own inherent nature,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid yin te /
translated: and are empty of their own characteristics.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: Therefore, Śāriputra, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis stong pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid du yang dag par rjes su mthong nas lus sgyu ma mkhan lta bur byin gyis brlabs shing /
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis stong pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid du yang dag par rjes su mthong nas lus sgyu ma mkhan lta bur byin gyis brlabs shing /
translated: They see all phenomena as having the nature of non-entityness, as being empty by nature, and as being empty of their own marks.

original: sems can rnams la chos ston par byed de /
analyzed: sems can rnams la chos ston par byed de /
translated: They bless their bodies to be like those of illusionists and teach the Dharma to sentient beings.

original: sems can gang dag ser sna dang ldan pa de dag la ni sbyin @177b pa'i gtam byed do //
analyzed: sems can gang dag ser sna dang ldan pa de dag la ni sbyin @177b pa'i gtam byed do //
translated: To those sentient beings who are stingy, they give discourses on generosity.

original: sems can tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams la ni tshul khrims kyi gtam byed do //
analyzed: sems can tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams la ni tshul khrims kyi gtam byed do //
translated: To those sentient beings who have faulty discipline, they give discourses on discipline.

original: sems can gnod sems kyi sems dang ldan pa rnams la ni bzod pa'i gtam byed do //
analyzed: sems can gnod sems kyi sems dang ldan pa rnams la ni bzod pa'i gtam byed do //
translated: To those sentient beings who have a mind of malice, they give discourses on patience.

original: sems can le lo can rnams la ni brtson 'grus kyi gtam byed do //
analyzed: sems can le lo can rnams la ni brtson 'grus kyi gtam byed do //
translated: To those sentient beings who are lazy, they give discourses on perseverance.

original: sems can sems rnam par g-yengs pa rnams la ni ting nge 'dzin gyi gtam byed do //
analyzed: sems can sems rnam par g-yengs pa rnams la ni ting nge 'dzin gyi gtam byed do //
translated: To those sentient beings whose minds are distracted, they give discourses on concentration.

original: sems can shes rab 'chal pa rnams la ni shes rab kyi gtam byed do //
analyzed: sems can shes rab 'chal pa rnams la ni shes rab kyi gtam byed do //
translated: To those sentient beings who have faulty wisdom, they give discourses on wisdom.

original: des gang gi tshe sems can rnams spyin pa la bkod par gyur pa dang / shes rab kyi bar la bkod par gyur pa de'i tshe sems can de dag la gtam gang gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ba dang / dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar dag thob par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: des gang gi tshe sems can rnams spyin pa la bkod par gyur pa dang / shes rab kyi bar la bkod par gyur pa de'i tshe sems can de dag la gtam gang gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ba dang / dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar dag thob par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: When they have established sentient beings in generosity and so on up to wisdom, then they also give them the noble and definitive discourses that will cause them to attain the fruit of stream enterer and so on up to the state of a worthy one,

original: rang byang chub thob par 'gyur ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar dag thob par 'gyur ba'i gtam 'phags shing nges par 'byin pa dag kyang byed do //
analyzed: rang byang chub thob par 'gyur ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar dag thob par 'gyur ba'i gtam 'phags shing nges par 'byin pa dag kyang byed do //
translated: the state of a pratyekabuddha, and so on up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then venerable Śāriputra inquired of the Lord,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa gang gis sems can ma mchis shing mchis pa ma lags pa dag sbyin pa la rab tu 'god par bgyid cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa gang gis sems can ma mchis shing mchis pa ma lags pa dag sbyin pa la rab tu 'god par bgyid cing /
translated: how do bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom establish sentient beings who do not exist and are not existent in generosity,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar dag la rab tu 'god par bgyid kyi steng du /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar dag la rab tu 'god par bgyid kyi steng du /
translated: and up to the perfection of wisdom.

original: bka' @178a *// mchid gang gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'thob pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar dag 'thob par 'gyur ba'i bka' mchid 'phags shing nges par 'byin pa dag bgyid na /
analyzed: bka' @178a *// mchid gang gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'thob pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar dag 'thob par 'gyur ba'i bka' mchid 'phags shing nges par 'byin pa dag bgyid na /
translated: And if they give them advice that is noble and liberating, by which they attain the fruit of stream enterer, and up to attain the knowledge of all aspects,

original: ji ltar dmigs pa ma mchis par 'gyur lags /
analyzed: ji ltar dmigs pa ma mchis par 'gyur lags /
translated: how is it that they have no reference?

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Lord replied to the venerable Śāriputra:

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra!

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa la ni dmigs pa 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa la ni dmigs pa 'ga' yang med do //
translated: For bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom there is no reference at all.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa des ni kun rdzob kyi brda tha snyad 'dogs pa ma gtogs par sems can gang yang mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa des ni kun rdzob kyi brda tha snyad 'dogs pa ma gtogs par sems can gang yang mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, Śāriputra, the bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom do not apprehend any sentient beings at all, except for the conventional designation of conventional expressions.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni bden pa gnyis la gnas te /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni bden pa gnyis la gnas te /
translated: the bodhisattva great beings, standing in the two truths,

original: sems can rnams la chos ston par byed kyang /
analyzed: sems can rnams la chos ston par byed kyang /
translated: teach the Dharma to sentient beings.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: bden pa gnyis po dag la ni sems can dmigs pa'ang med /
analyzed: bden pa gnyis po dag la ni sems can dmigs pa'ang med /
translated: in the two truths, sentient beings are not apprehended,

original: sems can du gdags pa'ang med mod kyi /
analyzed: sems can du gdags pa'ang med mod kyi /
translated: and there is no designation of sentient beings.

original: 'on kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs la mkhas pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa sems can rnams la chos ston cing /
analyzed: 'on kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs la mkhas pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa sems can rnams la chos ston cing /
translated: Nevertheless, the bodhisattva great beings skilled in means, practicing the perfection of wisdom, teach the Dharma to sentient beings.

original: des sems can de dag kyang tshe 'di nyid la bdag tu'ang mi dmigs na gang 'thob @178b par 'gyur ba dang / gang gis thob par 'gyur ba dag lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: des sems can de dag kyang tshe 'di nyid la bdag tu'ang mi dmigs na gang 'thob @178b par 'gyur ba dang / gang gis thob par 'gyur ba dag lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: And those sentient beings, in this very life, do not even apprehend a self, so what need is there to mention that they will attain or that they will attain through that?

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni de ltar thabs la mkhas pas sems can rnams la chos ston par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni de ltar thabs la mkhas pas sems can rnams la chos ston par byed do //
translated: bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom teach the Dharma to sentient beings in that way with skillful means.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Śāriputra said to him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: aa la la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: aa la la 'di lta ste /
translated: how wonderful!

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos gang yang gcig pa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos gang yang gcig pa'am /
translated: Bodhisattva great beings do not apprehend any dharma as the same or

original: tha dad pa'am /🔽so so bar yang mi dmigs la /
analyzed: tha dad pa'am / so so bar yang mi dmigs la /
translated: different or🔽separate,

original: go cha gang 'tshal bas 'dod pa'i khams na'ang mi gda'/
analyzed: go cha gang 'tshal bas 'dod pa'i khams na'ang mi gda'/
translated: and they do not apprehend the armor that they have donned in the desire realm,

original: gzugs kyi khams na'ang mi gda'/
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na'ang mi gda'/
translated: in the form realm,🔽or

original: gzugs ma mchis pa'i khams na'ang mi gda'/🔽'dus byas kyi khams na'ang mi gda'/
analyzed: gzugs ma mchis pa'i khams na'ang mi gda'/ 'dus byas kyi khams na'ang mi gda'/
translated: It is not in the formless realm.🔽It is not in the conditioned realm.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi khams na'ang mi gda' la /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi khams na'ang mi gda' la /
translated: It is not in the unconditioned realm.

original: sems can rnams khams gsum nas yongs su thar bar bgyid kyang sems can dang / sems can du gdags pa'ang mi dmigs pa de lta bu'i go cha 'tshal ba de ni /
analyzed: sems can rnams khams gsum nas yongs su thar bar bgyid kyang sems can dang / sems can du gdags pa'ang mi dmigs pa de lta bu'i go cha 'tshal ba de ni /
translated: Although they liberate sentient beings from the three realms, they do not observe sentient beings or the designation of sentient beings.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: spro ba che ba lags so //
analyzed: spro ba che ba lags so //
translated: such an undertaking is truly magnificent.

original: sems can du gdags pa ma mchis pas sems can ma bcings ma grol la; sems can ma bcings ma grol bas /
analyzed: sems can du gdags pa ma mchis pas sems can ma bcings ma grol la; sems can ma bcings ma grol bas /
translated: Since there is no designation of sentient beings, sentient beings are neither bound nor liberated.🔽Since sentient beings are neither bound nor liberated,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ma mchis shing /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ma mchis shing /
translated: there is no affliction and

original: rnam par byang ba ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba ma mchis lags so //
translated: no purification.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ma mchis la /🔽rnam par byang @179a *//
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ma mchis la / rnam par byang @179a *//
translated: Since there is no affliction

original: pa ma mchis pas 'gro ba'i bye brag kyang ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: pa ma mchis pas 'gro ba'i bye brag kyang ma mchis lags so //
translated: and no purification, there are no different kinds of beings.

original: 'gro ba'i bye brag ma mchis pa la ni las kyang ma mchis /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bye brag ma mchis pa la ni las kyang ma mchis /
translated: Since there are no different kinds of beings, there is no karma

original: nyon mongs pa rnams kyang ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams kyang ma mchis lags so //
translated: and no afflictions.

original: las ma mchis shing nyon mongs pa ma mchis pa la ni rnam par smin pa gang gis bdag gam /
analyzed: las ma mchis shing nyon mongs pa ma mchis pa la ni rnam par smin pa gang gis bdag gam /
translated: For one who has no karma and no afflictions, what would ripen?

original: sems can dag 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba na gda' bar 'gyur ba'i rnam par smin pa mchis par yang ga la 'gyur lags /
analyzed: sems can dag 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba na gda' bar 'gyur ba'i rnam par smin pa mchis par yang ga la 'gyur lags /
translated: How could there be any ripening of karma and afflictions for one who has no karma and no afflictions, by which self or sentient beings would appear in the five destinies of saṃsāra?”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One said to the venerable Śāriputra,

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: de de bzhin te /🔽de de bzhin no //
analyzed: de de bzhin te / de de bzhin no //
translated: it is so,

original: ji skad smras pa bzhin te /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa bzhin te /
translated: it is just as you have said.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: gal te sems can zhig sngon yod par gyur la /
analyzed: gal te sems can zhig sngon yod par gyur la /
translated: if sentient beings existed before and later did not exist,

original: phyis med par gyur na ni de'i phyir de ltar sngon yod par gyur la /
analyzed: phyis med par gyur na ni de'i phyir de ltar sngon yod par gyur la /
translated: then it would be like this: ‘Before they existed, but later they will not exist.’

original: phyis med par 'gyur ro zhes byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la'ang skyon du 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: phyis med par 'gyur ro zhes byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la'ang skyon du 'gyur zhing /
translated: This would be a fault of the bodhisattvas and the Tathāgata,

original: 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba'ang sngon dngos po yod par gyur la /
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba'ang sngon dngos po yod par gyur la /
translated: and the five destinies of saṃsāra would have existed before as real things,🔽but later would not exist.

original: phyis dngos po med par gyur na /
analyzed: phyis dngos po med par gyur na /
translated: Later, when it becomes nonexistent,

original: de'ang skyon du 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de'ang skyon du 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: that would be a problem.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
translated: whether the tathāgatas appear

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste /
translated: or whether the tathāgatas do not appear,

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid dang / de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid 'di ni gnas pa ste /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid dang / de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid 'di ni gnas pa ste /
translated: the true nature of phenomena, the way things are, and the unmistaken way things are remain.

original: de la bdag kyang med /
analyzed: de la bdag kyang med /
translated: In that, there is no self,

original: sems can yang med /
analyzed: sems can yang med /
translated: no sentient being,

original: srog kyang med /🔽@179b gang zag kyang med /
analyzed: srog kyang med / @179b gang zag kyang med /
translated: no life-force,🔽no person,🔽no agent,

original: byed pa po'ang med /🔽byed du 'jug pa po'ang med na /
analyzed: byed pa po'ang med / byed du 'jug pa po'ang med na /
translated: and no instigator.

original: de la gzugs ga la yod /
analyzed: de la gzugs ga la yod /
translated: How can there be form in that?

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams lta'ang ga la yod /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams lta'ang ga la yod /
translated: How can there be feeling, perception, and volitional factors in that?

original: rnam par shes pa lta'ang ga la yod de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa lta'ang ga la yod de /
translated: How can there be consciousness in that?

original: med cing yod pa ma yin pa'i chos de dag la gang las sems can rnams yongs su thar bar bya ba'i 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba lta'ang yod par ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: med cing yod pa ma yin pa'i chos de dag la gang las sems can rnams yongs su thar bar bya ba'i 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba lta'ang yod par ga la 'gyur te /
translated: How can there be the five realms of saṃsāra from which sentient beings are to be liberated in those nonexistent and unreal phenomena?

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de'i phyir chos 'di dag ni de ltar rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos 'di dag ni de ltar rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, these phenomena are empty of their own intrinsic reality.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams las thos nas /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams las thos nas /
translated: “In this regard, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas, having heard from the tathāgatas, the arhats, the perfectly enlightened buddhas of the past,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la zhugs te /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la zhugs te /
translated: set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: gang la byis pa so so'i skye bo phyin ci log gis rmongs par gyur pa rnams mngon par zhen pa ma gtogs par gang la mos par nus pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid gang yang dmigs su med do //
analyzed: gang la byis pa so so'i skye bo phyin ci log gis rmongs par gyur pa rnams mngon par zhen pa ma gtogs par gang la mos par nus pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid gang yang dmigs su med do //
translated: Apart from the attachment of foolish, ordinary beings who are confused by error, no intrinsic reality of phenomena can be apprehended at all, in which they might believe.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de ltar go cha gang la bgos pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa dang / bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya bar mi bya'i /🔽bdag gis ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o snyam pa dang / mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang don gang gis sems can @180a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de ltar go cha gang la bgos pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa dang / bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya bar mi bya'i / bdag gis ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o snyam pa dang / mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang don gang gis sems can @180a *//
translated: ‘I must not fail to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rnams phyin ci log las yongs su thar bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos kyis sems can rnams kyi don bya'o zhes de lta bu'i go cha bgos pa yin no //
analyzed: rnams phyin ci log las yongs su thar bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos kyis sems can rnams kyi don bya'o zhes de lta bu'i go cha bgos pa yin no //
translated: Having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, I must benefit sentient beings with the Dharma in such a way that they will be completely freed from error.’

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: dper na / sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i mi zhig gis srog chags bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag mang po dag cig sprul nas /
analyzed: dper na / sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i mi zhig gis srog chags bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag mang po dag cig sprul nas /
translated: For example, a magician conjures up many hundreds of thousands of living beings,

original: de sprul pa de dag la bza' ba dang / bca' ba nyams su bsod pa mang po dag stobs shing tshim par byed de /
analyzed: de sprul pa de dag la bza' ba dang / bca' ba nyams su bsod pa mang po dag stobs shing tshim par byed de /
translated: and then conjures up much delicious food and drink and satisfies them with it.

original: bstabs shing tshim par byas nas kyang /🔽bdag gis ni bsod nams mang du spel to //
analyzed: bstabs shing tshim par byas nas kyang / bdag gis ni bsod nams mang du spel to //
translated: Having satisfied them,🔽he says, ‘I have increased much merit!

original: bdag gis ni bsod nams mang du spel to zhes ched du brjod pa ched du brjod par byed na /🔽sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: bdag gis ni bsod nams mang du spel to zhes ched du brjod pa ched du brjod par byed na / sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: I have increased much merit!’

original: 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: What do you think of this, Śāriputra?

original: de la bstabs shing tshim par byas pa gang yang yod snyam mam /
analyzed: de la bstabs shing tshim par byas pa gang yang yod snyam mam /
translated: Is there any giving, any gift, or anyone who is satisfied?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
translated: He replied, “No, Blessed One, there is not.”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: in the same way, from the first production of the thought of awakening,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi la spyod pa dang / tshad med pa bzhi la spyod pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi la spyod pa dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi la spyod pa dang /🔽yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam @180b yan lag brgyad pa la spyod pa dang / stong pa nyid bcu bzhi dang /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi la spyod pa dang / tshad med pa bzhi la spyod pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi la spyod pa dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi la spyod pa dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam @180b yan lag brgyad pa la spyod pa dang / stong pa nyid bcu bzhi dang /
translated: They practice the six perfections, the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, and the four establishments of mindfulness.🔽They practice the four right efforts, the four legs of miraculous power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven branches of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path, and the fourteen emptinesses,

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyod cing /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyod cing /
translated: the concentration of signlessness, and the concentration of wishlessness, and the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.
